loans.name: Mary Joy's Group

texts.en:
Mary Joy A. is from the village of Brgy.Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 24 years old. Mary Joy is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling pork and chicken barbeque. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia L. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Sari-sari (general) store and livestock businesses. She lives in Media Once, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP16,000. Rosalia is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she  can  purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.

 Rosalia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

La señora Jessica es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que fue ella una de las personas que propuso crear este Banco, le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la institución a las socias que como ella realizan los créditos. Tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años, la mayor esta en escuela, el marido trabaja en albañilería.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo de marcas nacionales y colombianas. También vende productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días por las tardes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella visita a sus clientes, les enseña la revista para que ellos vean que es lo que desean comprar, luego ella realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar más de su mercadería como pantalones, camisetas, blusas, y productos de Yanbal y Avon. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén y ser profesora ya que le encanta enseñar.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Marianita de Jesús' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Jessica is a founding member of her community bank and she tells us that she was one of the people who suggested the bank be founded.  She likes the bank for the help that our institution provides to its members who take loans like she does.  Jessica is 24 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 7 and 4.  Her eldest is in elementary school.  Her husband works as a construction worker.

Jessica is a saleswoman.  She sells national and Colombian clothes through a catalog.  She also sells Yanbal and Avon products (beauty pr4oducts, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every afternoon, selling door to door.  She visits her customers and shows them her catalogs so that they can see what they would like to buy.  She then makes her orders and delivers her products.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as pants, t-shirts, blouses and Yanbal and Avon products.  Jessica's dreams are to own her own store and to be a teacher since she loves to teach.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and Yanbal and Avon products

loans.name: Piedras De Oro Group

texts.es: Maria Cristina I. Q., D. veintidós años D. edad, es una señorita, que apoya económicamente a su familia para que sus padres puedan darle un mejor futuro a sus cuatro hermanitos pequeños,  ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa que ella  ha podido  mantener esta actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. cuatro años, ella venD. en varios municipios y en los días D. plaza del pueblo para mejorar sus venta y tener más clientes, necesita surtir su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, D. esa manera pueda obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace mas D. ocho años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su comunidad, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. mochilas,  venta D. mercería, entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina I. Q. is 22 years old and supports her family financially so that her parents can give her four younger siblings a better future.  She has sold clothing for more than four years.  She sells in many towns and in the town square on market days to improve her sales and have more customers.  She needs to add merchandise to her store to improve sales and earn more money.  

She gathered some friends and neighbors that she has known for more than eight years to form this group, which will support not only her family, but the people of her community.  Each of the woman work in different areas, such as: fruit sales, raising animals, making backpacks, selling notions, and others.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is from the village of Nuesa. She is 35 years old. Rosemarie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Guddu

texts.en:
Guddu lives in a small city called Kasur, which is located in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She is a 53-year-old lady, and the mother of three daughters who are all illiterate and do labor work. They couldn’t get an education and had to start working at an early age due to the death of their father. Their father was the only breadwinner of the family, and after his death they had no financial resources available.
 
Guddu started a business of selling animals after the death of her husband. She purchases animals from the animal markets and raises them up to sell to butchers for a profit. The earned income helps her to put three meals a day on the table for her family.   

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her animals sales business. With the loan she will buy goats and buffalo and raise them up for selling. She is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her business and will increase her household income as a result. She also has a plan to collect some dowry for her elder daughter’s marriage with the help of increased profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats & buffalo) for animal sales business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 13 years. She is 58 years old, married to Dedan Ndungu and they have three children. Irene was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all the previous loans well and in good time. Irene plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer for planting. In the future, Irene hopes to improve her farming and become the top farmer in the town.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in Faisalabad, which is Pakistan’s 3rd largest city and famous for its textile industry. She is 51 years old and married to D.. Her home is located in the area of Ghafary town and contains 2 rooms. She moved here 13 years ago. 
Her husband has a business making and selling furniture. He is very good at his art and makes quality furniture. He operates his shop in the market and displays his furniture to sell there. 
Bilqees is a house wife. She does her job very well as a wife and mother. She has a daughter and 2 sons.  Her sons left their education and started work to support the family financially. Her eldest son works with his father at his shop and is learning the art of making furniture, while her younger son is a painter by profession and paints houses and walls. Her daughter is studying in 5th grade. 

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a woodcutting machine and wood in large quantity to make more furniture and sell for extra profit.  Bilqees is hopeful that, by investing loan money in her husband’s business, his income will definitely grow as a result of increasing sales. 
She is a regular user of Asasah, and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy a woodcutting machine and wood for furniture business

loans.name: Nyorita

texts.en:
Nyorita, 45, is a mother of two children, aged eighteen and nine, who both attend school. She has been doing mixed farming in her hometown of Nyamira in Western Kenya for the last ten years. Her produce of maize and beans are sold to the local market. She has employed three farmhands. She earns additional income from the selling of domestic animals, especially goats.  

Nyorita has requested this loan of 45,000Kes from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes the dairy cow will generate enough income to educate her children and expand her farm to five dairy cows.  That will eventually make her a major supplier of milk in the region. She faces the challenge of low production during dry weather but is optimistic about growth in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Azbayar

texts.en:
Azbayar is 32 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone else's backyard. Her husband helps her with the business. 

She began operating her own business in 2005. She imports leather gloves and glasses from China and sells them at her rented stall at the market. She pays 60,000 MNT for rent on the stall. Her average daily income is 40,000 to 60,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, "We want to increase our profit and build a house where we can have a comfortable life."  She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more leather gloves and other consumer goods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more leather gloves for resale.

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in their own house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a teacher at a secondary school while his two sons, who are 2 and 5 years old, go to kindergarten. 

Enhbaatar manages a used clothing trading business out of a rented stall in a local market. He started his business in 2005 with the working capital of 500,000 MNT. His business was quite successful, and that enabled him to increase his working capital to 2,300,000 MNT.  

Sometimes he exchanges his products for dairy products traded by herdsmen. This barter-trading made his business as comfortable as possible for the herdsmen. Enhbaatar is very honest man who wants to own his clothing factory someday. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more used clothing for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Esmeralda; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de realizar servicio de llamadas, ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria en el paradero de los carros que salen a la ciudad de Cusco del lugar de Andahuaylillas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un negocio de venta de caldos de la carne de cordero. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne, fideos y arroz para hacer los caldos.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Esmeralda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) which is in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old, single, and has one child. Esmeralda divides her time between her daily activities and her business of providing calling services. She works as a street merchant at a bus station where vehicles from the city of Cusco arrive in Andahuaylillas. Esmeralda works from 7am to 6pm. She wants to start a business selling lamb stew, so she is requesting a loan to buy meat, noodles, and rice for making the stews.

Esmeralda is happy with this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase meat, noodles, and rice for making stews.

loans.name: Moserrate Aracely

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

La señora Monserrate es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace 9 años y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy ordenadas y cumplidas. Tiene 56 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene  4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos que es soltero aun viven con ella, en la actualidad también está viviendo con su hija que está separada del marido, junto a sus dos hijos pequeños.

Ella es una mujer muy preparada, tiene un titulo de Ing. Civil pero también es comerciante, vende productos de las marcas Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), produntos Herbalive (productos naturales) y además está construyendo unas casas en convenio con el Miduvi (casa que da el estado a personas de bajos recursos). Ella trabaja todos los días y las ventas las realiza en su tiempo libre, tiene un local en su casa y otro en  la ciudad de Portoviejo que atiende su hijo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más sus negocios, va a comprar productos naturales Herbalive y cosméticos Yanbal.

Sus sueños son tener salud y fuerzas para seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Unión y Solidaridad' (Union and Solidarity) community bank meet in San Pablo parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí and has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees for many years.

Monserrate is a founding member of her community bank.  She has been a member for nine years and she enjoys it because her fellow group members are all very organized and punctual.  Monserrate is 56 years old.  She is separated but has four grown-up children from that relationship.  One of her children is single and still lives with her.  She is currently also living with her daughter, who is separated from her husband, and her two small children.

Monserrate is a very educated woman.  She has a degree in civil engineering but she is also a saleswoman.  She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) and Herbalife products (natural products).  She is also building some houses in association with Miduvi (Ecuador's Ministry of Urban Development and Housing).  These are houses that the State provides to people of limited economic resources.

Monserrate works every day and makes her sales in her spare time.  She has a sales location in her home and another in the city of Portoviejo which her son runs.

Monserrate will use this loan to further stock her businesses.  She will buy Herbalife natural products and Yanbal cosmetics.  Her dreams are to enjoy good health and the strength to continue helping her children.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife natural products and Yanbal cosmetics

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik is 28 years old and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10. Malik’s spouse is a housewife and he lives with his family of 5 in his own home. His family goal is to build more houses and his home address is Hoima, Uganda. 

For ten years this hardworking father has been operating a business of art and design. He started by making paper stamps and later diversified to T-shirt making. He faces a challenge of clients not paying on time. He hopes in future to capture a wider market in order to be able to add more art items to his business. Malik needs a loan to purchase T-shirts and printing chemicals.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts and chemicals for his art shop.

loans.name: Noemi Yanira

texts.es:
Noemí, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 18 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de meriendas desde hace dos años y su cuñada le ayuda en el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para la preparación de las meriendas como pollo, carnes, arroz, verduras, aceite y condimentos, con este le ayudara al negocio fortaleciendo el inventario y atendiendo la demanda.
Su objetivo, tener el negocio en optimas condiciones y al mismo tiempo ayudar a sus hijos para que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Noemí lives with her husband and two children aged 13 and 18.  For two years she has run a business selling snacks.  Her sister-in-law helps her in the business.

Noemí is requesting a loan to buy materials with which to prepare her snacks such as chicken, meat, rice, vegetables, oil and condiments.  This will help her business as she will be able to strengthen her inventory and meet demand.

Noemí's goal is to have her business in optimum conditions and, at the same time, help her children to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, vegetables, oil and condiments

loans.name: Andrea Josefina

texts.es: Andrea Josefina de 33 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos Ricardo, Mauricio y Carlos en su casa. Ella trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando y ella sueña con verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales. Es por esta razón que se concentra en su trabajo y se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de ella en la realización del mismo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza como desinfectantes y detergentes que con mucha amabilidad comercializa de manera ambulante en la zona donde reside. Cuenta con mucha clientela y todos los vecinos la conocen y confían tanto en ella como en sus productos. Para ella lo más importante es ver a su familia en mejores condiciones y sabe que la única forma de lograrlo es trabajando duramente, es por eso que ha decidido ampliar su negocio y para esto necesita de un préstamo ya que no le es posible hacerlo con fondos propios, razón por la cual  solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para poder comprar variedad de desinfectantes y detergentes y así poder cubrir a una demanda más grande. De esta manera espera lograr cumplir su sueño  y dar a sus hijos lo que se merecen.
texts.en: Andrea Josefina is 33 years old, she lives with her three children Ricardo, Mauricio and Carlos.  She works hard to get them ahead while they go to school, she dreams with seeing them become great professionals.  For this reason she focuses on work and tries to give the best of herself for its success.  She sells cleaning products such as disinfectants and detergent, she provides friendly customer service selling in the same area where she lives.  She has a lot of clients and neighbors that know her and trust her with her products.  To her the most important thing is to see her family in better conditions and she knows the only way to achieve it is through daily hard work, this is why she has decided to expand her business and needs a loan to do it because her own financial resources are not sufficient,  she requests a loan to "integral" to buy a variety of disinfectant and detergent products to supply a higher demand.  This way she hopes to achieve her dream and give her kids what they deserve.

loans.use: to buy a variety of disinfectants and detergents to supply a growing demand for products in her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a resident and farmer in Kisii area of South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for six years, employing one farmhand and producing tomatoes, maize, trees and potatoes. He is married with three children and works as an electrician for additional income.

Patrick has made a loan request of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to plough his horticultural land and buy horticultural seeds.This is Patrick's fourth loan with Juhudi Kilimo. He adds that the productivity of his farm will go up and help his family with their daily meals. He wants to buy a vehicle in future to venture into transport.

Patrick complains of poor market prices for his produce.

loans.use: to plough his horticultural farm and purchase seeds.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson, tiene la edad de 21 años, está soltero, y el vive con su madre. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de maquinas para un lava car.  El quiere montar o establecer un lava car para satisfacer las necesidades de personas que necesitan el servicio. El quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar propio y seguir dándole el sustento diario a su mamá. El piensa en su futuro y quiere tener ingresos desde joven para guardar para asegurar su futuro.  Es el primero  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Wilson is 21 years old and single, living with his mother.  Wilson is requesting a loan to purchase the machinery for a car wash.  He would like to establish this business to meet the needs of people who want this service.  He wants to generate income to improve his own quality of life, as well as help support his mother.    Wilson thinks about his future and wants to start generating income from a young age, so that he can save and help secure his future.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.   He hasn't had other loans prior with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has made the loan with better services and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase basic machinery for a car wash

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bars for her windows.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad,  vive con sus hijos menores de edad en casa de unos familiares, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola y ganadera de sus pobladores.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa para todas las edades, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace algunos años, pero también compra mercadería a pedido, también da a crédito o al contado a sus clientes, cobra cada fin de mes, tratando de brindarles facilidades a sus clientes, al contar con mayor demanda de clientes, sus ingresos aumentarán para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar Rosa que su negocio cada día va creciendo a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para la época de invierno y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela esté satisfecha para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a mother, and is 42 years old.  She lives with her children in the home of some relatives; they have running water and electricity.  The house is located in the district of Guadalupe, which is part of the department of La Libertad.  This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock and its people.

Rosa works selling clothes for all ages. She has run her business from her home for the last several years, but also buys merchandise on order.  She also offers credit or cash purchase to her clients and collects payment at the end of each month.  She is trying to provide facilities for her customers so as to have greater customer demand.  This will increase her income to cover her family's expenses.

On observing that her business was growing on a daily basis, Rosa felt it necessary to request a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan will buy a greater quantity of merchandise for the winter season, and stock up her store with innovative products.  Her goal for this is that her customers are satisfied, and that she can pay back her loan and improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quality of merchandise.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Merlyn has a retail shop from which she sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI III  est un groupe  de femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, préfecture de BLA région de SÉGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe BENKADI  III  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
RAMATOU A., debout au milieu avec une écharpe bleue,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI III comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI III is a group of married women who come from the village of Sangoula, located in the sub-prefecture of Bla, an administrative subdivision of the Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional households. They have an average age of 43, 6 children to raise and they grow rice, groundnuts and okra. In order to make their farms profitable and increase the amount of cultivatable land and therefore production, the members of the BENKADI III group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and this year are requesting their first farming loan.
Ramatou A., standing in the middle of the picture and wearing the blue scarf, will use the loan to buy good quality seeds, small equipment and farm inputs (e.g. fertilizer, pesticide) at the Grand Market in Bla. After the rainy season, the harvested produce will be stored for a certain period of time so that it can gain in value before being sold at the markets of Bla, Yangasso and surrounding towns. It is often sold in bulk and mostly for cash to customers from large towns.
The members of the BENKADI III group are hoping to realize an average profit of 45 000 francs each after selling their produce, and will use those profits to pay off their loan interest and cover their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from knitting and food vending. Arlyn requested a 19,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. Arlyn hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es socio del Banco Comunal Paloma,tiene 27 años y 6 hijos.
En Matara Oscar tiene un fundo donde tiene 6 vacas lecheras, y produce queso, Oscar siempre tuvo el alquiler de este fundo pero ahora él desea poder comprar el fundo, recuerda que antes no tenía mucho, con la ayuda de los préstamos que ha recibido ha podido incrementar el número de vacas lecheras, le encanta las capacitaciones y el ahorro le ayuda a poder trazarse metas y cumplirlas. Con el préstamo que solicita se comprará una vaca lechera y su meta es poder comprarse el fundo.
texts.en:
Oscar is a member of the 'Paloma' (Dove) community bank.  He is 27 years old and has six children.

Oscar has a farm in Matara where he has six dairy cows and produces cheese.  Oscar has always rented this farm but now he would like to be able to buy it.  He recalls that, in the past, he didn't have much.  With the help of the loans that he has received, he has been able to increase his number of dairy cows.  He loves the training sessions and the savings help him to be able to set goals and accomplish them.  Oscar will use the loan that he is requesting to buy a dairy cow.  His goal is to buy his farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Saidchafar

texts.ru: Саидчафар житель района Шахритус. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сам Саидчафар зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Saidchafar lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 45 years old, married and has six children.  His son is working in the Russian Federation.  Saidchafar earns a living by breeding cattle and small livestock.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.   He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widow with three school-going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Luvuno has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of theft.  She dreams of establishing a retail shop.

With this loan for Kshs 30,000, Luvuno wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it has very few legal requirements to join.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Juana Feliciana

texts.es:
Doña Juana  tiene su negocio de venta de carne de cerdo y de res en su casa de habitación, tiene diez años de tener el negocio y esa actividad ella trabaja con su marido quien se encarga del destace del cerdo. 
Doña Juana visita las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para invertir en su negocio. Ella es casada y madre de familia de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en el colegio.
El préstamo lo va ha invertir en compra de tres cerdo para engorde y después destazarlo.
Da gracias a Ceprodel por brindarles la oportunidad ya que gracias a los financiamientos su negocio ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juana has her business selling pork and beef in her home.  She has had the business for ten years, and she works with her husband, who is responsible for butchering the pig.

Juana is visiting the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan to invest in her business.  She is married and the mother of a family of two children who are in school.

She is going to invest the loan in buying three pigs to fatten and then quarter.

She thanks CEPRODEL for giving them the opportunity, since thanks to the loans her business has been able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 23-year-old married lady who has a son and a daughter. Since they are still a young, small family, Hanadi decided to start a small retail business at home selling clothes. 
Now Hanadi has applied for a loan to buy more clothes at wholesale prices. She hopes to start a distribution business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Dialicounda Kawral/ Sabougnima 01 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnima 01 est créé le 12 Octobre 2010 à l’inauguration du Banc Villageois Dialicounda Kawral. Il est composé de six femmes qui habitent le même village.

Madame Mariama  (en médaillon en bas à l’extrême droit) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants. 

Elle vend du poisson fumé, elle importe des pays frontaliers  vers les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de son activité pour l’avoir  pratiquée pendant plusieurs années.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en poisson fumé pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son marie dans la prise en charge scolaire et alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnima 01 was founded on October 12, 2010 with the inauguration of the Banc Villageois Dialicounda Kawral. The group consists of 6 women who live in the same village. 

Mariama (inset at the bottom right corner) is in charge the group. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells smoked fish, which she imports from neighboring countries and brings to the weekly markets in her village. She has a good command of her work as she has been doing it for many years. 

This new loan will allow her to buy and resell smoked fish. The profits will allow her to help her husband with their family's school and food expenses.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a clothes sewing expert. She knows about the latest trends in fashion and can prepare beautiful looking clothes. She charges 150 PKR for a simple dress and 200 PKR for a designer dress. Her husband makes shoes. He is an expert in his field of work and receives a good number of orders every month.

Sakina is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.

Sakina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further expand her husband's shoemaking business. With the loan investment, he will buy shoelaces and leather in large quantities, which will help him to complete orders on time and to increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past many years, and Sakina is hopeful that after investment, it will grow further.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding the book, Asasah Passbook, is Sakina.

loans.use: to buy shoelaces and leather to expand her husband's shoemaking business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Con su nuevo credikiva Gloria surtirá su tienda, con la mercancia de mas salida comoercial para el fin del año, como bebidas, refrecos y abarrotes principalemente. Ella está muy satisfecha porque con su credikiva adecuó el piso y la cubierta de su terraza locativa,  donde hoy ofrece un ambiente confortable a sus clientes. Su mensaje para los financiadores es el siguiente: " Austedes les agradezco mucho su ayuda y espero que sigan ayudando para que mi negocio sea mas grande y próspero. "
texts.en:
Gloria will use her new Kiva loan to stock her store with the merchandise that moves quickly for the end of the year.  She will mainly stock up on things like soft drinks and groceries.

She is very happy because she used her Kiva loan to finish the flooring and the covering of her patio where she now offers her customers a comfortable setting.  

Her message to the lenders is the following:  “I am very grateful for your help, I hope you continue helping so that my business will be bigger and prosperous.”

loans.use: to buy food, groceries, and drinks.

loans.name: Santa Maria 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Maria es de la ciudad de San Pedro, se formó con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Pedro, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que trabajan en busca de un mejor porvenir para sus familias. Actualmente el grupo está en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, con 12 integrantes.
Una de las miembros es Nilda, quien es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora. Comenta que desde joven ha trabajo, por lo que no teme a ningún desafío. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, a la que acuden la mayoría de sus vecinos. Ella sueña con poder creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, panificados, enlatados y demás artículos para poder abastecer su local.
texts.en:
Several friends and neighbours of the city of San Pedro formed the Santa Maria committee of this city. They are all heads of their households who work to achieve a better future for their families. The group, which is made up of 12 members, is currently in the first level of the Foundation’s female entrepreneur program. 
Nilda is one of the members. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. She says she has worked since she was very young, so is not afraid of any challenges. She has a well-stocked grocery to which most of her neighbours go. She dreams of continuing to grow so she can go on helping her family in that way.
She is requesting a loan to buy groceries, beverages, bakery products, canned food and other articles with which to stock her shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, bakery products, canned food and other items.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan is 24 years old, a married woman and the mother of a child. She lives in Ang Snoul district. She is a garment factory worker, while her husband provides construction services to generate income. Together, they usually earn in the neighborhood of $9 per day. 

The family doesn't presently own a motorcycle, so they have some transportation difficulties. Mrs. Chan is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to meet the needs of the family. 

Her business goal is to own a shop and sell construction supplies to the people around her commune.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to meet the needs of the family.

loans.name: Magda Yojana

texts.es:
Magda Yojana tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos con edades de 11, 5 y 3 años de edad.
Magda era empleada de una maquila, pero el poco tiempo que le dedicaba a su familia la llevo a tomar la decisión de  establecer su propio Foto estudio, donde ofrece los servicios de Fotos instantáneas, ampliaciones fotográficas, fotos con diseño y restauración de fotografías dañadas, también ofrece a los colegios y escuelas, diseños de folletos para cada ocasión  con fotografías para graduaciones, cumpleaños etc.
Inicio en su casa hace 10 años,  pero ahora tiene un local más amplio donde su esposo le apoya. Ella le dedica  8 horas diarias y también el tiempo necesario a su familia.

Ha solicitado varios préstamos para ampliar el Negocio actualmente esta solicitado L.10, 000.00 el cual lo invertirá en compra de papelería para fotos, cambiar el cielo falso y hacerle divisiones al negocio, para poder dar un mejor servicio profesional al cliente, ya que su negocio ha crecido y sus ventas han aumentado.
texts.en:
Magda Yojana, age 28, is married and has three children, ages 11, 5, and 3.  Magda worked in a factory.  However, the small amount of time she devoted to her family caused her to make the decision to establish her own business.  It is a photo studio where she offers snapshots, photo enlargements, photo design, and restoration of damaged photos.  She also offers schools brochure designs for every occasion with graduation and birthday photos, etc.

She started ten years ago in her house, but she now has a larger place where her husband supports her.  She works eight hours a day, and she also has the time she needs with her family.

She has requested several loans to expand her business.  She is currently requesting 10,000 lempiras to buy photo paper, to change the ceiling, and to make dividers for the business.  She will do this to be able to give better professional service to the customers.  Her business has grown, and her sales have increased.

loans.use: to buy photo paper, to change the ceiling, and to make dividers for the business.

location.town: Colonia el Paraíso, San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has one child aged 7 years. In 2009, Kadiatu established her charcoal and wood business. She began her business because she wanted to help in taking care of the home. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 850,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal and wood for resale. In the future, Kadiatu plans to get more profit and invest it in timber to get established in business. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, e.g.120 bags, for resale

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Саидмурод житель района Джоми. Ему 51 лет. Он семейный человек. У него жена, сын, невестка и внук. Саидмурод трудолюбивый и ответственный дедушка и отец. Он с детство был заинтересован заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Саидмурод всегда помогал отцу в работе, и освоил все навыки этой деятельности. Саидмурод 20 лет начал заниматься земледелием самостоятельно. Он в этом году посадил морковь. И на следующий посев собирается посадить картофель и на половине часть землю хочет посадить пшеница. Саидмурод просит кредит для купли семена урожай и минеральных удобрений. У него имеется большой земельный участок, и требуется больше количества минеральных удобрений. Саидмурод хочет собрать богатый и качественный урожай. Ему очень нужно Ваша поддержка.

loans.use: Для купли минеральных удобрений и семена урожай.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 46 year old married woman living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. Her husband works as a painter, and they cooperate to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. She has opened her house a room to sells hardware since five years and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more materials in order to increase her sales and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own Store.

loans.use: to purchase more materials in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Maria Felix Sosa

texts.en: I sell clothing and shoes for children, men and women.  My business is in  one of the main streets of Danili.  Iâ€™ve had my stand for the past two years and my sales are good given that my main clients are people from other communities that visit Danili.

loans.use: Buying hair ties, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, clothing for babies, and undergarments for men and women

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.en:
Married to a fisherman, Mrs. Ahoefa H. is the mother of four (4) children and is also responsible for her own two (2) younger brothers and one of her husband's brothers. Her business is producing palm oil. This is a very profitable buisiness that allows Mrs. H. to contribute to the household expenses. Because of the high quality of oil she produces, she has so many customers that she can no longer supply them all. It takes a large amount of money to acquire palm nuts for preparing the oil. Since she does not have this money, Mrs. H. cannot put enough palm oil on the market. In order to fill this gap and improve her family's income at the same time, she is asking for a credit of $850 to purchase a supply of palm nuts and improve her production facilities. This will help her better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée à un pêcheur, Madame H. Ahoefa est mère de quatre (4) enfants et a à sa charge ses deux (2) jeunes frères et un frère de son mari. Elle exerce comme activité la production de l’huile de palme. Cette activité est très rentable et permet à Madame H. de contribuer aux charges du ménage. De part la qualité de l’huile qu’elle produit, elle a une clientèle abondante qu’elle n’arrive plus satisfaire. Il faut des moyens importants pour l’acquisition des noix de palme en vue de la préparation de l’huile. N’ayant pas ces moyens, elle n’arrive pas à mettre suffisamment d’huile de palme sur le marché. Pour combler cette insuffisance et par la même occasion améliorer le revenu familial, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’approvisionner en noix de palme et améliorer son installation de production. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: buy a supply of palm nuts and improve her production facilities

loans.name: Zakira

texts.en:
Zakira and her husband have a tailoring business. She is requesting a loan so they can buy new machines and sewing supplies, so they can rebuild their lives and have a better future. She is thankful for the loan programs that help poor people create better lives for themselves.

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase materials for a tailoring shop

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en: Mwanahamisi lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two sons. Mwanahamisi has a food vending business. She has four years of experience in this business. She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs, food serving dishes, and a stock of cold drinks. Sometimes she loses some customers due to inadequate equipments. She is also in need of a cupboard for storing food serving dishes hygienically. To facilitate her plan, Mwanahamisi needs US $550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Mrs. Christiana A. is happily married with six children. She is 62 years old. In her store, she sells drinks, bottled water, and other provisions. She has been in this business for 19 years, also with LAPO for 3 years as an assistant leader. She needs a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her store

loans.name: Ixi Hohana

texts.en:
For 5 years, Ixi R. has had a small business selling clothes, shoes, decorative pictures, and other items. With the profits from this business, she helps her brothers support the family. She also attends night school, and has to pay school fees.

She is requesting this loan of $250 to purchase the supplies to fill the orders she has for Christmas.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and other items to fill Christmas orders

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
It's been more than four years since Luis Alberto decided to build a business he had inherited from his grandmother in the market called Israel Lewites in the city of Managua. He sells plastics, buying them wholesale and selling them individually at his small shop. Luis is married and has three children, two of whom attend school and the other is still a baby. He would sacrifice anything for his family. It's key to him that he provide his children with a good education, enough food to eat and a father's love. The infrastructure of his shop isn't great and there's not much security. He began with an investment of $37 and now he is able to offer a good selection of plastic products. Slowly, his business has been growing. He's increasing his income and profits and feels grateful to the help from CEPRODEL, who has been by his side supporting his efforts for three years. He has had 8 loans which he's used to invest in his business.

Hace más de cuatro años Luis Alberto decide seguir con el negocio que su abuela le heredo en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua. Sus productos los obtiene de la compra que realiza al por mayor en el mercado Oriental y los vende al detalle.

Casado, padre de tres hijos, un bebe y los otros dos en edad escolar. Su familia es su razón de existir y por quienes se sacrifica para así poder brindarles a ellos educación, alimentación y sobre todo amor de padre. La infraestructura del local es regular ya que no hay mucha seguridad sin embargo está cerrado por tablas. Empezó con un pequeño capital de US$37.00, ahora ofrece un amplio surtido en los plásticos.

Paulatinamente este negocio ha ido creciendo, sus ganancias han sido mayores y parte de esto él dice que siente que se lo debe a CEPRODEL quien ha estado a su lado apoyándolo durante casi tres años, tiempo en que ha solicitado 8 créditos.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HIS PLASTICS BUSINESS, GROWING HIS INCOME AND PROFITS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HIS THREE CHILDREN.

loans.name: Ketra

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Ketra, 45, and her husband, Un Many, have been married since 1980. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. Two of Ketra’s children are studying and one of her daughters is helping her in business of weaving cotton scarves. Ketra and her family are living along National Road Number Two, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of weaving cotton scarves since 2000. Her husband is moto taxi driver.

Ketra is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of US $1,000. She will use this loan for expanding her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase material for weaving cotton scarves

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en: B. Dilshod lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Mr. B. is engaged in the business of selling medicine. He rents a pharmacy in a food bazaar and has a good assortment (medicine that he receives straight from factory suppliers). It is the municipal pharmacy which is why prices for the medicine are lower than normal bazaar prices. Now Mr. B. requests a loan of $1200 to open a homeopathic department.

loans.use: To help open a homeopathic department

loans.name: Jhoely

texts.en: Jhoely, a twenty-one year old budding entrepreneur and mother of three children, lives in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal where she operates a small business in order to make a living. Jhoely prepares homemade sweets and candies that she sells throughout the community. The entrepreneur explains that her production is still limited, but she plans on using her loan to expand the business and to produce a wider range of sweets so that she can attract more people. Jhoely’s business supports her children's educations.

loans.use: Jhoely would like to expand her small business selling sweets and candies.

loans.name: Niurka María's Group

texts.en:
Niurka María is an influential woman in her community and the leader of a group of five businesswomen in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo.  To support her unique son, she sells homemaD. sweets and candies.  The entrepreneur has been running this activity for two years.  Niurka explains that she has good experience running her business and a well established clientele.  So, she iwishes renting a small local (place from which to sell) to run the business.  That will allow her to offer a more comfortable service to her clientele and attract more people.  With her loan, Niurka will buy more materials to prepare her delicious sweets and candies.
The group is composed as well by:
Augustina D. L. C. M. and Augustina D. L. C. M., twin sisters (with the same name), who sell men’s and women’s clothing.
GracieL. S., an owner and operator of a small cafeteria.
Cecilia D. L. C. S. who retails sewing cloth in the same community.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a pastry shop.  Also to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Gledys Melita

texts.es:
Gledys belongs to La Familia Community Bank, located in Humano Javier Perez, in the Calleria District in Ucayali. She is 42 years old, and is the mother of three children. Her husband works in business. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to create her seamstress and clothing sales business.

She relies on her business as a seamstress, and also selling grilled snacks, parrillidas. She rises at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and afterwards, works on her linens and sells them, and on weekends she prepares parrilladas and sells them from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.

With this loan of $500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: cotton cloth, thread, material, and chickens.

Gledys is happy and thankful that all that she has achieved in life, she obtained through her own strength and conviction with the main concern of seeing out the well-being of her children and knowing that her support of them is vital.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gledys pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Javier Pérez de Cuellar Mz C Lt 7, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Gledys con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de confección y venta de lencería.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de confección y venta de lencería y también venta de parrilladas mixtas para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo, después se dedica a la confección de su lencería para venderlo de manera casual, los fines de semana prepara sus parrilladas mixtas y los vende desde las 9 am hasta las 3 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: telas de algodón, hilos, blondas, pollos, etc.

Gledys esta muy feliz y satisfecha, todo lo que logro en su vida lo obtuvo por su propio esfuerzo y convicción con el único afán de ver bien a sus hijos pues el apoyo que les da es vital para ellos, esta muy agradecida con la ayuda que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Merchandise for food production

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence A. is thirty two years old. He is married with two kids, age one and four. He is a chemical seller of various kinds of drugs. like blood tonic, pain killers, and malaria drugs, in his neighborhood. Many local people patronize his drugs as first aid and as cures when they are sick.

Lawrence wants to use this loan to increase his supply of drugs and add stock of other drugs that his customers frequently request. He hopes to raise his income in order to take care of his family.

He is a member of the community called Nso Nyame ye Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase his supply of drugs.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S., 51, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and one of her children. She raises fish and pigs and makes approximately $5 a day. Her husband makes $5 a day as well, working in law enforcement. They are also supported by their child, who raises chickens and makes $1 a day.

Inflation has made prices soar lately in Cambodia, and Sam S. knows that she must increase her income by expanding her business. She has applied for a loan of $1,000 to dig a well that will provide water for raising fish, and also to buy fish food. She sees this loan as a great economic opportunity and believes that she can raise her standard of living by making this careful investment.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy fish food

loans.name: Ezzat-Ullah

texts.en:
Ezzat-ullah, son of S. N., is a hardworking man but he's still struggling with economic difficulties surrounding him. He is 23 and single and he has the responsibility of supporting six other members of his family.

After graduating from high school, Ezzat wanted to go to college but the financial conditions of his household did not allow him to do so. He had to take the responsibility of supporting his family and therefore he opened a retail store.

Ezzat-ullah was 18 when he started the business; however he did not have a lot of experience but always had the motivation to work and support his family. First he made a small shop which didn’t have many things. But the shop was in a good location and before long he attracted a lot of customers. In order to expand his business, he borrowed some money from one of his friends and made some new shelves in his shop. He has repaid that loan but he wants to buy a freezer for his shop to keep juices or other beverages cold enough so as not to lose his loyal customers. Ezzat-ullah has, therefore, applied to AFSG for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis (US$ 1,100).

Ezzat-ullah hopes that through improving his business by getting this freezer, he will be able to increase his profitability. He dreams of restarting his education and becoming an engineer. He also wants to make a bright future for his younger siblings.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for his shop

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatimata G. est âgée de  41 ans et vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec ses 3 enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles), son époux, sa belle mère et les autres parents de son époux à Kaboïla I, un quartier central de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle décida d’entreprendre l’achat  vente d’habillements depuis maintenant 6 ans.
Elle est en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans. Après avoir bénéficié de 5 prêts de groupe ( prêt solidaire) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son 5 ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 500 paires de chaussures de qualités différentes (Talons, Chaussures en plastique et d’enfants) à Bamako et 10 pièces de Brodé de qualités différentes à Lomé (République du togo), Conakry (République de guinée conakry) et Accra (République du Ghana).
Elle revend ses marchandises en détail (au comptant ou à crédit) dans sa boutique située au grand marché de Sikasso à une clientèle constituée en majorité de femmes et surtout de foraines.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFAqui servira à résoudre l’essentiel de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille,  payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité. Elle souhaite dans l’avenir devenir une commerçante grossiste s’occupant de l’import export afin de fournir les détaillants de Sikasso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata G. is 41 years old and has a traditional family which has grown to include three (3) children (1 boy and 2 girls), her husband, mother-in-law and other relatives of her husband. She lives in Kaboila, a neighborhood in the center of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After several unsuccessful attempts at other businesses, she decided, six years ago, to go into the business of buying and selling clothing. She has had an association with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinancing bank for five years. She has profited from five (5) group loans made with a neighborhood association and is also on her fifth personal loan, all of which have been successfully repaid.

With this loan she plans to buy 500 pairs of various quality shoes (heeled, plastic and children shoes) at Bamako and 10 pieces of Brodé (embroidered fabric) of different quality at Lomé (Republic of Togo), Conakry (Republic of Guinea-Conakry) and Accra (Republic of Ghena). She will sell this merchandise as single items (for cash or credit) in her boutique located in the central marketplace at Sikasso. Her clientele is made up mostly of women and many local stall owners.

She expects to produce a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA which will be used primarily, to pay personal expenses, contribute to family expenses, meet the payments of the loan and invest the remainder in her business activity. She would like to become an import-export wholesaler to supply retailers in Sikasso.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of embroidered fabric and shoes

loans.name: Hilda Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Hilda Beatriz Hernández T. de 27 años de edad, Casada,  Quin es originaria de una comunida de Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapan  que para su llega a la ciudad  son cuatro kilometros  con su negocio que posee actualmente . Hace más de siete años viene trabajando de ventas de productos de consumo diario y según la demanda de los clientes ella se acercó a las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar un crédito que sera invertido en la compra de varios productos para surtir mas su tienda  la cual será invertido en tarjetas prepago de las compañías Movistar, Tigo y claro, también será invertido en compra de artículos de consumo diario para que la tienda se amplié mas, doña Hilda hace este préstamo con el único fin de que su negocio día a día se un mas grande y así  brindarle un buen servicio a sus clientes. Y que la familia pueda superar en gran manera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda Beatriz Hernández T. is 27 years old, and married. She from the Proxlajuj community in the Totonicapan department. Hilda has been working in retail for seven years, and she now owns a general store. Her store is four kilometers from the nearest city. As a result of high demand, Hilda came to the Asdir offices to ask for a loan. She’ll use the money to buy prepaid phone cards from companies like Movistar, Tigo and Claro, as well as household items, to increase her business. Hilda would like a loan so that she can grow her business day by day, and provide good service to her clients. Hilda hopes that her family will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita L. lives in Sanepa Lalitpur. Sanepa is a developing town in Lalitpur and most of the people living in this region are engaged in small business endeavors.
Mrs. L. lives with her husband and four children, she has two sons and two daughters. Both of her sons are studying in lower secondary school and her daughters are studying in secondary schools. Her husband, Mr. Ram L., is engaged in his own small restaurant.  Sunita manages a grocery store that sells different varieties of groceries. She also exchanges coins for bus drivers and charges a commission.
Now Mrs. L. is requesting a loan so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace F. is married and has 2 children. She received schooling through junior high.

Peace has sold yams to local customers at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana since 2000. Her husband works as a policeman.

Peace uses her income to pay bills and other family expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more yams in larger quantities from the yam-producing area, which is several kilometers away. With the bigger profits from her business, Peace plans to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Purchase more yams in larger quantities

loans.name: Risitas Group

texts.es: El grupo Risitas esta representada por la señora Zulema ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos al igual que sus compañeras D. grupo que son madres D. familia D. hijos menos a cinco años, las integrantes son gente joven, dinamica, respondable y con ganas D. progresar. Una mayoria del grupo se dedica al comercio D. diferentes productos como ser: venta D. pollo, cereales, tela, cosmeticos, cotillon algunos se dedican a la elavoracion D. pan, D. prendas D. vestir y al trasporte público. Las socias tiene vastante experiencia en el rubro al cual pertenecen por lo que saben manejar a su beneficio el mercado competitivo. En general los socios (as) no tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios ya que es su primer financiamiento, pero se sienten capaces D. cumplir con la Fundacion Agrocapital y con los integrantes D. su grupo con responsabilidad. el destino del crédito es para el incremento D. insumos y materiales a la venta así como para el mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The group, Little Smiles, is represented by Mrs. Zulema. She is single with three children, just as the other women of the group are mothers with children under the age of five. The members are young, dynamic, responsible, and have goals for advancement. A majority of the group sells different types of products such as chicken, cereals, fabric, cosmetics. Others bake bread, sew clothes, and proviD. public transportation. The members have plenty of experience in their areas, so they know how to gain a competitive edge in the market. In general, the members don't have experience working in these types of groups, and this is their first microloan, but they feel capable of fulfilling their responsibility to Kiva partner Fundacion Agrocapital and to the other members of the group. This loan will lead to increased income and (the purchase of) more products to sell and improve the members' ability to do business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational expenses

loans.name: Lourdes Zenobia

texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Ayllu (Family) Village Bank. She is 32 years old and is a single mother of two children. Lourdes owns a car, which she uses as an inter-provincial taxi between Ayacucho and Ocros, in the jungle. She hires a driver to drive the car, and she collects payments from passengers. She makes three to four trips per week.

Lourdes is requesting a loan of 1800 soles (US $600) to buy new tires and a new battery for her car. She usually uses her FINCA loans for automobile maintenance. 

Lourdes’s goal for the future is to buy another car with her FINCA savings and loans.

loans.use: Buy new tires and battery for taxi

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which consists of fourteen people, is located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sareth S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small store where she sells fruits and cakes. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit and cake to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income while she is using this loan. She is a 46-yE.-old widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer, while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruit and cake to re-sell.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: T., 49, has been selling vegetables in Mongkol Borey Market since 2002. She is married to Vann, 44, who has been a construction worker for a numbers of years. They live together  in a rural area of Banteay Meanchey Province, and they are responsible for three children; two of them are single and still live in the family home. T. is running the vegetable-selling business very well; she is skilled in communication in the market. To earn additional income, she is asking for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie L. is 53 years old, married and a mother of four. Elsie manufactures, buys and sells pottery. She delivers the finished products to her customers. 

The  business started when she attended a  livelihood training in pot making seminar. She will use her current loan amounting to P 9,000.00 in purchasing pot making materials.

She aspires to have a stall in the market as a source of income and to send her children to school.

loans.use: purchasing of pots and pottery making materials

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy S. A., 38, is a widow with three young children living at home in the Takeo province. She makes collars, and typically earns $6 each day. She receives help from two children who are construction workers. Soy S. A. requests a loan of $400 to purchase materials to make collars.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make collars

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es: Ludith es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 55 años y vive en su propia casa, es soltera y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. A lo largo de su vida ha tenido muchos trabajos, los cuales le han permitido sostenerse y tener un vida tranquila, actualmente aprovechando el gran patio que tiene en su casa, ha puesto una cochera donde sus vecinos guardan sus carros, este negocio le es muy rentable debido a que la mayoría de sus vecinos prefieren guardar sus autos con ella, por la confianza que le tienen. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es que al mismo tiempo que cuida su negocio puede realizar sus tareas domésticas, ahorrándole tiempo para hacer otras actividades; pero lo que más le disgusta es que a veces tiene que levantarse en la madrugada para atender a las personas que desean utilizar su cochera. Ludith espera tener más adelante una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le brinde otros ingresos económicos y mejore su situación. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a sus compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con el dinero que solicita planea arreglar su cochera para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ludith is a very hardworking woman. She is 55 years old and lives in her own home. She's single, and what she most desires is to have a quiet old age. Throughout her life she's had many jobs, which have allowed her to support herself and live well. Currently, taking advantage of a large patio in her house, she has installed a carport where her neighbors store their vehicles. This is a very profitable business since most of her neighbors prefer to store their cars with her because they trust her. She's been doing this for 8 years, and what she likes most is that while she takes care of her business, at the same time she can do her housework, saving her time for doing other activities. What she likes least is getting up at dawn to attend to people who want to use the carport. Ludith hopes in the future have a grocery store, which would provide more income and improve her situation. This is her first loan with MFP, and she plans to make her payments on time so as not to cause her partners in her community bank any trouble. She is very respected by the other members because she helps organize the group. With the requested loan she plans to repair the carport in order to offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her carport

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious W. is thirty years old and married with one child. She has a beauty salon where she styles hair for her customers, and she also sells cosmetics. She hopes for a loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcelina A. de 37 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Antonio Escobar de 35 años de edad, ellos tienen 2 hijos que están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
    Doña Marcelina tiene una despensa bien surtida, ha empezado este negocio con el capital obtenido con el trabajo y esfuerzo de su esposo, que es oficial de obras, aproximadamente en el año 1.990; en la actualidad la mayoría en la comunidad son sus clientes ya que ofrece cordial atención.
   Ella invertiría este crédito para la comprar un terreno que está pegado a su vivienda para poder construir ahí el salón para su negocio, ya que actualmente lo tiene en su propia casa y no hay espacio suficiente. 
   Y espera que esta crisis se normalice lo antes posible, para que tengamos más fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. Marcelina A. is 37 years old, and is married to Mr. Antonio Escobar who is 35 years old. They have 2 sons who are attending high school. Ms. Marcelina has a well-stocked pantry shop. She started this business about 1990 with her husband’s savings from years of work and effort, he is a foreman.

Since she offers cordial service, most of the community is currently her customer. She has not enough space to keep the business at her house so she will invest the money from this loan to buy a land that is located next to her house and then to build and establish her business there. She hopes this crisis will normalize as quickly as possible so there will be more work sources.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a land.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Mrs. Anecita Q. is 57 years old, married, and blessed with six children. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since May 18, 2007 under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program. She is a bona fide resident of Barangay D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Anecita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for more than two years, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Currently, she's requesting her 3rd loan in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ma. Aileen

texts.en:
Ma. Aileen A. is from the village of Bagacay. She is 31 years old. Ma. Aileen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Aileen operates a family member's business making & selling snacks. The revenue from this business comes from selling a variety of food products to the local community. Ma. Aileen has been engaged in this work for several years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Aileen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Ma. Aileen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to be used to purchase ingredients for snack making and vending. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ma. Aileen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
