loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Calamba - Bagacay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Melenda

texts.en:
Melenda S. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 25 years old. Melenda is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Melenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The primary--but not only--source of income for this business comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Melenda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (or about $250 US) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Melenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melenda is requesting a loan of 5000 pesos (or about $125) which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo William de 37 años y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Son 10 años los que lleva fabricando ladrillos, su horno está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de Juliaca, cerca al aeropuerto “Inca Manco Cápac”. Se levanta muy temprano y junto a su esposo comienzan con el amasado y moldeado del barro, para luego dejarlo secar por 10 días y meterlo al horno. Antonia disfruta de vender sus ladrillos, ya que siente que su trabajo es recompensado, pero considera que lo más difícil es trabajar sin importar el clima, puesto que muchas veces el sol hace que el trabajo sea más pesado o la lluvia impide que los ladrillos se moldeen correctamente, aun así ella continua trabajando duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda de comestibles, ya que actualmente hay muy pocas por su barrio. Es el segundo préstamo al que accede Antonia en MFP y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades. En su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para ladrillos de techo, ya que es lo que más le solicitan.
texts.en:
Antonia is 36 years old; she is a very hard-working woman and a fighter. She lives in her own home with her husband WIlliam, who is 37 years old, and the couple's greatest goal is to get ahead in life. She has been making bricks for the past 10 years. Her oven is located outside the city of Juliaca, near the "Inca Manco Cápac" Airport. She and her husband wake up very early each morning to start mixing and molding the clay, which they then allow to dry for 10 days before firing the bricks. Antonia enjoys selling bricks, since she feels well compensated for her work. She says that the hardest part is working through all kinds of weather conditions, since sometimes the hot sun makes work more tiring, or the rain prevents the bricks from taking the correct shape. Still, she continues to work hard each day to improve her quality of life. In the near future, she hopes to open a small grocery store, since there are very few in her neighborhood. This is Antonia's second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she expects to pay in on time without any difficulties, just as she has done with her earlier loans. She is very well respected in her village bank, since she is the most active, committed group member. With the 2,000 soles she has requested, she will buy new molds for roof bricks, since this is what she receives the most requests for.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy brick molds

loans.name: Roxana Melita

texts.es:
La señora ROXANA MELITA A. M., tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal CIELO II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  2 hijos (de  9 y 6 años) quienes  dependen  económicamente de ella.
ROXANA   se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, cerveza y agua mineral en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de agua, cerveza y gaseosas. Así como también en la compra de productos alimenticios para preparar menú (alimentos) pero por problemas de salud de su menor hija se vio obligada a dejar de prepara menú para dedicarse a cuidarla adecuadamente ya que se encontraba enferma de los riñones.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar cajas de cervezas, gaseosas y agua mineral al por mayor para vender en las fiesta que se realizaran por aniversario de su barrio.
ROXANA  sueña con tener un restaurante y así poder generar mayores ingresos que le permita solventar los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Roxana Melita Azanero M. is 28 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Cielo II Community Bank. Roxana has a high school education and is the mother of two children, ages 9 and 6, who depend on her financially. She makes a living selling soft drinks, beer and mineral water in her home. She used her initial loan of 300 soles to invest in the purchase of those products. She also bought food products to make and sell meals, but due to the health problems of her youngest daughter, who had kidney problems, she had to drop her menu to be able to adequately care for her. With the current loan of 800 soles (approximately $275) she is requesting, Roxana plans to purchase cases of beer, soft drinks and mineral water wholesale to sell at the parties celebrating the anniversary of her neighborhood's founding. Her dream is to have a restaurant and thus be able to earn a better income, which would help him cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cases of beer, soft drinks and mineral water at wholesale

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 42-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their three children. Jihad has owned a grocery store since 2004. Jihad has requested a loan of $1500 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan.

Jihad is special in his work because of his good reputation in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Jihad decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his family’s financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Niliver

texts.es:
Niliver  tiene 25 años, vive con su esposa Felipa y sus 3 hijos: Verónica de 26, Jonathan de 23, Jacky de 22, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de bolsas de plástico, su forma de trabajo es coordinando con las grandes empresas que fabrican estas bolsas y les compra las que les sobran de los grandes pedidos que ellas manejan. Así, Niliver las compra a un precio menor y las vende al precio de mercado. Hasta el momento el negocio le va muy bien, ya que ofrece su mercadería a tiendas de los mercados más conocidos de su ciudad. A él le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y complementar con las ganancias que aporta su esposa con la venta de artículos según la temporada. De esta manera, ambos se ayudan y salen adelante para darles bienestar a sus hijos.
Es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, ya que su grupo es muy exigente a la hora de cumplir con ellos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará otra cantidad de bolsas para esta temporada de primavera, ya que promete ser muy buena la venta.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim L., 43, is a widow with two school-aged children. Living in the Kampong Cham, she typically makes about US$7.50 per day by selling porridge in the morning and dessert in the evening. However, she still looks after her disable mother. To earn more money, she needs a loan from CREDIT of US$1000 to make a new investment. She would use this loan to raise cows for sale.

loans.use: Raise cows.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income of Roberto and his family. He is married to Anita and they are blessed with two children: Russel - 12 years old, an elementary student, and Hannah - 5 years old.

Roberto and his family reside in the village of Pangal Norte, Echague, Isabela. He would like to buy farm supplies to enable him to have a higher yield. For this reason, he would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase the needed items.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa P. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Temukisa is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Temukisa has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Temukisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Temukisa is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Temukisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is from the village of Taboo in Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Cecilia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cecilia harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2005, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. She use her previous loan to buy fish to sell. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This will be Cecilia's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Laron

texts.en:
Laron P., 30, is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been married for two years and has given birth to a young child. Her husband is a photographer. She currently lives with her mother who helps her in caring for her child and in doing housework as well. Her mother is shown in the photo.

Laron P. works sewing clothes in a factory and started early in 2007. The family finds it hard traveling to work or anywhere else and also pays a lot of money for taxis because they have no vehicle for their transportation needs. That is why Laron P. has decided to seek a loan to buy a motorcycle to make her family's transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her family's transportation needs

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of six children. Currently, three of her children are in school, while the rest of her children are independent and live on their own. She works hard to support her husband in taking care of their home.

To earn a living, she is a producer and supplier of local palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, and is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish, soups, and pastries. She produces and supplies palm oil to food vendors so that they can prepare their meals for their customers. She also sells palm nuts to those who need them for further processing. Unfortunately, her palm oil production has been hampered as of late due to insufficient working capital; more specifically, she cannot to afford a machine to assist with palm oil processing. In any event, she is seeking a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts to increase her production of palm oil. She believes that this loan will enable her to save more for her children's education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing a bulk supply of raw ingredients of palm oil

loans.name: Victoria Lili

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria Lili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Victoria Lili, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos y lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, y cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria Lili, 36, is a member of the “Esmeralda” communal bank, which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She has two children who still are dependent on her. Victoria Lili, as she is affectionately called, sells anticuchos (grilled meats on skewers). She has been in this line of work for several years; she tends to her customers in her own home in an area that is set up for this purpose. She tells us that her daily sales are good because her dishes are very tasty; she is well-known and well-liked. She continues in this line of work and she is very happy with her daily tasks. She, herself, tends to her customers with her characteristic good humor and charisma. She will use the 3000 sol loan to buy ingredients for her meals like: kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, crates of chickens, vegetables as well as some utensils to provide better customer service. She feels full of life and the will to continue forging ahead; she has many dreams and goals in life like setting up her own, well-stocked and equipped grocery store. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Aguli

texts.en:
Aguli L. is 28 years old and married to a journalist. She has three school-aged children. L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread from home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Women in Nigeria love sarongs, and wear ones with lovely designs for many different purposes. Kate loves sarongs too, and that is why she has chosen to make a living selling them. She has been in this business for a long time, and has applied for a loan for N120,000 to buy more sarongs to sell. She is a hard-working woman who is determined to lift her business and her family above poverty, and someday hopes to own a world-class boutique. She is married and has seven children. Her husband makes a living selling wooden planks used in various construction projects. Kate extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog Misamis Oriental.  She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Jinky runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling mostly food & daily use products in her local community.  Jinky has been in business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. (Jinky is in the middle of the photo.)

In 2009, Jinky joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 
----------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expandi the business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
36-year-old Judith is married to Herminaldo and they have six children, her eldest being 18. She desires that her children achieve a proper education which urges her to work hard.

Judith owns a rice field and is engaged in rice farming. She envisions having a better income from her business and so improving her family’s living status.

Judith applied to CEVI and would like to loan Php 5,000. This loan will be used to supply Judith’s farm needs such as seed, urea (a fertilizer), pesticide, insecticide, diesel fuel and other items.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.ru:
На ровном месте ничего не строиться. Герои этой истории на примере собственной жизни показывают, что это именно значит. Дамира Алдаярова– лидер группы. Она вместе с семьёй проживает в с. Тюп, что находится на берегу прекрасного озера Ыссык – Куль (в переводе с кыргызского языка: горячая вода). Дамире пятьдесят лет. Вместе с мужем она вырастила двоих сыновей. Сейчас  у них даже есть один внук. Муж Дамиры и её два сына занимаются домашним хозяйством. У них имеется скот, и дети заготавливают для него корм. Помимо этого, с весны вся семья также занимается земледелием. Дамира, же дома смотрит за коровой и продаёт молоко. Иногда им удаётся подзаработать от перепродажи скота. К примеру, прошлой весной, они купили двух ягнят по полторы тысячи сомов  ($35) и перепродали их по две с половиной тысячи сомов ($55) осенью. От одной продажи молока, им удаётся заработать до тысячи сомов ($22) в месяц. Таким образом, у них складывается довольно богатый спектр занятий, включающий в себя и земледелие, и животноводство, и торговлю. Сейчас Дамира хочет купить четырёх ягнят, и одного бычка для откорма, чтобы затем перепродать осенью. Она надеется получить этот кредит и осуществить задуманное. В дальнейшем, Дамира и её семья планируют увеличить пахотные земли с пяти до десяти гектаров, что в свою очередь должно принести им в два раза больше урожая, чем раньше. 

Партнёры Дамиры по группе – её односельчане:

Роза Тойгонбаева, вдова и мать троих сыновей. Роза, имеет кое – какую живность. Дети летом помогают заготовить корм. С апреля месяца, Роза планирует продавать молоко. Одна из её коров скоро отелится. Роза обратилась за кредитом, с целью закупить ягнят для откорма.

Рапия Балтабаева– вдода и мать четверых детей. Сын живёт вместе с ней и помогает по хозяйству. Дочери учатся в школе. Рапия ежедневно сдаёт по шесть литров молока и готовит корм для скота. Продажа молока приносит ей ежемесячно по полтора тысячи сомов. Сейчас Рапие нужен кредит, чтобы купить корову для откорма. 

Тологон Турсумбаевой, пятьдесят четыре года. У Тологон один сын. Тологон продаёт молоко по шесть литров, а сын готовит сельскохозяйственную технику для полевых работ. Тологон надеется получить кредит, с помощью которого, она планирует закупить скот и таким образом увеличить поголовье. Недавно, она уже продала кобылу, и купила корову и овец.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Damir A. is the leader of the group. She and her family live in Tup, which is located on the shores of beautiful Lake Issyk-Kul. Damir is married, fifty years old with two sons. They have cattle, and the children help them to store food. In addition, since the spring the family is also farming. Damir has one milk cow to produce milk and earns extra income from the sale of livestock. For example, last spring, they bought two lambs for a half thousand soms ($35) and resold them for two and a half thousand soms ($55) in the autumn. From a single sale of milk, they are able to earn up to a thousand soms ($22) per month. They have a rather wide range of occupations, which includes agriculture, livestock, and trade. Damir now wants to buy four lambs and one calf for fattening, to then resell in the fall. She hopes to get the loan and to realize her plans. In the future, Damir and her family are planning to increase arable land from five to ten hectares, which in turn should bring them in twice the yield than before.

Damir’s Partners live in the same village:

Roza T. is a widow with three sons. Rose has some livestock. Her children help in the summer to procure forage. Since April, Rose plans to sell milk. One of her cows will calve soon. Rose is asking for a loan, to purchase lambs for fattening.

Rapiya B. is a widow and mother of four children. Her son helps her with the business while her daughters study in school. Rapiya’s cows produces six liters of milk. Milk sales earns her a monthly one and a half thousand soms. She is asking for a loan to buy a cow for fattening.

Tologon T. is fifty-four years old with one son. Tologon sells six liters of milk daily and her son is a farm equipment mechanic. Tologon hopes to get a loan with which she plans to purchase cattle, and increase the stock. Recently, she already sold a mare, and bought a cow and sheep.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase land livestock

loans.name: United Sisters And Brothers Group

texts.en:
Mary W. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called United Sisters and Brothers. She is 38 years old, married and has five children who range in age, from 3 to 19 years old. She could not continue her education through high school.

For 8 years, Mary has been selling fried fish, cucumbers and cola nuts at the Somalia Drive in Monrovia, Liberia.
She gives her customers kind words during sales and sometimes shares a laugh with them, in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.
Mary started selling with 500.00 Liberian Dollars as working capital. She now has 3000.00 Liberian Dollars as working capital.
She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more fish and flour. Her goal is to grow her business to a higher size and to see her family live an improved life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more fish and flour.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort describes herself as lovely and caring woman. She has been trading in groceries for the past 7 years, selling assorted groceries like candies, rice, biscuits, bottled water, toiletries, etc. Currently, Comfort operates her business in a rented metal container in her community. She is excited to be taking out this loan so that she can purchase large quantities of groceries that will help her meet customers demand at all times. Comfort dreams of generating enough profits to build a bigger store and sell groceries wholesale.
 
In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Comfort is also the mother of four children of ages 27-40 years old. She is a widow and through hard work, she has been able to support all her children through tertiary institution.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, es viuda con dos hijos de 30 y 29 años,  al morir su esposo ella no tenia como sustentar su hogar, decidió construir un pequeño local en su casa para una tienda, pero al pasar el tiempo ella se postulo como comerciante minorista para que le den un puesto en el mercado de Guasmo, cuando le dieron el puesto ella traslado su tienda al mercado.

Poco a poco a incrementado los víveres en su negocio, con granos y otros productos. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 13h00 todos los días, vende los aceite a $ 1.70, azúcar a $ 0.45, arroz a $ 0.30. Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, arroz, azúcar para su puesto en el mercado. 

En el futuro quiere tener locales para alquilar y tener otro ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old and lives in the urban zone of Guasmo in Guayaquil. She is a widow with 2 children, aged 30 and 29. When her husband died Rosa had no means of sustaining her household, and she decided to construct a small area in her home to use as a store. Then with the passage of time, she began to think of herself as a retail merchant and sought a post in the Guasmo market. When she got the stall, she moved her store to the market. Little by little, Rosa has increased the goods available at her business, including grains and other products. She works from 7:00am until 1:00pm everyday, and sells cooking oil at $1.70, sugar at $0.45, rice at $0.30. With this loan she will purchase cooking oils, rice, and sugar for her market stall. In the future, Rosa would like to offer space to rent out in hopes of earning additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING COOKING OILS, RICE, AND SUGAR TO SELL

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Enoc, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, su actividad económica principal es brindar servicios de taxi en la ciudad de Chichero y otra veces cubre la ruta Chichero – Cusco y viceversa y su actividad complementaria es la agricultura. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere ahorrar y después adquirir un vehículo.
texts.en:
On our visit to the community bank "Mateo Pumacahua," we spoke with Enoc, one of its members. He is single and lives in the city of Chinchero in the Cusco region. His principal economic activity is offering taxi services in the city of Chinchero, and sometimes he covers the Chinchero - Cusco (and return) route. His complementary activity is agriculture. He has already worked in this business for five years, and it is going very well for him, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Being a member of the Arariwa Foundation has helped him very much to aim higher and make his business grow. With this new loan, he needs to save and later acquire a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To save and later acquire a vehicle.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada G. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Amada is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Amada owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Amada has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Amada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Amada is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products that she has for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Amada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his land and purchase high quality wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ayten

texts.ru:
Ayten Xamedovoy 32 qoda . Ona zamujem. Ona jivet v regione Absheron. Eta molodaya devushka uchilas v universitete bataniki i posle okonchaniya  universiteta ona reshila rabotat s rasteniyami uxajivat zanimi izuchat ix a tak je i potom prodovat interesniye rasteniya.

Ayten nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit otrostki rasteniy dlya toqo chto bi virastit ix i potom prodast.V budushem ona xotela bi imet pobolshe mesta dlya virashivaniya rasteniy tak je imet ochen redkiye rasteniya v svoyom maqazine dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Ayten X. is 32 years old. She is married. She lives in the Absheron region. This young woman studied botany at the university. After graduation, she decided to work with plants, caring for them, studying them, and selling interesting plants. Ayten needs 2000 AZN to buy plant clippings in order to grow and later sell the resulting plants. In the future, she would like to have a larger space for growing her plants, rare plants, and her own store.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying plants

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. sells firewood at Takoradi. She is married to a driver and lives with her three children. She has no educational background. She helps her husband with the general welfare of her children.

Ama is going to add the loan to her initial capital to purchase more firewood to distribute to her customers. With the new earnings from her extended business, she plans to save to build a storehouse for her wood to protect it from the rain.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El Sr. Joaquín, es cliente que trabaja solo con emprender  y se encuentra en su quinta secuencia, ingreso el año 2007, con la actividad que aun continua, de constructor, el realiza contratos para construcción de casa particulares y arreglos, estos trabajos generalmente los acaba en un plazo máximo de seis Semanas en cuanto a la obra bruta y en obra fina actualmente trabaja junto con su esposa y dos ayudantes, el Sr. Joaquín utilizara el dinero del crédito en la compra de andamios y de madera para poder realizar un trabajo mas  seguro en las casas de dos pisos o mas altas, en  el Sr. Joaquín, vive en casa propia por la zona de Cota Cota, tiene dos hijas en edad escolar y un bebe de ocho meses, es una familia joven y trabajadora, por lo que se solicita nuevamente una tasa kiva.
texts.en:
Joaquín works exclusively with Emprender and this is his fifth loan. He began in 2007 with an activity that he continues with to this day: construction. He works on contract building private houses and doing repairs. This work typically takes him no more than six weeks of hard labor, and then for the lighter construction he works with his wife and two assistants. Joaquín will use the loan money to buy wood scaffolding to make the taller, two-story houses more stable. Joaquín lives in his own home in the Cota Cota area. He has two young daughters and an 8-month-old baby. His family is young and hardworking, which is why he's asking for a new Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and scaffolding

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia makes a living by running a farm on the outskirts of Kitale town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 20 years and now employs two people. Her farm produces maize, beans, vegetables, tea and milk, all of which she sells at a local market.

Julia is 49 years old, married and blessed with four children who range in age from 22 and 30. One of her children is still in school.

Julia has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, having successfully repaid previous four loans. She is applying for a new loan, for 50,000 KES, to expand her poultry business. She hopes that this will allow her to increase her family's standard of living and reduce the threat of poultry diseases.

In the future, she hopes to expand her livestock business and begin raising more exotic types of poultry.

loans.use: To expand her farm

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Women's Group 1-Lugazi

texts.en:
Due to her unwavering steadfastness 42-year-old T. Jannet has not compromised her business values, even in the face of provocation, threats, competition and, above all, challenging business conditions. This has been the hallmark that has set her drug store or pharmacy business in Lugazi town apart from others in the last 13 years. Her customers range from the lowly to the middle class and live in her area of operation and even from beyond.
Jannet belongs to Tusooka Kwavula Women's Group. It has helped her to have a supportive family and the first person on hand for her has been her husband. This kind of business, which involves selling and prescribing drugs, is tailor made for somebody who has gained an apprentice nurse training and Jannet is a qualified nurse. She worked first in a health center. Jannet says that credit for her success so far boils down to her hard work and tenacity. In a month, she makes 430,000 UGX, and with this loan she hopes to buy more drugs that she will, at length, resell.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Samuel. He is married, and has four children under 12 as well as two additional dependents. He established his timber board and motor spare parts business in 2007. He started in this business as an apprentice repairing mobile phones but wanted his own business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he now earns about Le 1,281,000 every month. Samuel would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more supplies, as he has very little competition and many customers. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profit by approximately Le 230,000. In the future, Samuel plans to build a large store for his his timber and would also like to invest on his daughter’s education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
57-year-old Melania dreams of giving the best to her children in their future. She and her husband hope to build a more accommodating and comfortable life for their family. She has two children: 32-year-old Emmil and 27-year-old Emmanuel. Both of the children graduated from college but are still dependent on her. To achieve this, she plans to develop her business. Melania has requested PHP 20,000 as additional capital for her junk shop business. This loan will be a great help for making their dreams come true and little by little, her business will grow to be a full shop soon. 

For 14 years as a member of ASHI, she has been trusted with loans that have improved their standard of living. Melania is also a good mother and is good at budgeting money for their daily expenditures, which are very expensive. She hopes that through her loans from ASHI partnership with KIVA; someday she will be able to save money for their future. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, she hopes to have their own passenger boat in the island of Talim, Binangonan in the province of Rizal. Her long-term goal is to give her family a better life, far away from the slave of poverty.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her junk shop business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia R. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Leticia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly S. is from the village of Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Merly is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, rice by the kilogram and medicines in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Merly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng N., 31 years old, is the mother of two school-aged children.  She now lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She currently sells a few grocery items from her home in the village. She sells such items as shampoo, cooking ingredients, fast food, and plastic items. Pheng N. can earn around $3 a day for her family.  Additionally, she also helps her husband grow various crops for extra profit. 

They are raising two children, who are students. Pheng N. would like to request a loan, of which 50% will be used to grow a rice crop and the rest to buy some necessary items to sell. 

Note: Mrs. Pheng N. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop, and to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José tiene 30 años. El señor tiene un negocio de venta de venta de llantas y repuestos para vehículos, tanto nuevos como usados, este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Cabe señalar, el señor tiene ya 3 años de haber empezado con este negocio el cual dio inicio debido a la necesidad de generar un empleo propio y una forma de manutención de su familia, que son quienes lo han estado apoyando todo este tiempo. Su negocio tiene como nombre Multiservicios Jinotepe. El solicita este préstamo para realizar la compra de repuestos para vehículos, buscando como ampliar la distribución de su producto en estos meses. Su sueño, por el momento solo es hacer crecer más su negocio y que siga siendo tan rentable como ha sido hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Francisco José is 30 years old.  He owns a tire and auto repair parts business (for new and used vehicles) which he operates out of his home.  He began the business three years ago as a way to generate income for his family, who have supported him all this time.

His business is known as Multiservicios Jinotepe.  He is requesting the loan to buy more auto repair parts so he can increase business in the coming months.  His dream is to grow his business so that it can stay as profitable as it has been until now.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felista Wambui

texts.en: Felista, a 35-year-old single mother of five children, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan with which she plans to buy farm inputs and prepare to plant potatoes.  In the future, Felista hopes to practice large-scale farming and become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and prepare to plant potatoes

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia lives in Kasur, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its leather industry. She has been living there with her family for the past twenty years. She is 42 years old and has six children: four sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in a motor workshop as a mechanic while her elder daughter makes paranda (an ornament used to tie back hair). Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Safia also makes paranda to share the financial burden of her family with her husband and children. She sells them to different cosmetics shops at the markets and earns income in this way.
 
Her husband is a carpenter by profession and makes furniture on order.  He has a showroom in the market where he displays his furniture items, like chairs, tables, etc. He is known for his creative art and quality among his clients.
 
Safia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further growth of her paranda making business. With the loan, she will purchase thread, beads and tassels in bulk quantities, which will help her to make paranda in larger quantities for selling. 

She has been handling this business for the past ten years and she is very confident that her business will grow further after making the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy thread, beads and tassels for a paranda making and selling business. (paranda - an ornament used to tie back hair)

loans.name: Nicholas Kolian

texts.en:
Nicholas Kolian N. is 24 years old. He is married and a father of four children. Nicholas is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last two years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to prepare six acres for wheat planting which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.


Nicholas' hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to prepare six acres of land  for wheat planting

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Plata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” es un grupo que iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve personas, ocho mujeres y un varón.

La asociación comunal “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Erurita, como tesorera la señora  Grisel y en el cargo de secretario de actas el señor Santos.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos: venta de comida, chofer de transporte público, comerciante venta de varios, venta de Batidos (bebidas en bases a Bicervecina, azúcar y huevo), tejido a máquina, venta de comida, venta de ropa tejida, venta de comida para pollos, venta de queso.

En el caso de la señora Erurita, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio la venta de ropa tejida:   buzos para niño, polainas, y otros.  Estas prendas son elaboradas a máquina por ella misma, la señora Erurita trabaja en este rubro desde hace 36 meses. Ella realiza sus ventas por menor en diferentes ferias en la ciudad de El Alto, de manera ambulante.  Doña Erudita es una mujer joven y trabajadora de 25 años de edad, vive con su familia.   El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para incrementar el capital de trabajo y comprar lana.
texts.en:
The “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” (Little Silver Vicuñas) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Focal Center.  It has nine members: 8 women and one man.

The “VICUÑITAS DE PLATA” communal bank organized its governing board thus: Erurita is President, Grisel is Treasurer and Santos is Recording Secretary.  The businesses the members carry out are varied.  Some have to do with commerce, others with services and production.  Among the businesses we have: sale of food, public transportation driver, general merchandise sales, sale of “Batidos” [drinks based on Bi-Cervecina (low alcohol, dark, malt beer), sugar and egg], machine weaving, food sales, sale of knit clothes, sale of chicken feed and cheese sales.

In the case of Erurita, communal bank President, she indicates that she has a knit clothing sales business at present.  She sells children’s sweatshirts, leggings and others.  These items are machine woven by her.  She has been in this line of work for 36 months.  She makes her sales at various markets in the city of El Alto in an ambulatory way.

Erurita, 25, is a hard working, young woman living with her family.  She will use the requested loan to increase working capital and buy wool.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en: Janifer is a 29-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food market and a rice retailing business.  She lives in the municipality of Rizal, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food market and rice retailing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,900.  Janifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her second loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Janifer aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop for five years. His hardship is increased rent; his vision is to complete his house. Samuel is requesting a loan to buy salt and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase salt and rice to sell

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva C. is from the village of Dagohoy, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Genoveva is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Genoveva owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Genoveva has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Genoveva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genoveva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Genoveva is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, snack foods & beverages. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Genoveva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, snack foods & beverages.

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liliana de 28 años, es una mujer  trabajadora que desde pequeña le gustaba jugar a ser estilista. Y se decido a estudiar para ser maestra de belleza. Es soltera u tiene un hijo que está en escuela

En la actualidad trabaja en el día en un salón de belleza y por la noche abre su propio negocio de peluquería. Con el préstamo quieres comprar materiales para su salón de belleza  para así trabajar en cuenta propia y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Liliana is a hard-working 28-year-old who, as a child, enjoyed pretending she was a hair stylist.  So she decided to get training to be a beauty professional.  She is single and has a school-aged son.

During the day she works in a beauty salon and at night runs her own hair salon.  She plans to use the loan to buy beauty shop supplies so she establish her own business and provide the best she can for her son.

loans.use: To buy furniture, haircolour and supplies for her business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es una madre D. familia D. 51 años D. edad, vive con sus 3 hijos y esposo en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos D. agua y luz, en donD. acondicionado la su sala un lugar para colocar su tienda, ubicado en la zona rural D. la campiña  La Arenita a unos 15 minutos del distrito D. Paijan,a 30 minutos D. Ascope y a una hora D. distancia al departamento D. La Libertad (Trujillo) .  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola,ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Carmela ha puesto  en su casa su tienda, en cual sus  vecinos encuentran toda clase D. productos comestibles (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, todo tipo D. golosinas, etc.), con el pequeño negocio que a colocado Carmela  en su casa trata en lo posible D. brindar un mejor nivel D. vida para su familia mediante los ingresos D. sus ventas diarias.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Carmela trata D. adquirir un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda D. más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades D. cus clientes, y D. paso incrementa sus ingresos.

Carmela es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo D. que como familia salgan adelante apunta D. esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmela is a 51 year-old mother.  She lives with her husband and three children in her own home which benefits from the basic services of water and electricity.  Her store is located in her specially-adapted living room.  Carmela's home is located in the rural area of the countrysiD. of La Arenita, 15 minutes from Paijan district, 30 minutes from Ascope, one hour from La Libertad department (Trujillo).  These areas are noted for their high levels of commerce, farming, livestock raising and tourism.  

Carmela has set up a store in her home in which her neighbors can find all sorts of food products (milk, sugar, rice, candies, etc.)  With the small business that Carmela has set up in her home, she tries to proviD. her family with a better standard of living through her daily sales.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Carmela acquired a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles which she will use to stock her store with more supplies.  She will thereby be able to meet her customers' needs and increase her own income.

Carmela is known by her neighbors as a cheerful woman who is ready to help others.  She is also known as a responsible woman whose goal is to get her family ahead in life through her efforts and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to stock her store

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 3 años, él se dedica a la venta de ropa, lleva tres años y medio de dedicarse al negocio, el cual lo hace de forma ambulante, junto a su esposa recorren las calles de la ciudad de 7:00am a 2:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, blusas y ropa para niños, esta inversión le ayudara para crear mayores ventas, ya que al surtir el negocio  los clientes tienen mejores opciones para escoger las prendas de vestir.
Su aspiración es en el futuro comprarse un lote para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
José, 28, lives with his wife and 3-year-old daughter.  He sells clothes.  He’s been in this business for three and a half years.  He works as a street vendor.  He and his wife wander through the streets from 7am until 2pm.

He is asking for the loan to buy pants, blouses and children’s clothes.  This investment will help him create larger sales since having the business better stocked will provide better options of clothing items to choose for his customers.  

His wish for the future is to buy a lot to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 41-year-old mother who insisted on helping her retired husband support their family of eight persons. After her husband retired from the military, he start working as a farm keeper but instead of getting a salary they agreed with the farm owner to rent the farm so they could plant some trees and have some sheep to raise. On the farm, they now have olive trees and peach trees; depending on the season, Fatmeh also makes yogurt and butter from the sheep milk. They sell it all. Now Fatmeh has applied for a loan to buy a machine that can help increase her productivity and make cheese.

Since Fatmeh is a conservative person, her husband Hussien appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a machine to make yogurt and cheese.

loans.name: Carmen Adelaida

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad y aún viven con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja pues sufrió un accidente.

Ella para poder sacar a su familia adelante hace tiempo instalo un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual vende helados, colas, bocadillos y otras golosinas, nos cuenta que este negocio lo puso para aprovechar que su casa está frente a un colegio y por lo general a los chicos les gusta todos estos productos, por lo cual las ventas están aseguradas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00. Nos cuenta  que gracias a los créditos que recibió de la institución ella pudo financiar este pequeño negocio que le ayuda mucho para su sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar dulces, golosinas, helados, colas, entre otras cosas que también vende. Está en el banco comunal hace dos años y le gusta por la ayuda y apoyo que le da el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
The “De Colorado” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are renowned both nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous “Panama” hats.

We met Carmen, 53, here.  She is married and has six adult children who still live with her.  Her husband no longer works because he suffered an accident.

In order to move her family forward she set up a small snack bar at home some time ago where she sells ice cream, colas, fast food and other snacks.  She tells us that she set up this business in order to take advantage of the fact that her house is across the street from a school and the youngsters generally like all these products so her sales are a sure thing.  She works every day from 6am until 6pm.  She tells us that thanks to the loans she was able to get from the institution she was able to finance this small business which helps her a lot for her daily sustenance.

She will use this loan to buy candy, snacks, ice cream and colas, among other things that she also sells.  She’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the help and support that the bank gives her.  Her dream is to have another business.

loans.use: to buy candy, snacks, ice cream, colas, etc.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 33 years old, married, and has four children aged 6 months to 11 years old. He has been running several businesses in the last 10 years. Vincent owns a cyber café and rents out spraying machines used for painting. He intends to use his loan to purchase another paint spraying machine for rental to his customers. 

Vincent hopes to open up another business in the future. He describes himself as honest and committed to his work.

loans.use: to purchase another paint spraying machine for rental to his customers.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; la socia tiene 53 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores así como gallinas doble pechugas, pollos, cuyes, la socia vende en Urubamba que está ubicado a 20 minutos del poblado; la socia lleva a vender sus gallinitas cuando estas alcanzan la madures deseada; estas gallinas ponen huevos de tal modo que la socia también puede vender los huevos de corral; en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 100 gallinas bebes de doble pechuga para poder incrementar sus ganancias y seguir creciendo económicamente. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 100 gallinas doble pechugas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS", which is located in the district of Urquillos in the province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Ms. Clotilde, 53, is single, and earns a living buying and selling small animals such as double-breasted chickens and guinea pigs.  She sells them in Urubamba which is about 20 minutes away from the village.  She also sells the eggs that her hens lay.  The loan will be used to buy 100 young double-breasted hens to increase her earnings and continue growing economically.

She is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy 100 double breasted chickens.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 31-year- old mother. She is married to Haitham and has three beautiful girls. Rania is also a governmental employee at the Ministry of Education. Her husband Haitham started his own business two years ago selling gas drums that are used mostly for cooking purposes. In order to help her husband, Rania has decided to apply for a loan to help him pursue his dream and open his own gas agency. Because Rania is a conservative person, she requested that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To help her husband open his own gas retail agency

loans.name: Santos Bernabe

texts.es:
Santos de 40 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura,  ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y caprino (tiene 20 ovejas y 30 cabras) desde hace 5 años, el lugar donde cría  a sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar de alimento balanceado y para mejorar sus corrales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados y cuidados para ofertarlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.  Santos es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el anhelo de que en un futuro su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Santos, 40, lives with her family in her own house which only has electricity and is located in Tambogrande District belonging to Piura Department.  These areas are noted for farming, cattle raising and crafts making.

The activity Santos carries out is raising sheep and goats to sell (she has 20 sheep and 30 goats); she’s been in business five years.  The area where she raises the animals is in her back yard.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses.  Once they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the various markets because she has her own clientele.  Income obtained is used to meet family needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to do some improvements in her corrals which will make it possible for her to have them well fed and cared for so that she can sell them to her customers at a better price.  Santos is a dedicated, hardworking woman who is always concerned for her loved ones’ well-being hoping that her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to make improvements to her corrals.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun, 48, and his wife, Channy, 41, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and five daughters. Five are married and other two are garment workers.  Yun is a horse-cart driver and does construction work. He also assists his wife in farming. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a restroom for family use and build a stairway of his house because it’s old and breaks.

loans.use: To build a restroom for family use and build a stairway of his house because it’s old and breaks.

loans.name: Djeyesse Iv Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 10 membres, DJEYESSE IV  est un regroupe de femmes toutes mariées du village de KOLA SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA,  région de SÉGOU, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe DJEYESSE IV  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
KADIATOU S.,  debout au milieu,   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture,au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20.000 à 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djeyesse IV is a group constituted of ten members, all married women living in traditional families in the village of Kola Sangoula in Bla sub-prefecture, Segou region. They are on average 38 years old with four kids, and cultivate groundnuts and okra.
In order to make their farms more profitable and to increase cultivable areas for better production, the members of group Djeyesse IV have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s lending program this year; they are on their first agricultural loan.
Kadiatou S., who is standing in the middle, plans on using her loan to buy quality seeds, small equipment and agricultural cultivation intrants from the great market in Bla. After the rainy season, the harvest is stored for a while to increase in value before being sold wholesale for cash (sometimes retailed) at the great markets in Bla, Yangasso and neighboring towns, to a clientele generally coming from the larger cities.
After selling their crops, the group’s members are counting on an individual profit of 20,000 to 45,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan’s interests and for the day-to-day expenses of their families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
Danila works hard to support her family. Danila is married and sells personal products in the Philippines.

Danila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

Danila has been in this business for three years now and earns additional income from her general store.

In the future, Danila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell

loans.name: Imani Shg Group

texts.en:
Violet is the facilitator of the Imani SHG group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Violet takes care of 12 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertiliser and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family and give them education. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had a very good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on half an acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Violet will educate her children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Imani SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

In the photograph above, Violet is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо вдова. Ее дети совершеннолетние, имеет внуков. Ей 61 года. Несмотря на это она занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота и торговлей сухофруктов на протяжении восемнадцати лет. В бизнесе ей помогает сыновья и внуки. Полученный займ она хочет потратить на приобретение крупного рогатого скота и закупу сухофруктов.
texts.en: Markhabo is a widow. Her children are adults and she has grandchildren. She is 61 years old. Despite this she has a business feeding large horned cattle and selling dried fruits for eighteen years. Her sons and grandsons help her in this business. She wants to use the received loan to buy large horned cattle and dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle and dried fruits.

loans.name: Bebyana

texts.en:
Bebyana is 38 years old with five children who are all in school. She is a widow. She has a charcoal selling business in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Bebyana requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use her profits from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra.  Maritza  tiene su negocio de venta de carne de res y cerdo en el mercado de Mayoreo, ella tiene trece años de vender en el mercado, ella vende de lunes a domingos de las seis de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.
Ella es soltera y  madre de dos hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
Ella ha trabajado seis créditos con ceprodel y estos han sido para compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Ella esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en compra de carne de cerdo y de res para su negocio, ya que para estos días las ventas son buenas.
texts.en: Maritza sells beef and pork at the wholesale market.  She’s been selling in the market for 13 years.  She sells Monday to Sunday from 6am until 2pm.  She’s single and the mother of two children who are school aged.  She’s worked with six Ceprodel loans that have all been to buy merchandise for her business.  She’s asking for a new loan to buy pork and beef for her business because these days sales are good.

loans.use: to buy beef and pork.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana was born in 1966 and lives in Ijevan city with her school-aged son. Svetlana's daughter is married and she lives separately from her mother.   

Since 2005 Svetlana has run her own shop where she sells food, household goods and clothing. With the profit from her business she keeps her small family, supports her business, and also was able to buy a computer. 

To increase her income, Svetlana intended to manage an Internet Club. Thanks to her first Kiva loan, she was able to buy two more computers. Her son has good computer skills so, after his lessons, he used to help his mother in her new occupation. 

Svetlana says that trading business is more profitable than running an  Internet club, so she decided to close her Internet club and to go on only with her trading business. 

Now Svetlana is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy winter outerwear, household goods and food for her market.

loans.use: To buy winter outerwear, household goods, and food for her market.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es: Silveria, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchos deseos de progresar. Esta separada de su esposo desde hace 4 años, pero vive en compañía de sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Silveria es la cosmetología, dando servicio de cortes, tinte de cabello, ondulaciones, manicure y pedicure y otros, para eso cuenta con un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa, llegando a ganarse clientes gracias a la recomendación de sus actuales clientes por el buen trabajo que realiza. Este trabajo lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional durante 3 años y luego se especializó. Tuvo su primer trabajo en una estética particular de una amiga, y con los ahorros que logró juntar logró independizarse hace 6 años. Al comienzo lo realzaba sola, pero ahora cuenta con el apoyo de una joven que es su ayudante y le paga por semana trabajada. Le gusta mucho el oficio que desempeña, por eso tiene planes de abrir otro local en alguna zona céntrica de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para implementar su negocio, como tintes, laca, polvos para maquillaje y demás, que los traerá desde la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en: Silveria, 36, is a hardworking and diligent woman who has a strong desire to get ahead.  She has been separated from her husband for 4 years, but she lives in her own house in the company of her three children aged 16, 14 and 12.  Silveria is a cosmetologist; she provides haircuts, hair color, hairs waves, manicures, pedicures and other services.  She does this out of a space in her home that she has set up for the business.  She has managed to attract customers thanks to the recommendation of current clients, due to the good work that she does.  She learned to do this work by training in a vocational education center for 3 years, and later she became specialized.  She had her first job in a private beauty shop owned by a friend, and with the savings she managed to accumulate she was able to become independent 6 years ago.  At first she worked alone, but now she has a young assistant who she pays weekly.  She enjoys her work very much, and so she has plans to open another business in an area in the center of the city.  This will be loan number 6 from the MFP institution, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she has been receiving, so she pledges to be on time with her payments.  With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy supplies for her business such as hair dyes, hairspray, powdered makeup and other products that she will bring back from the city of Lima.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, hairspray, cosmetics and other products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Marisa runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has 2 young children. Marisa's husband is engaged in fishing.

Marisa sells various items at her store such as packed noodles, soft drinks and canned goods. She also helps her husband sell fish to their community.

Marisa is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets and more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. Marisa hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods
