loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 41-year-old business lady. She is married to Jerald who is a business man. They are blessed with four children. She has been running a pharmacy for the past five years with a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Rosemary will use the loan to buy more medicine for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a bigger pharmacy, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her shop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is aged 38 and is married with two children aged eight and three. He has been in poultry farming for six years and sells his eggs to the local market. In addition to farming, he runs a motorcycle transport business within the local market. His currently employs one farmhand.

John has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him boost his poultry farming business. He says he has seen the potential in poultry farming and wants to exploit the opportunity fast and supply bigger markets within the region. He adds he will use the income to educate his children.

John says he has focus to repay the loan and acquire more in future.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gotitas De Azul Group

texts.es:
Gotitas de Azul es un grupo solidario formado por 7 mujeres de la ciudad de Monterrey. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que iniciaron sus propios negocios para poder proveer a sus familias con un mejor futuro. Ellas se dedican a diversos oficios como a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y algunas hasta manejan pequeñas mercerías y tiendas de abarrotas.

Gelacia es la Presidenta y líder de este grupo. Ella tiene 45 años y esta casada. Tiene tres hijos de 24, 20 y 15 años de edad de los cuales dos continuan estudiando y uno ya se encuentra trabajando.
Desde hace varios años, Gelacia se decidió a poner un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en su casa que poco a poco ha ido creciendo.

Ella decidió pedir este crédito porque esta convencida de que invirtiendo este dinero en su negocio podría ofrecerle a sus clientes una variedad más amplia de productos, con lo cual sus ganancias se incrementarán y su negocio podrá seguir elevandose.
texts.en:
Gotitas de Azul is a group made up of 7 women in the city of Monterrey.  They are hard working women who started their own businesses to provide their families with a better future.  They have different businesses such as clothing sales and cosmetics.  Some even have notions stores and small groceries.  

Gelacia is the President and leader of this group.  She is 45 years old and married.  She has three children, ages 24, 20 and 15. Two are still in school and one is working.  Some years ago, Gelacia decided to open a small grocery store in her home and it has grown bit by bit.  

She is requesting this loan because she believes that investing this money in her business will enable her to offer her customers a wider variety of products, which will increase her profits and continue to improve her business.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Las Primas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PRIMAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Matilde es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio venta de chuño, venta de tunta, venta de papa, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Matilde es integrante, ella indica que hace un año integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que fue a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de su hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Primas" is beginning their third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Patacamaya.  The group has 8 members and is directed by a Board of Directors where Matilde is the President.  The businesses the members of the group have help get them ahead, and are varied.  Some of their business are: a general store that sells chuño (freeze-dried potato), selling tunta (white freeze-fried potato), selling potatoes, and selling milk.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small-business owners, of which Matilde is one.  She indicates that she has been with Pro Mujer for one year, joining through the invitation of an advisor who went to her home.  She currently has a general store.  She became acquainted with this business through her sister.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy wholesale canned goods that she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her store.  

This work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, since she lives in a free union and has two children.  When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale canned goods.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myla is 37 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Myla has a fishing  business in the Philippines. Myla requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Myla has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 48 years old and owns a shop for veterinary and agricultural products. He provides foods and medicines for domestic and farm animals in the neighborhood. He has over 25 years of experience in this business and is seeking loans in order to acquire better quality and higher quantity of products so that he may serve his clients better. He comments that the only access to credit he has charges 10% to 20% monthly interest and is way beyond what he can afford. He hope he can use profits made from his business in order to provide a better living for his two children who he cares for by himself.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Afi A. is the mother three, has responsibility for two younger sisters, and is married to a farmer. Given their insufficient family income, everyday life is hard at home. A very courageous woman, Ms. A. has built upon her experiences from her mother to start a business selling daily necessities in order to help cover household expenses. Among her display of goods can be found: canned food, soap, and other items. This woman deserves support, since her only wish is to be able to ensure that her children are educated. She is requesting a loan of $800 as capital to acquire basic necessities to sell. The loan will allow her to expand her display of goods, to improve her income, and to really take care of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Afi est mère de trois (3) enfants et a à sa charge deux (2) petites sœurs. Mariée à un agriculteur, le revenu familial est très insuffisant et la vie au quotidien est difficile dans le ménage. Très courageuse, Madame A. Afi est partie de l’expérience reçue de sa mère pour se lancer dans la vente des produits de premières nécessités afin de contribuer aux charges son ménage. Sur son étalage on retrouve : les boîtes de conserve, les savons et autres. Cette femme mérite d’être soutenue car son seul désir est de pouvoir assurer l’éducation de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des produits de première nécessité. Ce crédit va permettre d’augmenter son étalage, d’améliorer son revenu et d’assumer efficacement les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire and sell basic necessities of daily life.

loans.name: Pari Gul

texts.en:
Pari gul is married and has six children. Her husband has a retail shop. She helps with purchasing, cleaning and packaging food items. She also manages the cash. She is requesting a loan so they can purchase more food items and increase their sales. They work very hard to meet their family's needs, and this loan will enable them to improve their income and standard of living.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: buying food item

loans.name: Nilmida

texts.es:
Nilmida has had her business for four years. She used to work cleaning homes, but then her and her husband decided to invest in basic food products and they started to sell meals, which has gone very well. She does this weekdays from 4pm to 11pm. She has managed to keep both activities going so that she earns more. Each morning she still cleans houses and each afternoon she prepares the meals she is going to sell.

With the loan she will buy kitchen utensils and food and drink as the more you buy the larger the discount, and therefore her earnings will increase.

Nilmida is 41 years old and has 3 children, one of which helps her with her business. She has managed to create a very hard working spirit in her family, which all of them still have. Her husband also cleans houses and after work he helps her attend to her clients. Their house is made of sugar cane stalks and the floor is of earth. She hopes that with the loan and their savings they will be able to start building it, little by little, of cement.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

Nilmida tiene una experiencia de 4 años con el negocio. Ella se dedicaba a trabajar en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. Junto a su esposo logran invertir en la compra de víveres y comienzan a vender meriendas. Actividad que le ha ido muy bien. Trabajando todos los días de la semana en horario de 4 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Actualmente ella ha logrado mantener las dos actividades que le generan ingresos. Por las mañanas continuas con su limpieza en casa y por las tardes se dedica a preparar las meriendas para su venta.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina. Además poder comprar víveres al por mayor con lo que obtendría mayor descuento. Y por ende las ganancias en sus ventas van a ser mayor.

Nilmida tiene 41 años. Y tres hijos. Uno de los cuales le ayuda con la atención del negocio. Ha logrado crear dentro de la familia un sentimiento de ayuda que todos lo están practicando en este momento. Su esposo también se dedica a limpiar casas. Luego de su trabajo le ayuda con la atención de sus clientes. Su casita es de caña y piso de tierra. Espera con la ayuda del crédito y sus ahorros poco a poco construirla de cemento.

loans.use: To invest in kitchen utensils and basic food products/Invertir en utensilios de cocina y viveres

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana is a student at the Del Valle University. In order to pay for her studies she works selling perfumes and cosmetics at offices and universities and to friends. Her collections are every two weeks.

Her home is located in the Villa Fátima neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is single and has over 2 years of work experience, since she used to work with her mother who was also a perfume promoter, and now she is independent.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO. The requested amount will be destined to pay for her boarding and tuition at the University. She is in the final years, and the previous loans she was granted were used for payment of boarding at the University, which is private.

Viviana is a client who, with her effort and the help of IMPRO, is at the point of achieving becoming a professional. Her work allows approval of this loan and provides income to cover the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Viviana es estudiante de la Universidad del Valle, y para poder pagara sus estudios se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos, en las oficinas, universidades y amigos, y sus cobros son quincenales.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene experiencia de trabajo mas de 2 años, ya que anteriormente trabajaba con su madre que también era promotora de perfumes y actualmente es independiente.

Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para el pago de pensiones y tutoría en la universidad ya que Viviana esta en los últimos años, y los anteriores créditos que se le otorgaron fueron para el pago de pensiones a la Universidad, que es Privada.

Viviana es una cliente que con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de Impro esta a punto de lograr ser profesional. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito y le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To pay for boarding at the University.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Rosa Isabel is 38 years old. She only completed her studies until the end of primary school. She lives in Caserio De Simon Bolivar in the district of Usquil in the Otuzco providence, within the community of La Libertad. She has 2 younger children that depend on her.

At a young age she learned how to plant, harvest, and sell potatoes, barley, broad beans and other grains from her parents. She didn’t continue school because there were no nearby high schools within her community. Also, she couldn’t go to another community to study because her parents depended on her to help them by working. She got married at age 16 and her needs increased. Her father helped her by lending her a small amount of money to start her business. With this loan she bought potatoes and grains in bulk. She then began working independently.

She needed more money to grow her business and accepted the invitation of her neighbor to increase her income by joining a community finance group. With her first loan of $96 dollars she bought potatoes, barley and other grains. Little by little her business started growing. Presently she distributes her products weekly in the main markets of Trujillo. Thanks to this business she was able to buy land and cultivate her own produce to sell. From the most recent loan she was able to buy potatoes by bulk and dry them to sell dried ground potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosa Isabel tiene 38 años de edad y solo estudió hasta primaria completa, vive en el Caserío de Simón Bolivar en el distrito de Usquil de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que depende de ella. Desde muy pequeña aprendió de sus padres a trabajar en la siembra, cosecha y venta de papa, cebada, habas y otros cereales. No pudo seguir estudiado porque en su comunidad no había colegio del nivel secundaria y no podía ir más lejos porque no había quien ayude a sus padres. Se casó a los 16 años y sus necesidades se incrementaron, su papá le prestó una pequeña cantidad de dinero para que empezara su negocio, compró papa y cereales en pequeña cantidad y empezó a trabajar en forma independiente. Necesitaba mayor capital para incrementar su negocio y acepta la invitación de una vecina para ingresar al Banco Comunal “Estrella Resplandeciente”. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 ($96 aprox.) compró mayor cantidad de papa, olluco, cebada, habas y otros cereales, y poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo. En la actualidad distribuye semanalmente estos productos en los principales mercados de Trujillo. Gracias a este negocio pudo comprar tierras de cultivo donde siembra estos productos. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500.00 ($.500.00 aprox.) pagaderos en 4 cuotas, comprará papas al por mayor para dejarlo secar y vender papa seca molida

loans.use: Buy potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Mataumai

texts.en: Mataumai is a 50-year-old married mother. She lives in the eastern side of the island of Upolu which is about 50 kilometers from the main town. Her husband has been a farmer all his life. In Lona Fagaloa most of the people live on farms that produce Ava (a Samoan plant whose juice is used in traditional ceremonies) since the type of soil in the area is a bit dry as it is mostly surrounded by mountains. For so many years they have struggled to improve their family’s living standards. When she joined SPBD, Mataumai managed to improve things gradually. With her second loan, she will buy equipment for her Ava plantings as well as for home renovations.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her farm

loans.name: Yassar

texts.en: Yassar is a 30-year-old married man. He lives in the Bekaa with his wife and 2 children. Yassar repairs the vehicles. He fixes cars' wheels etc. This is the fourth time Yassar is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. Yassar is an honest, reliable and hard working man. He requests $1,200 to buy tools and materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials for vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Munaku B(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Hellen is 30 years old and married with five children. She sells raw matooke (a foodstuff) in the market. She intends to use the extra profits to repay the loan. Safina has a drug shop and wants to use the loan to increase her stock. Jennifer has a retail shop while Cate works in a hotel.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke for sale.

loans.name: Steria

texts.en:
Steria, 40 years old, is married with four children, ages 22, 18, 14 and 12. Steria owns a small shop that she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Steria has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth belongs to the Progress Communal Bank. She has a business making cleaning products, located in Ancash in the Huaraz region of Peru. She is 39 years old, married and has three children; her husband helps her with the work and the children's education.

With the $225 loan, which she plans to repay in four months, she will purchase 20 liters of pine oil, 20 kilograms of fragrances and 6 of dyes.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margoth, pertenece al Banco Comunal el progreso, tiene su negocio de elaboración de productos de limpieza, su negocio esta ubicado en el Pasaje alva Jurado 1091,ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 20 litros de Aceite de Pino, 20 kilos de Esencias, 6 sobres de colorantes. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, ambos comparten el trabajo, y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cleaning supplies / Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para su negocio

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith belongs to the community bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located at 500 Aguaytia Avenue, in the distric of Manaytay in the city of Ucayali. She is 67 years old is mother to 6 children, her husband is an independent worker. With the first loan Judith received from Manuel Ramos in the amount of S/.300 she decided to invest it in the sales of candy suckers.

Today she depends on her small grocery store, and renting lodging, and with the help of her children and husband she manages the grocery store and administer the room rentals.

With the loan she received in the amount of S/.1200 which she will repay in a term of 4 months, she will purchase construction materials to build more rooms to rent, and she will also purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

Judith feels happy that she is able to develop and expand her busienss every day, she is a hard working woman with a great deal of vitality.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en la Av. Aguaytia 500, del Distrito D. Manaytay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 67 años es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es trabajador independiente, es así que Judith con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. chupetes. En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega, y alquiler D. cuartos, con la ayuda D. sus hijos y su esposo atienD. su bodega y administran su alquiler D. cuartos. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/.1,200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará materiales D. construcción para construir mas cuartos, también comprará abarrotes para su bodega. Judith se siente contenta pueD. avanzar y crecer cada día con su negocio, es una mujer luchadora y con una gran vitalidad,

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her sales.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Señora Inés, 53 years old and mother of four, belongs to the Communal Bank "Virgen de la Natividad," located in the district of Manantay and the state of Ucayali. Her husband runs a business but his income is not enough to raise the family. With her first loan from our institution, Manuela Ramos, Inés decided to invest in a stand selling cold drinks. She now has a small soda fountain made from her profits. She sells cold drinks, snacks and her clients enjoy good service and good music from early in the morning until 10 at night. With the intense heat in our region [of Peru], her business has a lot of demand.

With her US$275 4-month loan, she will buy a large variety of soft drinks, sparkling water and snacks. Inés feels good; the loans are a help to her and her business. She enjoys the time spent during the meetings and talks with her community bank because she learns a lot and is responsible in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Inés pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi S/N, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comernciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia. Inés con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de bebidas heladas. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas construyo una fuente de soda, donde vende sus bebidas heladas, golosinas, a sus clientes que gozan de una buena atención y excelente música, atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas hasta las 10 pm., con el calor fuerte de nuestra región sus bebidas tiene mucha demanda. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará gaseosa de todos los preciso y tamaños, agua mineral, golosinas en general. Inés se siente muy tranquila, los prestamos son una ayuda para ella y su negocio, le distrae mucho cuando tiene reuniones y charlas con su banco comunal por que aprende mucho y es responsable en sus pagos.

loans.use: Increase the quantity and variety at her soda fountain

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi H., 47 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2005. Her family lives near the river; therefore, it is very convenient for her to invest in river transportation. Her family owns a shop for building materials. Because the materials usually arrive by boats which anchor near her house, she decides to buy boats to carry her materials. She earns 20-30 USD/day. She also helps 10 other local people in finding jobs with a wage of 100 USD/month. She has 3 children who are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 800 USD to buy fuel for her boats. Her average income is 625 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Hiệp 47 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thưong năm 2005, gia đình chị sống gần bờ sông rất thuận lợi cho việc đầu tư kinh doanh bến bãi và vận tải đường thủy. Hiện nay gia đình chị có bãi kinh doanh vât liệu xây dựng phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân trong khu vực, việc vận chuyển vật liệu về tập kết tại bến thường xuyên vì vậy gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua thuyền chuyên vận chuyển vât liệu, với việc kinh doanh đó gia đình chị thu nhập đều đặn hàng ngày 300.000đ đến 400.000đ, gia đình chị cũng tạo công ăn việc làm cho 10 lao động là người địa phương với thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng, chị có 3 con hiện đang trong độ tuổi ăn học.Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 13.000.000đ mua nhiên liệu chạy thuyền. Thu nhập bình quân. 10.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: buy fuel for boats that carry building material

loans.name: Lívia Trindade

texts.pt:
Lívia Trindade P. is 33 years old and is from Chibuto in the province of Gaza in the South of Mozambique. She is married and has 3 sons - the eldest two are 3 year old twins and the youngest is only 30 days old. Lívia only has her children to support.

Lívia was in school until the 12th grade but had to stop as her school timetable was not compatible with her work schedule, seeing as she was already working whilst doing her final few grades. Lívia grew up in the city of Maputo and her job was at Cimentos de Moçambique (Cements of Mozambique), later having a contract with the Youth Board for 2 years. She lives in a rented house and is currently building her own house with the use of loans.

Lívia has been working as a Logistics administrator for Procredito for 2 years and works from 8am to 5pm every day with a one hour break. She learnt how to perform her function primarily at Cimentos de Moçambique and from some other institutions she has been in. She has a monthly salary of 14000,00 MZN and saves 8000,00 MZN a month.

This is Lívia's first loan, having heard of Hluvuku through friends. Her great dream in life is to own her own house so she can stop renting and being dependent on someone else for her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Lívia Trindade P. tem 33 anos de idade, natural de Chibuto província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique. Casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos, os dois primeiros são gemeos e tem 3 anos e o ultimo tem 30 dias. Lívia não sustenta ninguém para alem dos seus filhos.

Lívia estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por incompatibilidade do seu horário de trabalho uma vez que os últimos níveis fez ja trabalhando. Lívia cresceu na cidade de Maputo e o seu emprego foi na Cimentos de Moçambique, e mais tarde veio a ter um contrato com Direção da Juventude por dois anos. Vive numa casa de aluguer e neste momento atraves dos empréstimos está a construir sua casa.

Lívia é funcionária da Procredito como administrativa da Logistica a dois anos e tem um Horário das 8 as 17h por dia com uma interopção de uma hora. Aprendeu a exercer tais tarefas primeiramente na cimentos de Moçambique e em outras instituições que passo nelas. Tem um salário mensal de 14000,00mt e poupa mensalmente 8000,00mt.

Para Lívia este é o seu primeiro empréstimo e conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas. Tem como grande sonho na vida dela é ter sua casa própria para parar de aluguer casa e depender de alguem.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials with which to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: ibrahima D. est  un jeune tailleur né le 10/10/1978 à thiès .il est célibataire et loge chez ses parents à la cité lamy de thiès .il a une expérience de 12 ans dans son métier et gère son atelier près du marché .il a 3 apprentis et dispose d'équipement moderne .c'est pour faire face à la demande du marché qu'il sollicite cette somme .
texts.en:
Ibrahima D. is a young tailor, born on Oct 10, 1978 in Thies, Senegal. He is single and lives with his parents in the Cité Lamy neighborhood of Thies. He has 12 years experience in his trade and runs his own workshop near the market. He has three apprentices and up-to-date equipment. He is requesting this loan in order to meet market demands.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric for making garments

loans.name: Abejitas (The Little Bees) Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Villa Exaltación  de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Abejitas” 
Un grupo formado por 10 mujeres, grupo muy simpático que  junto  a su asesora de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucho entusiasmo para mejorar en sus negocios.
La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con hijos de distintas edades, nos cuentan  que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares crecen cada vez mas y los ingresos que tienen ya no son suficientes para cubrir necesidades mínimas de sus hogares.
Este grupo se dedica principalmente a la elaboración de alimentos, preparan variedad de pastelitos, empanadas  y otras exquisiteces en el área de la repostería, también elaboran almuerzos y otros platillos en restaurantes ubicados  en la  ciudad de El Alto y en la localidad de Desaguadero, Necesitan mayor capital para la compra de insumos
texts.en:
In the zone Villa Exaltación in the city of El Alto, you will find a central location with this same name. To this belongs the group “Abejitas” (“The little bees”), a group made up of 10 women, a very kind group who together with their loan officer, work with Pro-Mujer with lots of enthusiasm to improve their businesses. The majority of them are married with children of different ages. They have realized that the daily expenses that they have in their homes grow each day more, and the incomes that they have already are not sufficient to cover the minimal necessities of their homes. This group is primarily dedicated to food preparation. They make a variety of sweets, empanadas, and other exquisite bits of confectionary. They also make lunches and other plates in the restaurants located in the city of El Alto and in the area of Desaguadero. They need more capitol in order to buy ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need funds to purchase ingredients

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya has been selling domestic tools in Zanzibar since 1994. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children, ages 3 and 5.

She works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $250. She is hoping that this loan enables her to buy more items for her to sell for profit at her shop.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of domestic tools for her shop

loans.name: Audelia

texts.es:
Audelia inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra, ya que su esposo percibe un sueldo bajo y los gastos de su casa iban creciendo además de los gastos escolares de sus 2 hijos de 13 y 5 años,  es por esto que ella comenzó hace 2 años con la venta de zapatos y poco después con la venta de productos de plástico para el hogar  y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien combinando estas actividades.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 3,000 MXN que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mercancía ofrecer a sus clientes mejor calidad y surtido, y así incrementar  sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Audelia started the business to generate extra income, given that her husband’s salary is low and the household expenses kept growing, including the school-related costs for their two children ages 13 and 5. It’s for this reason that two years ago she started selling shoes, and shortly thereafter began selling plastic products for the home. To date, these combined activities have gone very well for her.

She needs a loan of 3,000MXN, to be repaid in six months, so she can buy merchandise to offer her customers a better quality and variety of goods and that way increase her earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Sivorn N. is a 43-year-old widow who lives in Preak Ta Aung Tybey village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a mat maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more raw materials. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She has four children, two of whom work in different jobs, while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to support a mat-making business.

loans.name: Gabriel Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is a member of the Señor de Luren Village Bank, which is named after the patron saint of the city of Ica. Cirilo is 42 years old and is separated with five children. He has two businesses: he works as a taxi driver and also has his own carpentry workshop. He is mostly driving the taxi now, since wood has become more expensive recently and there is less demand for his skills as a carpenter. He has been driving his taxi for seven years, and has had the carpentry workshop for fifteen years.  

Cirilo is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to fix up his car. He plans to put in new upholstery and buy new tires. His goal for the future is to buy a motorcycle taxi next year so that his 15-year-old son can drive it.

loans.use: New tires and upholstery for taxi

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi B. is 31 years old and married with a child. She has been in the business of selling shoes and bags for more than 10 years. She hopes to own her own boutique in the future. She needs aloan amount of N50,000 to purchase additional shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and Lapo microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
“Hard work and patience are virtues one needs to become a successful entrepreneur” said Marites D., a micro- entrepreneur living in the village of Rizal, Santiago City.  

Marites operates her gown rental and catering businesses. Aside from these, she also sells frozen foods in their village for extra income to support the education of their children especially that her eldest child is about to entercollege this school year.  Her weekly income is carefully budgeted for their daily needs, school allowance and working capital for her businesses.  She wants to improve and develop her businesses for her family. For her gown rental business, she wants to avail a loan of PHP5,000.  She believes that to become successful, she needs to trust in her own ability and have faith in God.  

Her husband Jimmy is engaged in farming.  Their children are: Zyrene Andrella,16, a senior high school student and Wyndie Reeze,12, a graduating elementary student.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Solange's Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Solange N. who lives in the Nyarugenge district of the capital city Kigali, Rwanda! Nine years ago, Solange started a business selling men's and women's clothing.  She employs one person to help her run the shop and earns approximately 116,000 Rwandan Francs in profit each month ($230 USD).   Solange is requesting a loan worth 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company, S.A. to expand her business. Specifically, she hopes to increase her inventory by buying clothing in bulk to sell to her clients.  She will repay this loan over eight months on a monthly basis.

Solange is 26 years old and married with three children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sa Rorn Sin Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people who live in Daeum Doung village in Takeo province make up this village bank group and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sa Rorn S. was selected to be the village bank president by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Chin Khum, is a fruit seller. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it and he needs a motorbike to transport the fruit to sell. Mrs. Sa Rorn S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to bU. a motorbike for her husband’s business. She is twenty-seven years old with two children who are five years old and four months old.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Faavevela

texts.en:
Faavevela F., 36, is married with 5 children. She has 4 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village people/public 4 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

She had 2 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Faavevela’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She wants to use this loan to buy another fishing net, help pay for her children's school fees, and improve her home.

loans.use: Buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Cette femme a commencé depuis 2005 le commerce de charbons de bois, ce commerce marche bien pour elle, elle fait ce commerce en gros et en détail, étant la seule dans son quartier à exercer cette activité, elle arrive donc à réaliser d’importantes recettes. Elle veut agrandir son commerce pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays plus précisément dans la ville de Sokodé parce que dans cette ville le sac de charbon de bois est moins coûteux. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle contribue avec son époux aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
In 2005, this woman started doing commerce in charcoal. Her business is doing well, operating wholesale and retail. Being the only one in her district in this business, she therefore manages to realize sizable revenues. She wants to expand her business. To do so, she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten from inland locations, in the city of Sokodé to be precise, because charcoal is less expensive there. She is married and the mother of three. With what she earns from her commerce, she helps her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Juana  Matilde

texts.es: Doña Juana Matilde  R. con residencia de la comunidad de poxlajuj del Departamento de Totonicapan, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa para dama en los municipio de Totonicapan, Salcaj, Quetzaltenango y San Francisco el Alto, desde hace diez años viene realizado dicha activida hoy necesita de un credito para surtir su mercaderia ya por la competencia que existe hoy necesita surtir su mercaderia ya que una de sus hijas sabe hacer bordados y la cual necesita de un capital muy fuerte para poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Matilde R. lives in the Poxlajuj Community in the department of Totonicapan. Her main business activity is selling women’s apparel in the municipalities of Totonicapan, Salcaj, Quetzaltenango, and San Francisco el Alto. She has been in business for 10 years. She now needs a loan so that she can restock her business with more merchandise. Because of the competition, she now needs to stock up with items. One of her daughters knows how to make embroidery, so she needs solid capital to be able to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 27-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children.

Hasan has owned a scrap metal business since 1998. He requested a loan of $800 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more scrap metal and also some items for the new baby. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped Hasan to buy important missed things for his house. He is special in his work because he buys scrap metal and sells used iron. His clients are old customers. When he first started his business, he faced difficulties in getting along with new customers.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal and also some items for the new baby

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena A. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a son and three daughters. The children are currently in school: senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Helena is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar. Helena prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes – ‘fufu’, ‘banku’, etc. Her chop bar is located at the lorry station in her community. She wants a loan to buy food items and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Helena has been in business for three years. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 42 years old. She is a married and resourceful mother to her family. She has given birth to five children and three of them are in school. Cecilia has five years experience in selling. She prepares and sells pastries, like meat pie and doughnuts. She says it is a very lucrative business and she loves her work. She purchased her stock of raw materials from the Kumasi central market. Occasionally, she buys the ingredients at her community market. Demand for her pastries is on the rise because of its taste and moderate price. She wants a loan to buy bags of flour, margarine and yeast to enhance her business growth. She saves part of her profit to help her husband pay the children’s school bills.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, yeast etc.

loans.name: Martha Oralia

texts.es:
La  señora Martha Oralia Ramírez tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de arreglos flóreles. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para darle lo mejor a su hijo que tiene bajo su responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera.
Últimamente le está haciendo falta material y armaduras para realizar los arreglos, pero no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y las armaduras que necesita para poder tener variedad de arreglos. Y así tendrá más ingreso al negocio y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Oralia Ramírez has spent more than six years making and selling flower arrangements. This business is her source of income, which allows her to give the best to her child, who is under her care because she is a single mother. As of late, she is lacking material and frames to make her arrangements, but she doesn’t have the money necessary to make the investment. Because of this, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the material and the frames that she needs so that she can have a variety of arrangements. In this way, she will have more income, from which she plans to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and frame for garlands

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maritza es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, de 1 y 10 años de edad, en el distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años y medio se dedica al comercio de pescado, todos los días lunes y viernes va a la terminal pesquero del lugar a comprar una variedad de pescado llamado caballa, que es muy consumido en la región, para luego procesarlo y venderlo como pescado salado en el mercado del distrito de Olmos los días sábados y domingos.

Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como chofer de autos que brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros y lo percibido por ambos sirve para solventar los gastos económicos de su hogar; poco a poco han llegado a comprar un lote de terreno y construir su casa que aún no está terminada,.

Por este motivo ella está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en una ampliación de su negocio con la compra de más pescado para procesarlo, venderlo; a la vez, generarse los recursos suficientes que le permitan terminar de construir su hogar.

Maritza goza de muy buenas referencias laborales, por lo que fue recomendada por muchos clientes de nuestra Institución que laboran en su misma actividad y que conocen de su responsabilidad y su entrega por sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 30 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children (ages 10 and 1) in the district of Santa Rosa, located 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For two and a half years, she has worked as a fish merchant. Every day, Monday through Friday, she goes to the fishing terminal to purchase mackerel, which is widely consumed in the region. She processes it and sells it as “pescado salado” (salted fish) at the market in Olmos District every Saturday and Sunday.

Her husband works as a chauffeur who provides transportation services to passengers. They both contribute to the household income. Over time they were able to save enough money to purchase a plot of land and start construction of a house that has not yet been finished.

Maritza is applying for her first loan from our Institution in the amount of 800 soles so that she can expand her business. She plans to buy more fish for processing and resale so that she can generate sufficient income and complete the construction of her home.

Maritza has very good work references, since she was recommended by many existing clients of our Institution who are in the same business as her. They know that she is responsible and capable of succeeding.  

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mackerel for processing & resale

loans.name: Maliky

texts.en: Maliky N. is married and has five dependants. He has no educational background.  Maliky sells fish. He goes to the sea and fish for himself and sells it to buyers at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2002. His wife is a fishmonger. Manlike uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Maliky will use the loan to purchase fishing equipment and also to fuel his boat. With the new profits from his expanded business, Maliky plans to save towards building of his own house.

loans.use: Maliky will use the loan to purchase fishing equipment and also to fuel his boat.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra P. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan De Oro City. She is 42 years old. Isidra is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Isidra owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as perfumes, a variety of clothing, lotion, shampoo and others in the local community. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Isidra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Isidra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nipasin

texts.en:
Nipasin E. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour.

Nipasin is 45 years old and is married to a husband who is a builder. She has 5 children and four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking flour

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
36-year-old Mila T. wants to be successful in her rice farm business. She has eight children. Her eldest child is 15 years old and soon will enroll in college to pursue a degree. She wants to save money for her child’s college educational needs even if it means that she needs to work hard all day. 

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy farming needs. The loan will definitely help her achieve a maximum harvest and a better income for her family.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Mrs. Marichel P. is a 28-year-old, married and living at Punta Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She has two school-aged children. Her husband is a fisherman, and this is their primary source of income. Her husband's catch is sold at the public market or to their neighbors. Their fishing business sustains their daily needs despite weather conditions.

Marichel joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to help them with financial assistance. This is her first loan amounting to 5,000 PHP which will be used to acquire more fish to be sold because the catch of her husband is not enough. In the future, she hopes to own a stall in the public market to display their fish.

loans.use: buying fish to be sold in the neighborhood

loans.name: Resureccion

texts.en:
Resureccion P. is from the village of Macabayao in Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Resureccion is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Resureccion owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Resureccion has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Resureccion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resureccion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy additional products to sell. Resureccion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Resureccion's 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia has been a member of ASHI since 2003 and has an excellent performance. She is 62, married, and has two grandchildren who are now independent of her. They live at Morong, Rizal, Philippines. Her children already have their own living with their partners in life.

Facing the necessity of supporting the household and being self-motivated, Artemia started a small business of sewing RTW (ready to wear clothes). She started it with Php 5,000 and she has gotten results from the beginning because of the quality of her products, the reasonable prices, and the good attention she gives to the customers. She currently continues with the same business, which is located in her own house. Her main customers are her neighbors and people at the market.

Artemia will use this loan of PHP 40,000 to stock her business, like buying Tela (cotton) for curtains, jeans, shorts, blouses, and pajamas for a broader expansion of her business and to buy other products to keep her customers happy.

Artemia now feels very happy about her work and the service that ASHI and Kiva provide, offering her big opportunities to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to them for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue this way for a long time and help many families and enterprising women.

loans.use: To purchase tela (cotton) for curtains, jeans, shorts, blouses, pajamas, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two beautiful children. Her children are in school in the community where they live. Amalia works hard to support her husband in taking care of the family. She is a trader and trades in goods like scarves, and local slippers for women and children.

She also sells drugs like Viagra and other drugs for those who have low sperm counts. She said her business is doing well as most men patronize the sale of the drugs. She takes delivery of stock from importers and retails them to her loyal customers through selling in the community and its surrounding villages. Amalia has been in business for the last eight years to support her children. She is requesting the loan to buy bulk supply of stock so that she can increase her profits. She saves part of her profits in a bank for future eventualities and hopes to pay back the loan in time. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy drugs, locally made slippers and scarves in bulk.

loans.name: Violeta Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Violeta Azucena L. tiene ya más de seis año dedicándose a la venta de joyería de oro y plata. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía ya que en la temporada de navidad de le termino. Esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar la inversión y así tener más inventario que ofrecer a sus clientas. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Ramos Ruiz quien trabaja en una agencia aduanal como atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Señora Violeta Azucena L. has been selling gold and silver jewelry for over six years. Her inventory is running low now that the Christmas season has ended. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more inventory and offer a wider selection of jewelry to her clients. She plans to pay for the loan with her earnings from her business since the household expenses are paid for by her husband, señor Ramos Ruiz, who works in customer service at a customs agency.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the town of Barangcuag Jones. She is 60 years old. Erlinda is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Erlinda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.en:
Maksuda D. is 45 years old. She is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her 4 children and provide for their education. Maksuda has 5 years of experience selling dried fruits. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Maksuda requests 4000 Somoni for purchasing dried fruits with the purpose of processing them in order increase the range of her goods for sale. Maksuda expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
A big success starts with small steps. People who want much at once are doomed to disappointment, because a big role belongs to patience and resolution, The heroes of this story cannot boast grandiose success in their lives, but they are on that path.

Farida is the leader of this group. She is thirty-four years old. She lives in the small city of Tokmok. Many people of her age have left the city to work in Russia or neighboring Kazakhstan. Farida and her husband, despite a very difficult economic condition and poor job opportunities, have decided to stay in the city. At this moment her husband earns his family’s living by working as a taxi driver. Farida owns a pavilion. She trades in vegetables and different kinds of foodstuffs. Trading in the pavilion brings her a monthly income of $230. During her twenty years of selling vegetables, Farida has been able to buy a flat and a car. At this moment she needs a loan to purchase foodstuffs and vegetables. Farida lives with her family in a detached house and some of her future plans are to make a repair at her house, buy new furniture and put up new gates.

The following people are Farida’s partners:

Alymkan is fifty-two. Her husband is a taxi driver. Alymkan would happily stay at home and be a housewife; however, working as a taxi driver brings her husband only $140, so Alymkan decided to help her husband by selling patties. Alymkan needs a loan to increase the turnover.

Elmira is thirty-four. She has two daughters, both of whom go to school. Her husband provides welding services. Elmira is engaged in a furniture business. She purchases old furniture, repairs it, and resells it at market. This business brings her $185 a month. Elmira needs a loan to invest in her business.

Nurkanbek is twenty-two. He is single. For a living he manufactures small chests in his own workshop and takes the chests to Bishkek to sell them there. Nurkanbek has applied for this loan as he hopes to buy materials for manufacturing.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of their customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our lending team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Livera

texts.en: Livera B. is from the village of Aquiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Livera is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Livera operates a store to sell rice by the kilo in the local community. Livera has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Livera joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Livera is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Livera from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As the mother of three children, Marilyn J., who is 41 years old, dreams of having a sustainable livelihood for her family.

Currently Marilyn has a farm where she grows and sells rice to provide her children with all their needs. The income that she makes from growing rice helps to pay for school tuition and books and also helps to pay the daily costs in their home.

Marilyn desires to add to her business capitalization. She wants to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will go far in buying fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Ahmadalieva Sobirahon`s Group

texts.ru:
Собирахон 51 лет. Она разведенная мать 3 детей. У нее есть один сын и двое дочерей-близняшки.Сын частный водитель, дочери на заработках в РФ. Клиент занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение овец и реализация молочных продуктов. Клиентка ранее работала в г. Мархамат в Хлопчатобумажном комбинате, после того как закрыли границу она стала дома разводить овец, сын закупал и откармливал, через месяц продавал.Сейчас она хочет закупить 10 овец и отправить на пастбище.

Мавлюдахон, 51, замужем. Ее супруг частный строитель. Старший сын на заработках в РФ, старшая дочь помощница в бизнесе, две младшие школьники. Она вместе с семьей занимается животноводством, откорм и разведения и реализация молочной продуктов. Бизнес был начат с того, что продав овца закупили корову, затем стали реализовывать молоко. Доход был хорошим. Она в день реализует 7-8 лт молока, доход в месяц составляет 80 долларов. Кредит будет использован для закупа строй материалы для стройки дома.

Сайерахон 40 лет. Она вдова с 4 детьми. Старший сын помогает матери по бизнесу и хозейству, средний сын работает в чайхане, младший сын и дочь учатся в школе. Они занимаются животноводством.В 2008 году продав телку закупила беременную корову, которая после пол года родила теленка. Настоящее время клиентка активно занимается реализацией молока.Она хочет закупить 300 кг цемента и другие строй материалы для ремонта дома, также купить корм для живности на кредит.

Осудахон, 45, замужем. Ее супруг строитель.Дочь Дилором зарабатывает в г.Бишкек в швейном цехе, старший сын помогает по хозяйству, младший ходит в школу.'Она выращивает и реализует хлопок.Сейчас планирует закупить мин. удобрения и семена хлопчатника, также купить ГСМ для распашки земли.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Sobirahon is 51 years old. She is a divorced mother of 3 children. She has one son and two twin daughters. Her son is private driver, and the daughters are working in Russia. The client is involved in animal husbandry: feeding and breeding sheep and selling dairy products. The client previously worked in the town of Marhamat at a cotton manufacturing factory, and after the border was closed, she started breeding sheep at home. Her son bought and fattened the livestock and sold it a month later. Now, Sobirahon wants to buy 10 sheep and send them to a pasture. Mavludahon is 51 years old, married. Her husband is a construction contractor. The oldest son is working in Russia, oldest daughter is an assistant in the business, and the two youngest daughters are in school. Mavludahon and her family are involved in animal husbandry, feeding and breeding and sales of dairy products. The business was started with a sale of one sheep and purchase of a cow and then grew into dairy products sales. The income was good. Mavludahon sells 7-8 liters of milk per day, and her monthly income is 80 dollars. The loan will be used for the purchase of construction materials to build a house. Sayorahon is 40 years old. She is a widow and has 4 children. The oldest son helps his mother with the business and household, the middle son works at a teahouse, and the youngest son and daughter go to school. They are involved in animal husbandry. Sayorahon, having sold a cow in 2008, bought a pregnant cow, who birthed a calf half of a year later. Currently, the client is actively involved in sales of dairy products. She wants to buy 300 kg of cement and other construction materials in order to repair her house. She also wants to buy livestock feed. Osudahon is 45 years old, married. Her husband is a construction worker. Her daughter, Dilorom, works at a sewing factory in Bishkek, oldest son helps with the household, and the youngest goes to school. Osudahon grows and sells cotton. Currently, she plans to buy mineral fertilizers and cotton seeds and also fuel for plowing the land.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 sheep

loans.name: Concern Women Group

texts.en:
Watta S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Concern Women. She is 42 years old, married, and has a 10 year old child. She also cares for 2 siblings. She did not have the opportunity to go school because her parents did not have the opportunity.

For 4 years, Watta has been selling building materials at Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She sells her materials at a low price which keeps her customers returning. Watta started selling with 5,000.00 Liberian Dollars as working capital. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more building materials. Her goal is to grow her business and expand to every part of Liberia.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Watta is the one holding the sign. Inset at the lower right is Fanta F..

loans.use: To buy more building materials.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour contribuer aux charges familiales, elle fait le commerce de pagnes.
Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et expose ses pagnes sous un hangar à Adidogomé. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat d’un nouvel arrivage de pagnes pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
This 43-year old lady is married and mother to one child. In order to contribute to the family expenses she sells "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric). She gets her supplies in Lomé and displays her "pagnes" in a shed in Adidogomé. She is requesting this loan to buy a new arrival of "pagnes" in order to attract new customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Yazmin Yamara

texts.es: Yazmin Yamara es una joven que le gusta ir prosperando poco a poco sobre todo por que es madre de familia por quien tiene que salir a delante. Su esposo es un hombre que trabaja en maquiladora pero Yazmin para apoyarlo con los gastos se dedica a la venta de ropa usada actividad que realiza los fines de semana en las pulgas. Este negocio ya tiene un año al que en este momento desea invertir más para que le siga generando más ganancias.
texts.en:
Yazmin Yamara is a young woman who likes to advance little by little. She does this primarily because she is a mother and she has to get ahead. Her husband works in a factory. In order to help him with the expenses, Yazmin sells used clothes. She does this at the flea markets on the weekends. She has had this business for one year. Now she wants to invest more so that she can keep generating more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
N. Immaculate is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka area of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Immaculate has a business selling bunches of bananas to the townspeople of Kalisizo.

To expand her business, Immaculate is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy 30 or more bunches of bananas, which she then hopes to sell in the market.  Immaculate hopes to generate profit from selling bananas to enable her to develop her business and sell other types of goods.


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more product (bananas) to resell

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Madame Abla M. is 63 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo, where she sells cakes made from wheat flour. She is a widow and she has three children. She has been selling these little cakes, which are very popular here in Lome, since 2002.

Now she is requesting her third loan from WAGES for 250,000 CFA in order to purchase more wheat flour and some aluminum bowls she uses to prepare the cakes.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and aluminum bowls

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 30 years old. Her business is located along the main Market Road in Makeni. She has been selling gara (locally dyed) clothes for the past four years. Mariatu is a dedicated and very determined businesswoman. She starts work at 7.00am and returns home at 6.30pm. She was able to access funds from her relatives to begin her trade in gara clothes.
Mariatu has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to help her buy more gara materials for resale. In this way, she will make more profit. She intends to use the proceeds of this loan to pay college fees.

loans.use: To buy gara (locally dyed) clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy vegetables by the "quintal"  (one quintal is 46kg) and by the case, carrots, squash, cabbage, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions, etc.

loans.name: Fanny Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny Leonor Ávila es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive en la comunidad  Reina del Cisne en la Parroquia de Llacao, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente por tradición   realizan los sombreros de paja toquilla, también se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Fanny se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 10 años, está muy contenta con los préstamos porque le han ayudado a mejorar  la economía de su hogar y de su negocio, trabaja como empleada privada hace 6 años, en el cual labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 y media p.m., de lunes a viernes, también se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palitos) y tiene una pequeña tienda  donde vende gaseosas, cervezas etc., la cual ya tiene 4 años.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda.

La Señora. Fanny tiene 46 años, está separada de su marido, tiene un hijo  de 15 años que estudia en el colegio, gracias a su trabajo tiene casa propia. Su meta es hacer varios arreglos a su casa ya que aun no está terminada.
texts.en:
Señora. Fanny Leonor Ávila is a member of the Atenas community bank. She lives in the community of Reina del Cisne in Llacao parish. It is well known for its people and their tradition of weaving hats out of toquilla straw. They also raise animals and work in agriculture. Fanny has been a member of her community bank for ten years and is very happy with the loans as they have helped her to improve the financial situation of both her family and her business. She has worked as a private domestic servant for six years and works from 8 am to 3:30 pm, Monday to Friday. She also sells chuzos (strips of meat on a stick) and has had a small business where she sells soft drinks, beer etc. for four years. Fanny will use the loan to buy more products for her store. She is 46 years old and separated from her husband. Her son is 15 years old and is a high school student. Because of her hard work, she has a house of her own. Her goal is complete the renovations to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs etc

loans.name: Nassiri

texts.en:
Nassiri J., 38, is married to Hamida Lyunus, and he supports their entire family by himself. He lives in Chaani Magongo, Mombasa. He has owned and run a restaurant for eight years, and he makes a good enough income to cater to his and his family’s needs.

This will be Nassiri’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase food inventories for his restaurant and use the anticipated profit to boost the business. In the future J. hopes to open a spare auto parts shop.

loans.use: To purchase food inventories for his restaurant

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en:
Terisita R., from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, is 35 years old, single, and has three school-aged children.
