To make a living, Terisita owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Terisita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from ASKI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting her fourth loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Terisita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Justino Adolfo

texts.es: Justino Adolfo es un hombre responsable y que busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos pues él se encuentra muy emocionado con este crédito que es una oportunidad para salir adelante con su negocio. El se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de taxi, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha buscado la forma de mejorar sus ingresos de la mejor manera posible de mantener a sus 2 hijos menores de edad y su esposa. La mayoría de sus clientes se sienten satisfecho por el servicio que ofrece. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como llantas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Justino Adolfo is a responsible man who is looking for a way to improve his income.  

He is very excited about this loan, which is his opportunity to get ahead with his business.

He has been in the business of providing taxi service for over 13 years.  He has looked for the way to improve his income in the best possible manner in order to support his two minor children and his wife.

The loan is to buy raw materials like tires, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth Zaddock M. is forty-two years old and is married to a teacher. They have four children aged between twelve and six years old and they hope to give their children a good education through the university level. His business is located in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane. It is widely known as the "sugar belt region." He has a motorcycle, which he uses for transport to serve the local people. Besides this business, Kenneth owns a retail shop in which he sells general items. He has been in this business for the last eight years. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is that there are many other people in the area doing the same kind of business he is doing, so customers are not loyal, as they have plenty of choices. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stock of soft drinks to boost his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks as stock for his general store

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Naranbaatar is a 33-year-old single man who lives with his mother and two younger brothers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His father passed away when he was child. He is the eldest son in the family, and he started to work straight after high school to help his mother. Together with his mother, he managed to provide a university education to his two younger brothers by paying their fees. He told us that now it is time to think about himself and that he is planning to build his own family. 

He has been running a taxi business since 2005. This year he has obtained a license to carry passengers between Ulaanbaatar and Khentii province, which is situated 360 kilometers away to the east of capital. Therefore, he is planning to sell his old car and buy a 7-seat minivan. He is one of our reliable VIP customers and the loan he is requesting will be used to pay for a new minivan to carry passengers.

loans.use: To pay for a new 7-seat minivan to carry passengers

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 49 years old, married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and three young children.  To supply additional income for her family, she is opening a local convenience store in her neighborhood.

Ma. Delia would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, canned goods and other supplies.  She believes in offering a relevant assortment and inventory of goods in her store for customers seeking convenient purchases. 

As a member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Ma. Delia is grateful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long-term goals are to expand her retail business, fund the college education of their children, build a new house, a concrete and spacious one, and to support her family financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her entrepreneurial endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, canned goods and other supplies

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina T. is from Maquilao Tangub City. She is 55 years old. Martina is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Martina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Martina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Martina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Martina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Martina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand pig farming business

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagro lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas, ellas son  Margarita del Carmen Gómez de 38 años, Ana María L. L. de 35 años y Brígida de la Concepción Mejía Vasquez de 23 años.
La señora Ana L. es la coordinadora del grupo quien es comerciante de productos Avon, Arabella, Zermat y comercializa bisutería. Ella inició con su mamá en la empresa Oriflame con la que trabajo dos años y luego empezó a trabajar con las otras empresas y como vio que necesitaba capital para poder sobre vivir de eso decidió empezar a trabajar con ayuda de los préstamos.
 Ella invertirá el préstamo en encargos de productos como cosméticos, perfumes, bisutería, cremas etc. L.  tiene dos hijos y tres hijos de crianza, y su mayor anelo es mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Margarita del Carmen Gómez madre de dos hijos se dedica al  comercializo ropa y productos Avon y Zermat y  Brígida M. de 23 años quien tiene una pequeña y espera su segundo hijo también  vende productos vía catálogo de la Avón y Zermat.
texts.en:
The group “Milagro” (Miracle) consists of three hardworking and strong women. They are Margarita del Carmen Gómez (age 38), Ana María L. L. (age 35), and Brígida de la Concepción Mejía Vasquez (age 23).

Sra. Ana L. is the group coordinator who earns her living as a merchant of Avon, Arabella, and Zermat products. She also sells trinkets. Ana and her mother started a business selling Oriflame products two years ago and later began working with other companies. Seeing that they needed capital in order to continue working, they began seeking assistance with the loans. Ana will invest the loan in products on order such as cosmetics, perfumes, trinkets, crèmes, and other items. She has five children to raise and her greatest wish is to improve the conditions of her home.

The other members of the group are Margarita del Carmen Gómez, the mother of two children who sells clothing and products manufactured by Avon and Zermat, and Brígida Mejía, who is 23 years old and has a small child. She is expecting her second child and also sells Avon and Zermat products through a catalog.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en: Mackline is a twenty nine year old hardworking woman. She is a single mother of two children living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda with a desire to educate her children. For two years she has been dealing in second hand shoes and the business is still profitable. Her business desire is to set up a boutique. Mackline needs the loan to buy supplies of shoes.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies of shoes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena L. is a married woman from the town of Panglao. She grows and fattens pigs and then sells them at the market. She also owns a small sari-sari store located at her house. Ma. Elena works hard to build her business. She hopes to be a successful entrepreneur.

Ma. Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maclovia

texts.es: La Sra. Maclovia  tiene como actividad la venta de comida en su pensión que atiende todos los dias, esta actividad se constituye en su principal fuente de ingreso para su familia que esta compuesta por su esposo, su hija y ella,  el esposo ayuda para el mantenimiento de su hogar pero el trabaja en una provincia cercana al departamento de La Paz, en esta ocasión la sra. maclovia solicita el crédito para iniciar una actividad paralela que será la apertura de una pequeña librería la cual atenderá su hija; es una familia muy trabajadora y muy dinámica este nuevo emprendimiento ayuda a generar nuevos ingresos para el beneficio de ellos.
texts.en:
Maclovia sells prepared food in her eatery daily.  This is her family’s main source of income.  Her family is composed of her husband, her daughter and herself.  Her husband helps support the household but he works in a province near La Paz department.

On this occasion, Maclovia is asking for a loan to start a parallel business that her daughter will run: a small bookstore.

This is a very hard working, dynamic family.  This new enterprise will generate new income for the benefit of them all.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to start a parallel activity.

loans.name: Lucila Esperanza

texts.es:
La sra Lucila Esperanza D. se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, cuenta con mas de seis (6) años de experiencia en venta de ropa.
doña Lucila vende su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Danli, la mayor parte de estas ventas las realiza al crédito por lo que cuenta con una gran clientela ya que algunas personas que no pueden comprar de contado ella les da la facilidad de pago.
Doña Lucila convive en unión libre y juntos han procreado dos hijos que en la actualidad ambos están cursando sus estudios secundarios en un colegio de esta ciudad.
el creedito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, desea tener mas variedad de ropa y asi tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila Esperanza D. sells new clothing. She has more than six (6) years of experience selling clothing. Lucila sells her products as a street vendor in different areas of the city of Danli. She sells most of them on credit and therefore she has a lot of customers. Some people can't pay for it up front and she facilitates payment. 

Lucila is in a common law marriage and toegther they have two children who at present go to high school in town. She will use the loan to buy clothing. She wants to have a wider variety of clothing and thus have more earnings, which she needs to get her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 26 years old and is married, with two children between 1 and 3 years old. For six years, he has owned a small shop which sells cosmetics, and so on. His business is open from 6.30am until 7pm every day.

Omar has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for his business. Omar hopes to earn more profits and to save money for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To expand his boutique

loans.name: Telma Maria

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 20,18y 13años de edad respectivamente, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, se dedica a la sastrería tiene 30 años de dedicarse a este oficio. Este es su primer negocio el cual empezó a los 13 años de edad, aprendió costura por medio de un señor que tenia un taller costura, el le enseñaba sin cobrarle nada. Estudio magisterio el cual lo ejerció durante 6 meses en un proyecto de educación para adultos. También vende cosméticos, productos de la Avon lleva 6 meses vendiendo, los distribuye en los diferentes barrios de la ciudad de Estelí, en esta actividad le ayuda a vender u hijo mayor quien vende en las calles de Estelí. A ella le gusta hacer faldas para mujer de la tela que le sobran.
Le gustaría ofertar su producto en los mercados y principales puestos de venta de Estelí. Solicita el crédito para comprar tela y un pedido de cosmético de la Avon. Espera que con este crédito le ayude a crecer su negocio , aumentar su inventario en cuanto la negocio de cosmético y en la sastrería le ayudara a realizar ropa extra para vender. 
Tiene como  planes futuros tener una tienda propia donde pueda vender sus diseños y cosméticos. Como meta próxima desea poder incrementar los pedidos de cosméticos, vender ropa nueva y sobre todo pagarle estudios universitarios a sus hijos por que es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She is a single mother and has 3 children, aged 20, 18 and 13. She is from the departament of Estelí. She has worked as a seamstress for 30 years. This is her first business, which she started when she was 13 years old. She learned sewing through a man who had a workshop. He taught her without charging her anything. She studied teaching, which she did for 6 months in a project for adult education. She also sells Avon product cosmetics. She has been selling these for 6 months. She distributes them in different neighborhoods of the city of Estelí. Her oldest son helps her in this activity, seling in the streets of  Estelí. She likes to make women's skirts with the leftover fabric. 
 
She would like to offer her products in the maekets and main sales points in  Estelí. She is asking for the loan to buy fabric and an order of Avon cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her business, increasing her inventory in the cosmetic business and helping her make extra clothes to sell in the seamstress business.  
 
Her plans for the future are to have her own store where she can sell her designs and cosmetics. Her next goal is to increase her cosmetics orders, sell new clothes and above all, pay for her children's college education, which is the best inheritance she can give them.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a cosmetics order from Avon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay other women whom she wants to hire in her business

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la comunidad de Santa Catalina en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes y una amplia gastronomía, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas amables y de un corazón muy calido.

Doña Rosa tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 16 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y la segunda en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo volquetas, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad y es el fruto del esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.  Trabaja también en sus viveros en donde siembra una gran variedad de plantas para la venta y cría animales como pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su propio sector.

Es  el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de  arroz, azúcar, detergentes, aceites, embutidos y más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es crecer mucho más en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa C. is a member of the communal bank Siempre Amigas.  She lives in the Santa Catalina community in the parish of Valle.  This parish has beautiful landscapes and a wide variety of cuisines.  The people are here work in business, agriculture and the raising of animals.  The people are friendly and warm-hearted.  

Doña Rosa is 38 years old, married and has 2 daughters, ages 16 and 10.  Both girls attend school in the city.  Her husband makes a living as a dump truck driver.  They own their own house which is the fruit of their marital working efforts. 
 
Señora Rosa has had a grocery store for 3 years.  She works 7 days a week from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.  She also works in her nursery where she grows a wide variety of plants that she sells as well as raising animals like chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her area.  

This is her third loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, oils, meats and other basic necessity products with which to stock her store.  
 
Her goal is to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, oils, meats and other basic necessity products.

loans.name: Gregoria Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Gregoria, ella es madre soltera de tres hijos uno mayor de edad  y dos de 9 y 6 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos  y sin tantos requisitos.

Ella es una gran madre que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica al comercio, vende ropa interior tanto para hombres como para mujeres,  pero agrega que lo que más vende son interiores de hombres. Trabaja  todos los días en la  terminal terrestre desde las 8 h00 hasta las 14h00 en algunos días  ya que en las tardes tiene que ir a ayudar a sus hijos en las tares de escuela. Su mercadería las compra en Picoaza, nos cuenta que lleva seis años en esta actividad y que esto le ha servido para sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior para su negocio, en especial camisetas interiores que sus clientes le piden mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener un local con vitrinas y bien surtido.
texts.en:
The “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being very commercial, for its festival of Sts. Peter and Paul and for the joyfulness of its residents.

We met Gregoria here.  He’s a single mother of three children, one adult and two who are 9 and 6 years of age and go to school.  She’s been in the communal bank for 6 years and likes it because the loans are quick and don’t have a lot of requirements.

She is a great mother who, in order that her children lack nothing, is in business.  She sells underwear for both men and women but she adds that what she sells the most is men’s underwear.  She works every day at the bus terminal from 8am until 2pm on some of the days because in the afternoon she has to go help her children with their homework.  She buys her merchandise in Picoaza and she tells us that she’s been in this business for 6 years and she has availed herself of it to support her children.

She will use this loan to buy underwear for her business, especially undershirts which have high customer demand.  Her dream is to have a locale with well stocked display cases.

loans.use: to buy underwear, especially t-shirts.

loans.name: Bolivar Eduardo

texts.es:
Bolívar de 40 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta casado y tiene tres hijos y todos ellos estudian, la esposa es ama de casa y le gusta servir en la iglesia evangélica.

El empezó desde muy pequeño le gustaba mucho la reparación de artículos eléctricos que un a vez abrió una radio para ver como se así y la termino dañando pero desde ese entonce eligió esa actividad. El es dependiente aunque en su tiempo libre hace reparaciones de computadoras desde su casa. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere mejorar su vivienda en la compra de materiales para construcción para darle una mejor vida a su familia. Quiere comprar cemento bloques, madera. En un futuro desea darle unos buenos estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bolívar, 40, lives in an urban zone of El Suburbio in Guayaquil.  He’s married and has three children who go to school.  His wife is a housewife and enjoys serving in the Evangelical Church.

He started very young because he liked very much to repair electronic items.  One time he opened up a radio to see how it was made and ended up breaking it.  However, since then he decided to go into this occupation.  He is otherwise employed but in his spare time he repairs computers at home.  

He wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve his home and provide his family with a better quality of life.  He wants to buy cement, concrete blocks and lumber.  In the future he wants to provide good schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, lumber and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old and married.

In 2000 Hasan opened a grocery store where he sells all kind of fruits, vegetables and juices. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area. 

He is requesting  a $1700 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is 58 years old and lived in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Nelie runs a mini grocery store at her home to earn a living. She sells canned goods, personal care items, packaged food, cereals, refreshments and school supplies.  She has been this business for 5 years and earns a monthly income of PHP 7,000. Nelie wanted to add to her stocks, so she went to GDMPC to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Nelie is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she wants to have a mini-mart that sells both retail and wholesale.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en: Gerlee is 42 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who operates his own taxi service business. She manages a shoe-making business in her town with the help of her younger sister. Gerlee started her business in 2005. Her products are well-appraised by her customers. Now she has many regular customers who order several shoes at a time. With her earnings she has been able to buy a car, some furniture and appliances for her family. She is an open-minded woman who says, "One must be a good person." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her shoe-making business

loans.name: Blanca Janneth

texts.es:
Blanca Janneth tiene 23 años, Es soltera vive con la madre,tiene un hijo de 3 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembra de maíz y arroz.

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta jugar con el hijo y cantar.
texts.en:
Blanca Janneth is 23 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother and 3 year old son in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Ciudadela Los Ángeles' community bank is located in Los Ángeles, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank grow corn and rice.

Blanca is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Procan and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Blanca is requesting a loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  Her dream is to own her own home.

Blanca enjoys playing with her son and singing.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 44 years old and is a married woman with a 13-year-old child. She is a farmer and tills their land together with her husband. They have been growing and selling rice for 11 years. Amelita also put up a sari-sari store to help augment their income.

Amelita is now requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at the store. She hopes to be able to buy another farm lot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Enita

texts.es: El negocio de Enita consiste en la fabricación de cigarros mapachos (cigarro regional que aleja a los malos espíritus). Este negocio lo realiza en su casa cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, su madre y algunos familiares más a quienes ella les da trabajo en esta pequeña fábrica.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder trabajar junto a sus hijos y familiares pues es una buena manera de estar cerca de ellos y poder compartir cosas, además puede disponer de tiempo para realizar diferentes actividades por las tardes. Enita tiene una gran cartera de clientes y espera poder seguir creciendo con la misma fuerza que lo ha estado haciendo hasta ahora.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Enita y MFP, le agrada mucho el grupo en el que esta ya que es una socia muy querida por todos por su responsabilidad.Con el préstamo solicitado de 2000 soles ella comprará materiales para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Enita's business is the making of mapacho cigarettes (local cigarette that keeps away evil spirits).  She runs her business from her house with the help of her children, her mother, and some other relatives who work in this small workshop. 

What she most likes about her work is to be able to work alongside her children and relatives, since this is a good way to be close to them and to share things. Also, she has time available to to do other work in the afternoons.

Anita has a long list of customers, and hopes her business will to grow as strongly as it has up to now. 

This is the third loan between Enita and MFP. She really likes the group she is in, and she is a very well liked by all because she is so responsible.

With the loan of 2000 soles she is applying for she will buy materials to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy materials to continue with her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
For the last 24 years, Tabitha has been practicing farming in Magina, Limuru town. She is a 79 year old widow.

Tabitha was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings for planting and to pay for tilling the land.

In the future, Tabitha hopes to practice large scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings for planting and to pay for tilling the land.

loans.name: Sakia

texts.en:
Sakia, a hardworking 26-year-old businesswoman, is married and blessed with one child. For the last two years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living, and within the next five years, she wants to transform it into a wholesale operation. Her dream is to buy a piece of land.

Sakia is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a weighing machine, cooking fat, maize flour, and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine, cooking fat, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Mrs. Pom is a rice cultivator from the Ornlong Veng District of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She started this business many years ago. She is married to Mr. Sak who runs a business alongside her. She and her husband have five children who are living under their care. All of her children are school-aged. The couple always works hard to provide for their children so that they could live a good lifestyle and receive a good education. She and her husband planted their rice crops two months ago but they are not growing well. Therefore, Mrs. Pom and her husband are asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds and pesticides for protection of the crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides for protection of her crops.

loans.name: Blanca Roxana

texts.es: La señora Blanca es socia integrante del banco de emprendimiento "buenas emprendedoras" se dedica a la confección y costura de  loncheras, mochilas chalequeras estuches chamarras. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de material como ser rollos de tela cintas elásticas y otros por mayor. Vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus padrinos. Mas adelante piensan en comprar un terreno y tener un hogar propio, es una persona joven trabajadora su deseo es poder tener un taller de confección mas grande y contratar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is a member of the communal bank "Buenas Emprendedoras" [Good Entrepreneurs]. She works as a sewer and makes lunch bags, satchels, pencil cases, vests and jackets. The loan is to be used for the purchase of materials such as rolls of fabric, elastic bands and other wholesale goods. 

She lives with her husband and her three school age children in her godparents' house. They are thinking about buying a plot of land and having a home of their own later on. She is a young, hardworking person and she wants to be able to have a bigger sewing workshop and to hire staff.

loans.use: to buy supplies (rolls of fabric etc)

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en: Alaa' is a 24-year-old woman preparing to start a beauty salon. She is requesting a loan of $2,000 from FATEN, to be repaid on a monthly basis, in order to purchase salon materials including hair and body creams, hair brushes, hair dryers, etc.  Her business will offer her a good source of income and the opportunity to achieve better living conditions. Alaa' is shown in the above picture.

loans.use: to purchase a new beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra.  Xiomara tiene cuarenta de años de edad es madre de soltera de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y todavía dependen de ella. 
Ella acude nuevamente a las oficinas d ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para continuar con el proceso de mejoras en su casa de habitación. El préstamo es para compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de un cuarto para sus hijos, todo esto es para que su familia goce de una vivienda mejor.
texts.en: Xiomara is 40 years old and is a single mother of two children who are school aged and still dependent on her.  She calls on Ceprodel once again to request a new home improvement loan.  The loan is to buy building materials and supplies to build a room for her children so that the family can enjoy a better house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya, and he is 34 years old. He has been in farming for eight years and currently employs one farmhand with the income from his produce of peas, bananas, milk, maize, and beans that he sells to the local market. He runs a cereals shop to get additional income.

Silas has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank at 32,000 KES and irrigation pipes at 8,000 KES. He says the availability of water through the irrigation system will ensure a better and consistent income. He plans to boost his farming by buying two more dairy cows.

He laments the high costs of feed and inadequate rainfall as the major challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Sedjrogande Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SEDJROGANDE est composé de treize membres. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Odette est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Odette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Odette est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Sylver. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur  charge. Odette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Odette vend de divers produits et de la farine de manioc qu'elle produit par la transformation de manioc. Odette s'approvisionne dans un village du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Odette  et les autres membres du groupement SEDJROGANDE sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The Sedjrogande group comprises 13 members. The group leader, named Odette, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. With the goal of raising the level of their business in order to better meet the demands of their clientele, this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ. Odette never attended school. She is 36 years old and married to a mechanic named Sylver. The couple have four children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are in the care of their parents. Odette and her husband live together with their children. To contribute to providing for her family, Odette sells various products as well as manioc flour, which she produces herself from manioc. Odette gets her supplies from a town in Benin. With the goal of strengthening their businesses and better satisfying their customers, Odette and the other members of the Sedjrogande group are seeking their first loan with ALIDÉ. Their ambition is to raise the level of their business.

loans.use: To  buy bags of manioc to process into flour, and various other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and scarves

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia es cliente antigua de la institución   anteriormente trabajo en un grupo solidario las Uvitas actualmente esta trabajando en forma individual desde el año 2004 donde ese tiempo ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos con una visión de superación . La cliente vive en anticrético donde comparte  el departamento con su hija que esta estudiando en la carrera de  economía en la universidad. El crédito estará destinado para compra de accesorios de ferretería el cual tiene demanda en la ciudad del Alto en diferentes lugares donde acomoda por cantidad de acuerdo al pedido y También  comprara en poca cantidad  material para elaboración de regalos como ser platos tazas y otros donde vende en los salones de fiestas, los días sábados y domingos, la Sra. Julia se dedica a estas dos actividades, para mantener a su hija y los gastos de la casa, se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julia is a former client of the institution.  Earlier she worked with a solidarity group, Las Uvitas.  Currently she has been working on her own since 2004, during which time she has shown herself to be responsible and punctual with her payments, with an approach to improvement.

She lives in an "anticrético" [when a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of monthly rent] and shares the apartment with her daughter, who is studying economics in the university.  The loan will be used for buying hardware accessories, which are in demand in different places in the city of El Alto and for which she arranges the quantity in accordance with the request.  She also will buy retail the material to make gifts such as plates, cups, and others that she sells in party halls on Saturday and Sunday.  Julia works both these jobs to support her daughter and the household expenses.

She is happy about the support given.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Adrian; el tiene 58 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bazar donde vende regalos y peluches y también se dedica a vender artesanía como sombreros, pantalones y chompas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño del socio es ampliar el local donde pueda vender regalos y peluches y también ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar regalos, peluches y adornos y también para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “TINKA” communal bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
This is Mr. Adrian. He is 58, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his variety store where he sells gifts and stuffed animals. He also sells handmade items such as hats, pants and sweaters. Through this business, he is able to get his children ahead. His dream is to expand his business to sell gifts and stuffed animals, and also to expand his craft sales. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of gifts, stuffed animals and decorations, and to buy crafts wholesale.
He is happy to have this loan and promises to repay his quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy gift items, stuffed animals, decorations and hand-made items wholesale.

loans.name: Dadanne

texts.en: Dadanne, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two school-age children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fruits vendor. Her husband is a truck driver who carries chickens and ducks to sell at the market. In order to expand her business, Dadanne is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more fruits to sell in order to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she plans to build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in order to make more profit.

loans.name: Darwin Oswaldo

texts.es:
Darwin Oswaldo tiene 26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Darwin Oswaldo se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, además tiene animales como las cerdos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito mejorará el trabajo, Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. El sueño es comprarse terrenos para sembrar mucho más.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Darwin Oswaldo is 26 years old. He is single and does not have any children. He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. 

He is a member of the NUEVO HORIZONTE communal bank. It located in the Cachely Grande precinct in the Ventanas canton. The members of this communal bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Darwin grows corn and beans. He also has animals like pigs. He buys and sells his agricultural products in Ventanas. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and supplies. The support of this loan helps his work. He encounters challengers like plagues and diseases and variations in the climate. His dream is to purchase land in order to plan a lot more. 

He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 73 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 4 and 13 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been doing for the past 12 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 46 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and her siblings. She works as a teacher in a school in her town. She started her career at a young age since 1994. Currently, she wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her sister’s educational fees. She states that this is her first loan from kiva and this loan will help her to ensure a good education for her sister and her school year.

loans.use: to pay her sister’s educational fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has just been promoted to Foreman at the Life in Africa WE Center in Kampala. His hope is to eventually return to University for further studies, but in Peterâ€™s family itâ€™s become urgent that he starts to think about finding a wife â€“ two of his younger brothers have serious girlfriends they would like to marry, but it is against custom for them to marry before their older brothers do. With his recent promotion, Peter also believes itâ€™s time he started to think seriously about his future, and a wife is definitely part of the plan.

In Uganda, however, marriage is not a day long event but a long process that begins at the point Peter finds himself now. Since itâ€™s taboo for any girl Peter brings home to enter his fatherâ€™s house, the first thing that must happen is that Peter builds a house of his own on his fatherâ€™s land in Tororo (Eastern Uganda). Peter has been saving for this purpose and would like a loan of shs. 800,000 ($475) to add to what he has saved and complete the house quickly.

Peter is an extremely sincere, hardworking and capable young man, and very popular with the Life in Africa members - who are all now wondering who his choice of bride will be!

Below is Peterâ€™s budget:
Cement 20 Bags @ 17000 = 52000
Sand 2 Trips @ 30000 = 60000
Doors 4 @ 50000 = 200000
Windows 4 @ 15000 = 60000
Nails 4kg @ 4000 = 16000

Based on his current income, Peter will be able to repay this loan in 8 months. He has designated a portion of the interest he pays on the loan to support Life in Africaâ€™s Internet4change Program.

loans.use: building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HER FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Zilgai

texts.en: Zilgai S/O Rajab Khan was born in 1970 and lives in District 9 of Kabul City. He is married and has nine family members. He was in high school when the war broke out and that caused him to quit his studies. Zilgai has finished the group loan process and now wants to take an individual loan so he can purchase the materials he needs to make his business better. The loan program has enabled him to buy a used wood-cutting machine, which let him build items more quickly. Now he is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment and wood to further develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, wood cutting machine and other carpentry items

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Business Description: Mr. Justo runs a business where he makes sweet flour rolls and sells them with the help of a friend and his wife. He began this business with his savings after leaving his job and bought a second hand oven.

Use of Loan: He needs credit to buy more prime materials at wholesales prices and install a wall to separate his business area from his home; it lacks dividers.

Personal Information: He is 39 years old, has four children who are studying. His house is made of concrete but is not yet finished. He has a stable family situation. He hopes for a growth in his business so he can finish building his house and better his quality of life.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: Don Justo tiene un local donde elabora roscas dulces de harina y luego las vende con la ayuda de otro amigo y de su esposa. El incio su negocio con unos ahorros despues de dejar de trabajar para una panaderia y de comprar un horno de segunda mano.

Uso del Préstamo: El necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima a precio de mayorista y separar con una pared el negocio de su casa pues aun no tiene divisiones en el interio de ella.

Información Personal: El tiene 39 años y cuatro hijos que estan estudiando su casa esde cemento pero aun no esta terminada tiene estabilidad familiar. El espera que con el mejoramiento de su negocio podra terminar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase prime material at wholesale prices

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is divorced and takes care of his four children. He used to work as a welder; as he was paid too little to cover household expenses, however, he decided to start his own business. Thanks to one of his friends, who invited him to work in the traveling market, he began to offer his services as a repairman. Now he buys parts from used appliances, repairs them if necessary, and then resells them.

Fortunately, Armando has been able to expand his business and increase his number of customers. Now he needs a loan of $925 so that he can purchase more appliances in order to continue to expand his business. He is committed to repaying this loan within 6 months. Armando and his family are very much in need of your help. Please help them by contributing to the success of Armando's business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando es divorciado y se hace cargo de sus cuatro hijos. Anteriormente él trabajaba como soldador pero recibía un salario muy bajo y no lograba cubrir todas las necesidades de sus hijos por lo que decidió comenzar su propio negocio, gracias a la invitación de de uno de sus amigos para trabajar en el mercado ambulante, comenzó ofreciendo sus servicios de reparación de aparatos eléctricos y ahora se dedica a comprar remesas de aparatos usados y venderlos, algunas veces tiene que repararlos antes de ofrecerlos en venta.

Afortunadamente Armando ha hecho crecer su negocio y ha logrado incrementar su clientela, ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares con los que planea comprar una remesa de aparatos para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Esta familia necesita mucho de tu apoyo, ayúdalos a salir adelante contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is a single man. He has been in the photography business since 1998. This loan is his second one with HELP Africa . He needs US$ 400 to equip a studio where people will come to  have their pictures taken. Nestor  will be able to make  profit as there  are  few photographers  in the area. He will be  able to make profit and pay back his loan on time, just as he did in the past.

loans.use: To buy more photo-studio equipment

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen S., age 48, raises and sells domestic animals, including pigs, chickens, and ducks, earning less than US$1 a day. Her husband works as a chef at a restaurant, earning about US$5.80 a day. The couple (pictured in the photo) has seven children. Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more utensils and kitchen equipment for her husband's work. Being able to cook a wider variety of food, he will earn more, and be better able to support the family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen tools to expand their business.

loans.name: Namig

texts.en: Two years ago Namig started this business. This man buys the seedlings from the regions such as Barda, Yevlak, and Goychay for sale in Khachmaz. He was born in 1978. Namig lives in Khachmaz town and is single. Now he needs a loan of $850 to buy new sorts of seedlings for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy new sorts of seedlings to sell

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoeun C., 53, is the mother of six children and lives in Siem Reap province, Angkor complex, Cambodia. She is a housewife and is handicapped. Her husband is employed as a temple guard, making on average around $1.80 each day and two of her children work selling various kinds of souvenir products to tourists passing by. The rest of her children are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Chhoeun C. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Chhoeun C. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her family's transportation

loans.name: Bwase East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Amina K.. She is currently in the business of milling maize and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Amina is 30 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 5 and 10, and her children go to school. Each week, Amina makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Amina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Amina is joined in her small group by Betty M. and Regina N.. Betty M. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add to her business. Regina N. is currently operating a business running a retail shop and wants a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To purchase more maize and increase stock

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en: Altagracia is the owner and operator of a small cafeteria in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo.  She has three daughters, ranging from twelve to fifteen, all of whom go to school.  Altagracia explains that satisfying the customer’s needs is sometimes challenging, for each day “thousands of people ‘invaD.’ the cafeteria in order to purchase the appetizing dishes I prepare” she adds, bursting out laughing.  With her loan, Altagracia will buy a large quantity of many goods to keep preparing her food and improving her service, which will proviD. a better lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Necy

texts.es:
Necy belongs to the group Banco Comunal La Familia, in the Avenue 3 de abril 488 Micaela Bastidas, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has 2 kids. Her husband works in a shop. With the first loan that Necy received from Manuela Ramos of $300 she invested in food to sell.

Now she has a cevicheria (a place that sells cheviche - a cold fish/vegetable dish) in her house which is very well known for all the different stews she uses, as well as her excellent seasoning. This, along with help from her husband, is why her business is doing very well.

With the loan of $1300, which she will pay back over a period of 4 months, she will fit out her business with a stereo, and she will also paint it, and buy some more utensils for the preparation of her food.

For necy, belongin to a communal group like Manuela Ramos is a great help, as it is for all the women who have small businesses and want to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Necy pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. 3 de abril 488 Micaela Bastidas, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Necy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad tiene una cevicheria en su casa que es muy concurrida por los diversos potajes que ofrece además ni que decir de la excelente sazón y la atención esmerada de Necy, con la ayuda de su esposos sacan adelante su negocio. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implementara su negocio con la compra de 1 equipo de sonido, también pintara su local, comprará utensilios, y víveres para la preparación de sus comidas. Necy pertenecer a un banco comunal de Manuela Ramos es un gran apoyo para las mujeres que tenemos pequeños negocios y que queremos progresar.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy utensils for her business/Con el prestamo comprara utensilos para su negocio

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chu Thi P., 60 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2006. She has 2 grown-up children. Her main activity is taking care of her general store. Her saving money, together with the first borrowed money of 200 USD, allowed Mrs. P. to buy goods for her store. Every month, she earns a profit of 130 USD. In addition to the profit from the store, her husband also receives pension. As a result, she can spend the money on improving living conditions and furnishing the house. This time, she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more goods for her general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Chu Thị Phúc, 60 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chị có hai người con đều đã trưởng thành. Công việc hiện nay của chị Phúc là bán hàng tạp hóa. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị Phúc xin vay 200USD cộng với vốn tự có mua hàng bán. Bình quân mỗi tháng chị lãi 130USD. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, ngoài lương hưu của chồng, gia đình cũng có thêm thu nhập cải thiện cuộc sống, mua sắm đồ đạc. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 575USD mua thêm hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda Z. is 39 with three children. She has a secondary school education. When she finished school, she began trading fruits at the market. After she got married, he husband gave her money to expand his small business and she would regulary make sales trips to different districts of Sughd Region. For 10 years now, she sells food products (macaroni, sugar, rice, flour, etc.) at the markets in Spitamen, Djabbor, Rasulov, Gonchi. Mavjuda has regular clients.

She applied to MicroInvest for a loan to expand her assortment of products.

Translation from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Зикруллаева Мавджуда женщина в возросте 39 лет имеет троих детей, сама имеет среднее оразование .После окончания средней школы она торговала фруктами на рынке, после замужества муж ей дал деньги на расширение своего маленького бизнеса и она стала разъезжать по районам Сугдской области . Уже 10 лет как она продаёт продукты питания (макаронные изделия, сахар ,рис,мука и.т.п) на рынках регионов Спитамен, Джаббор Расулов, Гончи . Мавчуда имеет своих постоянных клиентов.

Она обратилась в Микроинвест для получения кредита чтоб расширить свой ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Angelica Rodrigues

texts.pt:
Angélica Rodrigues M. is 42 years old, a native of the city of Maputo, and married. She has one daughter who is 26 years old and attends 7th grade at night school. Aside from her family, she supports her father who lives in the province of Manica, in the center of Mozambique.

Angélica studied through 5th grade and then stopped because of a lack of means. For a while she lived outside the city in the Manhiça district of the Maputo Province. There she met her husband, and later they moved together to the Alto-Maé neighborhood in the city of Maputo. For the last five years they have been living in the Bagamoio suburban neighborhood of Maputo. They live in their own house, though it is still under construction.

Angélica has been an employee for 23 years and works from 7am to 3:30pm, having learned her trade and gotten experience on the job itself. She has a monthly salary of 2200 meticals and saves 1200 meticals.

For Angélica this is the third loan from Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner], and she has never requested a loan from other institutions. Her grand dream is to see her house completed and to see her family well-sheltered.

Pictured above is Angélica with her granddaughter.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelica Rodrigues M., tem 42 anos de idade, Natural da cidade de Maputo, casado maritalmente e pai de 1 filha com 26 anos de idade ela estuda na 7ªclasse curso noturno. Para alem da sua família sustenta o seu pai que se encontra na província de Manica ao centro de Moçambique.

Angelica estudou até 5ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições, por um tempo viveu fora da cidade no distrito de Manhiça na Província do Maputo e lá conheceu o seu marido que mais tarde vieram viver na cidade de Maputo bairro Alto-Maé e a 5 anos vivem no bairro suburbano de Bagamoio na cidade de maputo. Numa casa própria a pesar estar ainda em construção.

Angélica é funcionaria a 23 anos com horário das 7 as 15:30h aprendeu o trabalho ganhando experiencia no próprio trabalho. Tem um salário de 2200,00mt por mes e poupa 1200,00mt.

Para Angélica este é o terceiro empréstimo na hluvuku e nunca pediu noutras instituições. Tem como grande sonho ver a sua casa concluída e ver sua família bem alojada.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her family's house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph M. M. is a commercial driver who uses his own car. At the moment, the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for repairs. He is married, but his wife's income as a hairdresser is not sufficient for Joseph and their 7 children. Demand for his service is high, and he wants to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S., 26 years old, is married and lives with one of her children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has worked planting vegetables and is able to make 2 US dollars per day. Her husband, Un Chek, is a motor-taxi driver and makes on average $3.70 each day. In Cambodia right now, it is hard to survive, especially for poor entrepreneurs who are trying to start a business. The high price of gas is putting many motor-taxi drivers out of business. Still, her husband works in the motor-taxi business because it is hard to find a higher paying job with a better salary as someone without a good education. Heng is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start his own motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née en 1965 à Vogan, Madame A. Afi vit dans le village de Kpémé où elle vend de la bouillie accompagné de gâteaux. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Très appréciéepar sa clientèle, elle s’efforce pour satisfaire cette dernière en préparant toujours une bouillie de bonne qualité.

Pour maintenir ce cap, elle  sollicite un crédit  pour s’approvisionner en maïs, sucre et farine de blé. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir de la matière première sur un temps donné et éviter les ruptures.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Vogan, Mrs. Afi A. lives in the village of Kpémé where she sells porridge and cakes. She is married and has 6 children. Very much appreciated by her clientele, she tries hard to satisfy her customers' needs by always preparing high quality porridge.

To continue doing this, she is requesting a loan to stock up on corn, sugar, and wheat flour. This will permit her to have the necessary raw materials always at hand and prevent her from running short of her products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock up on corn, sugar, and wheat flour

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama Z. is a 47-year-old married woman. She and her husband have six children, all of whom are currently in school. To support her household, she sells food stuffs such as maize, bags of millet, beans, groundnuts and gari to her loyal customers in her neighborhood. 

She explains that selling such food products has proved to be a very lucrative business. As a result, she is now seeking a loan to expand her inventory, which she believes will enable her generate more income in order to better support her family. 

Mariama is a member of the group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The expand her inventory by purchasing additional food stuffs (e.g., maize, millet, groundnuts, gari and beans).

loans.name: Chhat's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of three members. Mrs. Chhat S., 28, a rice farmer who took this up over 9 years ago, is the mother of two children. She is married to Mr. Tuy Sarat, 31, who makes a living catching fish for selling, as well as he is a construction worker and currently earns approximately $3 each day. To earn additional revenue and make work easier, S. needs a loan to buy a fish to resell and to pay for harvesting her rice. S. is the leader of two other members:

Mrs. San Y., a farmer, age 48, who is applying for a loan to purchase a piglet for raising.

Mrs. Sos R., 33, who is a rice farmer requesting a loan to pay for cutting her rice crop. 

They all reside in Anlongveul Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy a fish to sell in local market

loans.name: Dawod

texts.en:
Dawod, the son of M. A., lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is married with three children. He works selling towels and cosmetics which is why he needs the loan for his business, in order to develop it and to better help his family.

Dawod is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 AFN ($1,075) for term of 18 months to enlarge and progress his business, and to buy new towels and cosmetics for his shop.

He is very grateful for this opportunity and thanks all lenders of Kiva and AFSG that want to help with the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his business and shop and to buy new towels and cosmetics

loans.name: Djougousomperin Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djougousomperin (composé de 5 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans avec en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  hamdallaye de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles  vendent divers  produits mais la plus dominante est la vente de pomme de terre à laquelle s’ajoutent la vente de tasses et  celle du bois de chauffe.
Les femmes de ce groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter  avec ce prêt 4 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre, 2 chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe et 3 douzaines de tasses métalliques et en plastique. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali), ou sur place à Sikasso et dans les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso et  dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 27.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djougousomperin (composed of five married women) average 33 years of age and three children. They reside in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Sikasso and commerce in various goods, but the predominant work is the sale of potatoes, plus bowls, tubs, and firewood.

The women of the group are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their burgeoning customer base. They are on their tenth solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy four 100-kg sacks of potatoes, two truck-loads of firewood, and three dozen metal and plastic tubs. They get their supplies either in Bamako (capital of Mali) or locally in Sikasso and surrounding villages. The goods are sold at the retail level for cash, in the marketplaces of Sikasso and in the districts, to customers composed of women and men.

They each hope to realize an average profit of 27,000 francs CFA a month that will be used to pay the loan interest and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tubs, firewood, and potatoes

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia, 43, is blessed with 8 children, all of whom are in school. She strives hard to provide the immediate needs of her family and to help out her husband who used to be the sole provider of the family through farming. Farming in the Philippines is not lucrative due to inadequate technology. Therefore, Rogelia decided to open a small variety store to supplement the family income. She has worked hard to build a successful business, and a loyal network of customers. She joined HSPFI and is now requesting a 8000 PHP loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tumur

texts.en:
Tumur L. lives with her husband in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. She has one son who has been working in South Korea the last few years.

Since 1998, Tumur has been running a butcher shop at the local food market. She mainly sells mutton from a rented stall. On average she sells eight sheep per day. Her husband helps her business by buying animals from herders and dressing the carcasses to get ready for sale. She adds MNT 600.0 per kg ($1 = MNT 1600) to the wholesale price.

Normally in the countryside, meat prices increase in the summer and decrease during the winter. Tumur has a small storage unit to freeze meat, which she uses to store sheep bought when the price is cheaper than in summer. Her loan will be used to purchase more sheep.

Together with her husband, she plans to one day own the shop she operates from.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently in the business of selling onions at home and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to transport onions to the market. Mary is 45 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children who are attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop at the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport onions to the market

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn, 35, lives in the town of Hiải Dương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising seafood. L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, used to purchase breeding livestock. L. is requesting a loan of 20000000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her sixth from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Buy breeding livestock.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a single mom. She is raising her son on her own and works really hard to meet all the needs of their family and pay her bills. Irina lives in Novomoskovsk and sells denim clothing in the central marketplace. Irina has been running this business for 15 years. Her income is 4,500 Hryvnia a month. 

Some of her strongest entrepreneurial characteristics are integrity and consistency. Irina is very determined. She tries to remain optimistic in every situation. This time, she is seeking a loan of 16,400 Hryvnia to purchase assorted inventory, attract new potential customers (which is difficult in the current financial recession), and help her build her sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 50 años, el amor y entrega por sus seres queridos la llevan a mejorar como madre, esposa y comerciante, con este sentir y junto a su esposo, pudieron concluir su meta de tener una casa propia. Durante sus años de carencia económica tuvo que salir a las calles a vender dulces a los niños, quienes eran sus principales clientes, fue así, que el tiempo y su carácter le dieron la oportunidad de caer en gracia delante de las personas quienes solían verla todas las mañanas en las puertas de los colegios y paraderos. Más ahora se encuentran en la esquina del ovalo de la ciudad, donde logró instalarse, gracias al permiso que le otorgó la municipalidad, para ello, tuvo que comprar un mueble exhibidor de madera, el cual sigue utilizando desde hace 6 años. Elvira espera que esta actividad le pueda dar la oportunidad de cumplir sus anhelos de tener su propio negocio en su casa, la cual viene ambientándola, durante todos estos años, con la finalidad de trasladarse pronto allí con sus producto. Mientras llega ese día, se le encuentra muy alegre, vendiendo dulces en el ovalo de su distrito. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, ya son 3 años desde que se formó su banco comunal, y el compromiso que tiene cada integrante con el grupo es algo que se fue poniendo en práctica desde el primer crédito que tuvieron como grupo, ahora han crecido como organización y como pequeños empresarios en sus respectivas actividades. Con los 2000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de una nueva carretilla para sus productos, pues la que tiene está muy vieja.
texts.en:
Elvira is 50 year old. The love and devotion for her loved ones make her a better mother, wife, and businesswoman. With this attitude she and her husband were able to achieve their goal of having their own house. During her years of economic hardship she had to travel around selling sweets to children, who were her main customers. She did that until, with time and by virtue of her own character, she found favor with the people who tended to see her every morning in the doorways of schools and various locales. Now she sees them on the corner at the city traffic circle, where, thanks to being granted permission by the local government, she has succeeded in setting up shop; she did have to buy a wooden display stand, which she's been using for six years. Elvira hopes that doing this will give her the opportunity to satisfy her desire to have her own business in her house, which she's been setting up for all these years, so she can move right in with her products. In the meantime, she's very happy selling sweets at her district traffic circle. This will be Elvira's 6th loan with MFP. Her village bank opened 3 years ago, and all the members maintain the same commitment they had when they received their first group loan. Now they've grown as an organization and as small businesspeople in their respective fields. Elvira plans to use her loan of 2000 soles to buy a new push-cart for her products, since the one she has is very old.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new push-cart

loans.name: Misbah Tahir Naveed Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Zakia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

Zakia Parveen baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe-making business.

Maryam Bushra baji wants a loan to buy garments to sell.

Misbah baji is the wife of T. N.; they have lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband deals in seasonal vegetables. He buys vegetables wholesale and sells to the vegetable shops and earns income. Misbah baji also operates an embroidered clothes business which she does to pay the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to grow her husband’s vegetable selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell to retailers

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Marilu es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, Marilu tiene juegos de billar que alquila por horas, su negocio esta en su casa que se ubica cerca de un colegio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para las mesas de billar.
Los sueños de Marilu son ampliar la construcción de su casa para un restaurante y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the communal bank “Suni,” which means “Abundant” in Quechua. Marilu lives with her partner, is 41 years old, and has three children. Marilu has billiard tables in her home that she rents out by the hour. Her home is located near a high school and her children help her with the business. Marilu needs a loan of 750 soles to buy accessories for the billiard tables. Marilu would love to expand her house so she could open a restaurant. She also wants her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de accesorios para las mesas de billar.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat is a loving mother of 3 children. Since starting a family of their own, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to making and selling buns, through which they have been able to cover the basic needs of their home. Sabohat begins her workday early in the morning. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can offer her products personally, in markets, throughout the regions of her country. She hopes to be earning a greater income to be able to arrange the wedding of her darling son. For this reason, Sabohat is requesting a loan of $ 1000 US to allow her to do these things. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her keep making buns and making her children’s dreams a reality.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
