While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of a new electrical oven.

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en:
Tolotea A. (0) is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Mulivai, Safata. She is single and has one infant child.

Tolotea owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 320 WST a month.

In 2007, Tolotea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

Tolotea is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will again be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Installation of a gate in front of her house

loans.name: Jorge Joaquim

texts.pt:
Jorge Joaquim A. nasceu no distrito da Moamba, província de Maputo, de 44 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 5 e 16 anos que freqüentam escola na vila do distrito de Boane. Fez o nível superior em metodologias de ensino da língua Portuguesa. Para alem dos filhos, não sustenta mais ninguém.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores, no distrito da Moamba, e saiu juntamente com os seus pais que trabalham na empresa publica dos caminhos de ferro de Moçambique.
Jorge é funcionário do estado moçambicano exercendo as funções de docência numa das escolas do distrito de boane. Recebe mensalmente 24.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família, pagamento de uma empregada domestica e pagamento de escola para os filhos. Vive na casa própria e a sua esposa não trabalha, sofre de uma doença a crônica há bastante tempo.

Já teve empréstimo num Banco comercial (BIM) no valor não estimado para construção de muro de vedação do seu espaço habitacional. Após a conclusão, aproxima se a Hluvuku-Adsema solicitando 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria (rebocar a casa e fazer outros acabamentos). prefere um empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema por oferecer o juro mais baixo da praça e com modalidade flexível de pagamento de credito.

Propõe se a reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de compra de uma viatura para transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Jorge Joaquim A. was born in Moamba in the province of Maupto. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 16. His children go to school in Boane. He attended college to become a Portuguese language teacher. Other than his children, he does not support any other family members. He grew up with his parents in Moamba and he often went to work with his parents, who worked for a public company in Mozambique. Jorge works for the Mozambique government, carrying out his functions as a teacher in the Boane school district. He earns 24.000,00MT each month that allows him to support his family, pay for a helper around the house, and pay for his children’s schooling. He lives in his own home and his wife does not work, as she suffers from a chronic illness. Jorge already had a loan with a commercial bank (BIM) to build a retaining wall near his home. After he was finished, he approached Hluvuku-Adsema for a loan of 20.000,00MT to purchase materials for a adding bricks to the exterior of his home. He prefers Hluvuku-Adsema because they offer a lower interest rate and a flexible repayment schedule. He pledges to repay the loan without problems in order to qualify for more loans in the future. His goal is to purchase a vehicle for personal transport.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is already 57 years old. She manages a hog raising business for many years. She is married to Virgilio M. Sr. The couple is blessed with six children who are Dominador - 30 years old, he is a college graduate; Virgilio M. Jr. - 27 years old; Brenda - 25 years old; Regovil - 23 years old; Jovilyn - 20 years old and Jeffrey - 13 years old. Estela is hoping to uplift her family from poor living condition thus asking for the assistance of KIVA lenders to her business. 

Estela is living in the village of San Antonio in San Agustin, Isabela together with her whole family. She wanted to buy feeds for her hogs. She hopes to avail the amount of PHP6, 000 as additional business capital to maintain her hog raising business. Estela is also hoping to improve her business so that, she could be able to garner bigger income for her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: C., 27, is hard work woman who tries to earn money from a suitable job. In the past, she planted a rice crop but she right now works as a seamstress for a garment industry. She gets a specific salary of $90 a month to be managed all her family’s living requirements. She is married with three young children, while her husband works on the farm (he is shown in the picture above). C. is hardly commuting to work because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for traveling purposes. Because of this obstacle, she decided to ask a loan to add to her little saving in order to buy a used motor to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motor to ride to work

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Purok Barangay, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing passenger transport (trisikad) services to local community members. Merlyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke G. is 25 years old; her husband is a doctor. She has one child who goes to school. Luke is currently in the business of selling charcoal and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to purchase more goods like maize flour, charcoal for stoves, etc. to sell. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a retail shop.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, targeted towards war refugees returning to their native home, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like maize flour,charcoal for stoves, etc. to sell

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong N. N., 20, is a professional hair dresser and decorates clothes for brides and grooms. She typically makes about $12.50 USD every day, while her husband is a barber and earns approximately $6 USD per day. This couple has one young child living at home to support. Duong needs to spend about $60 USD on food, $10 USD on utilities and $40 USD on other expenses. (Duong is pictured with her husband at home.)

Duong N. N. is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more decorating items for wedding clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more decorating items for wedding clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four children and she is 39 years old. She is a friendly woman and she is also hardworking. She sells tailoring materials in her stall but she is not a tailor. She has been in this business for three years.

Rose is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client and she used a LAPO loan as her capital to start her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

This is the high season for business and Rose hopes to make more profits. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is forty-five years old. He is married and has five children who are all in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. John works hard to be able to provide for his family. He runs a chop bar and operates a cold store as well. His shop is by the road side. He buys fresh fish directly from the fishermen in the community. John has been in business for four years and desires to improve upon his business. It is his desire to give all his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en: Vergenia Y.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting mango for sale. She is 44 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Vergenia has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vergenia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her eleventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher P., 26 years old, owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. He sells a variety of goods to earn money to pay the daily expenses in their home. He started his business last year. Now, he continues his selling to provide his family with a better future. He would like to add to his business capitalization. He would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell in his store.

loans.use: To obtain more merchandise to resell

loans.name: Kaftaro Group

texts.en: Hashmat Babai is the group leader of Kaftaro group.Hashmat Babai is a 56 years old,and married with six children, four daughters and two sons. They are at school.He lives in Kabul Afghanistan.He is a gas seller.He has been involved in this business for more than 25 years. He has a large number of customers in his shop. Hashmat needs the loan to purchase more balloons of gas and expand his business. He has one employee in his shop who supports him now,but he expects and hopes to grow his buisiness in order to hire one new employee.

loans.use: buying  balloons for gas

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 50-year-old married mother of five children between 14 and 26 years of age, three of whom go to school. Sarah resides with eight people in her five-roomed house that has electricity but no piped water. She also takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day.

Working seven days a week, Sarah sells charcoal in her community of Katanga, located on the outskirts of Kampala, to an average of 15 customers daily. She also practices outside catering, incurring extra transport costs to and from shopping. The major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and rising food prices.

Sarah has been with MCDT for five years, servicing her eleventh loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and stock non-perishable foodstuffs. Sarah aspires to expand her business and owin a permanent business structure in place of the open stall she currently works from.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and stock foodstuffs for her outside catering business

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeurn S. is married to Mr. San Som and she is 47 years old. This couple has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending local public school. This family lives in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Thoeurn S. is a farmer who hires a piece of land to cultivate rice on, not for selling but to support her family, and besides this, she is a Khmer noodle seller in their local village also. Her husband is a security guard who can earn only a low salary. This family has a problem because her husband’s workplace is far from their house. Thus, Mrs. Thoeurn S. decided to seek a loan to buy a new motorbike for transportation. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Mrs. Anu B. is a tailor in the village of Bhakepati, Kathmandu. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Both of her children are in pre-school. Her husband, Mr. Suresh B., went to Dubai for work.

Mrs. B. opened her tailoring shop seven years ago. Before starting her own business, she took a three-month training course from a tailor shop near her home. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses, like the Kurta Sulwar (a pant and tunic outfit) which is very popular among Nepali women.

Mrs. B. plans to use the loan of Rs 25,000 to buy tailoring materials for her business. She wants to use the shop's income to improve her family's standard of living and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Kotognogontala. Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Kotognogontala sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et  tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments alimentaires, de boissons non alcoolisées, d’huile de palme, de bois de chauffe, de  mercerie et de volailles.
Absetou F., qui est un des membres du groupe s’est spécialisée dans la préparation de jus de fruits et la vente de boissons non alcoolisées.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Absetou F. compte acheter, 20 casiers de boissons non alcoolisées auprès des dépositaires agrées de la place à Sikasso. Elle  vend en détail au comptant rarement à crédit, dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle espère réaliser  comme les autres membres, un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé en épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Kotognogontala group are married women who average 37 years of age with two children; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their fifth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which they are taking out to satisfy the needs of their customers; all their previous loans have been repaid on time. They have a variety of activities which include among others the sale of food condiments, non-alcoholic drinks, palm oil, firewood, haberdashery products and poultry. Absetou F., who is one of the group members, is specialised in the preparation of fruit juices and the sale of non-alcoholic drinks. With this new loan, Absetou F. is planning on buying 20 crates of non-alcoholic drinks from local authorised depositories in Sikasso. She sells on a retail basis for cash and rarely on credit, in various districts of the town, to a customer base made up of men and women. In common with the other group members, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 13,500FCFA, of which part will be saved and the rest invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of non-alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Carmen Anabel

texts.es:
Carmen es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos  a los 15 años se fue a radicar a la parroquia Picoaza, se esfuerza día a día en seguir adelante con su negocio, y es que para ella es muy grato vivir en un cantón tan hermoso como San Vicente, pero sabe que no todo es fantasía, sabe a ciencia cierta que tiene que trabajar duro para seguir sacando adelante a sus niños, aun están pequeños y necesitan del esfuerzo y protección de sus padres, ella vende zapatillas, y su esposo vende ollas, y cuchillos en otros lugares del país, como en  el oriente y Esmeraldas , la señora Carmen compra las zapatillas para el negocio y las deja a crédito, de alguna manera esta forma de trabajar le deja sus ingresos,  recorre puerta a puerta a sus clientes,  y por semana cobra, hay zapatillas desde 10 dólares, tiene pocos meses trabajando.

Están casados desde hace 5 años, y por la edad de los niños muchas veces se le hace complicado cumplir con su trabajo, pero opta por dejar a los pequeños con su madre quien es de gran ayuda para ella,  viven en la casa de su suegra y el sueño de ella es tener su propia casa, con el crédito se divide para comprar su mercadería y la otra parte a su esposo, por pedido hace las compras, hay diferentes modelos de zapatos la hermana es la que le ayuda a seleccionar la mercadería,  al mes compra tres docenas de zapatos, un distribuidor le lleva a entregar directamente a su casa, solo por pedido ella se encarga de hacer el pedido según lo que las clientas le solicitan, sale a vender en la mañana, los domingos cobra, no ha tenido problema con los clientes son puntuales para cancelar y una vez que reúne el dinero invertido hace otro , el amor hizo que Carmen desde que se comprometiera se radicara a vivir en la provincia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a native of the Los Ríos province and, at 15 years of age, she relocated to the Picoaza district. She works each and every day to get ahead in her business since, for her, it is very gratifying to live in a county as beautiful as San Vicente. However, she knows everything isn’t fantasy and that it’s a scientific fact that she has to work hard to help her children get ahead. They are young, and still need the strength and support of their parents. She sells shoes and her husband sells pans and knives in other areas of the country. Carmen buys shoes for the business and sells them on credit. Somehow, this way of working generates income. She travels door to door to visit customers, and charges on a weekly basis. Her shoes start at $10; she has been working only a few months. Carmen has been married for 5 years and, given how young her children still are, it has often been difficult to carry out her work. However, her mother has been a great help by caring for the kids while she works. They live with her in-laws, and she hopes to have her own house one day. She hopes to use part of the loan to buy merchandise, and share the other part with her husband. She buys different styles of shoes, which her sister helps her choose from the merchandise available. Carmen buys three-dozen pairs of shoes each month, which the distributor delivers directly to her home. She places her order based on customer demand, selling her shoes each morning and charging customers on Sundays. She has not had any problems with customers, as they all are punctual with their payments. Once she collects the funds, she places another order. Falling in love is what led Carmen to relocate until she got engaged.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Gary Alejandro

texts.es:
El joven Gary Alejandro R. S. C. vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la Zona conocida como Zona Estadio, actualmente vive con su Mama y su Esposa. Gary junto a su mama y a su esposa comenzaron un negocio de prestación de servicios, gracias al trabajo duro de los tres su negocio creció considerablemente. El servicio que brindan es de Alquiler de transporte urbano.

Gary solicita el crédito para poder mejorar su servicio de alquiler de transporte, y de esta manera poder brindar un mejor servicio y poder hacer crecer más su pequeña empresa. Gary nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro ser la empresa de Alquiler de Transporte más grande en Bolivia y así darle una mejor vida a su mama, su esposa y sus futuros e hijos.
texts.en:
This young person, Gary Alejandro R. S. C. lives in the city of Cochabamba in the area known as "Zona Estadio", he lives with his Mama and his wife. Gary, with his mom and his wife began a business of rental services. Thanks to the hard work of the threesome, their business as grown considerably. The service that they provide is the rental of urban transportation. Gary is seeking the loan to be able to improve his service of renting transportation and in this way to be able to provide a better service and to be able to grow his little business. Gary told us that his greatest dream is, in the future, to be the largest transportation rental business in Bolivia and to provide a better life for his mom, his wife and his future children.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Investment

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia E. is from the village of Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 64 years old, a widow and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Bonifacia operates a business venture in the food sector which is fish vending. Bonifacia has been engaged in her business for 27 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. At present, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonifacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bonifacia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Bonifacia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

       About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
 
       *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Lianlanie

texts.en: Lianlanie C. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Lianlanie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lianlanie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lianlanie has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lianlanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lianlanie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lianlanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a divorced woman with seven children. All of her children have completed their O-levels. She owns a home with no electricity, but with piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.  She has been operating her food vendor business for the last two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanajuma faces the challenge of competition from other food vendors in the market. With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sand and blocks to finish construction of her rental houses. She hopes that someday she will run a wholesale charcoal business. She decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation.

loans.use: To purchase sand and blocks to finish her ongoing construction of rental houses.

loans.name: Catherine Achieng

texts.en:
Catherine Achieng O. is a married woman and a mother of five children. Immediately after she dropped from school in 1985, she started a fish-vending business, something that has been able to generate her income to date. 

She decided to join KMET, where she was trained in business and financial management. With such skills, she believes that her business will diversify further. She would wish to get a loan worth 10,000 Kenyan shillings to help her expand her business to generate more income and support the family effectively.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Estela A. tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Gonzalo Posadas quien se dedica a la compra y venta de dolares en la frontera el Amatillo, tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos.
la señora A. se dedica al negocio de pulperia, tiene varios años con su negocio en el cual vende queso, pollo, carnes, refrescos ,jabon, azucar, café etc
esta ubicado en el barrio Morazan de Nacaome Valle, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, Santos es una persona muy trabajadora de muy buenos principios morales y espirituales.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su pulperia.
 
su mayor deseo es que su hija se le gradue de la universidad y que su negocio crezca cada dia que pasa.
texts.en:
Santos Estela A., 41, is married to Gonzalo Posadas who earns a living buying and selling dollars at the border town of El Amatillo. They have three children whom they support. Ms. A. owns and manages a grocery store where for a number of years she has sold cheese, chicken and other meats, soft drinks, ham, sugar, coffee etc. Her business is located in the Morazan neighborhood of Nacaome Valle and she is open for business Monday to Sunday. Santos is a very hardworking person with very good moral and spiritual principles. She will use the loan to invest in her grocery store. Her greatest wish is that her daughter get a college degree and that her business would grow with each passing day.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, sugar, bread, cookies, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, soft drinks, milk, juices, soups, pasta, salsas, salt, condiments, soap and toilet paper.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato S. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. He is 50 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Renato owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Renato has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP every two months.

In 2010, Renato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan that Renato has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur O. is a 29-year old single woman who lives with her mother in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her mother live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Gantumur operates a clothing retail business at the local market. She started her own private business in 2005 by selling a variety of fruits. In 2009, she began to operate a clothing trading business and has since built a stable operation. She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to purchase a new truck. She hired her brother as a truck driver and pays him a monthly salary from her earnings. 

In the future, Gantumur hopes to continue her success and to build her own new house from her revenue. Her working capital has decreased because of purchasing the new truck, therefore, she is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Agnes  Kamene

texts.en:
Agnes Kamene M. is a widow, aged 42 years. She has two children: one in polytechnic and the other in form two. She is the sole provider for the family. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer in charge of Tala office.

Agnes is a business lady operating a tailoring shop at Nguluni market, which is an rural area in Tala. She also sells curtains in the same market. The monthly income for the business is KES20,000. She loves her work a lot and wants to use the loan to buy more materials to make curtains and clothes to sell so as to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Agnes believes that in future she will have a wholesale for distributing curtains and tailored clothes. She is a very creative and ambitious business lady.

loans.use: To increase the stock of fabrics and curtain materials in her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia started her own business when she was 50 years old. She sells cosmetics and small home products at the open market. She has a booth that can be closed up and locked so that she does not need to take her inventory back and forth every day as she used to do in the past.

Lidia is 61 years old and divorced, and she lives with her son and his family. Lidia's goal is to help her son's family financially and help to improve their living conditions. 

Lidia has used micro-loans before and found them very instrumental for her business. This time she would like to borrow 14,700 Grivnas to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 47 years old. He is married and has 10 children between the ages of 1 and 23. Nine of his children are students and are currently enrolled in school. Faustin sells different types of crafts in his shop. His wife helps him with his work. He has had this business for four years. With the loan, he will buy more crafts to sell. With the profit, he will pay school fees for his children. He says that his business is successful because he knows all the people near him and they appreciate his business. In the future, he would like to sell in a big market like that one in an urban area where there are more people than his local area.

loans.use: To buy more crafts to sell

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Fishing is the most important part of 49-year-old Mrs. Pheng N.’s daily work. She and her husband have been living on the river for more than nine years. They always catch around 8 kilos of fish a day and sell them to their regular customers who retail in the busy market. Pheng N. and her husband also support their four children, three of whom are single and one of whom is married and lives independently. This approaching fishing season, the river is full of fish, but Pheng N. lacks tools for fishing. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support her business activities.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. To make a living, Jesus raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jesus shares that his farm is a big help to his family for it helps provide for their needs. He works hard to keep it productive.

Jesus joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred A. is from Capatan, Tuguegarao City. He is 34 years old. Fred is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Fred owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing tricycle transport services to local community members. Fred has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fred has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Fred is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair the vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Fred from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used in his transport business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso, es casada, tiene 70 años y 3 hijos. Cristina tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general que atienD. en su casa, donD. venD. aguas, gaseosas y otros productos. 
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, harina, leche, etc. Cristina antes tenia un puesto D. papas en el mercado D. la Magdalena y decidió abrir una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
A Cristina le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque le dan créditos y pueD. ahorrar.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Cristina, age 70, is a member of the Glorioso communal bank; she is married and has three children. Cristina has a convenience store located in her home where she sells water, soft drinks, and other products. She is seeking a loan in order to buy inventory for her store, including items such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, flour, milk, etc. In the past, Cristina used to sell potatoes in the Magdalena market but now decided to open a grocery store in her home. Cristina enjoys the meetings of her communal bank because it allows her to obtain credit and also to save. Her dream is to see her business grow.

loans.use: purchase rice, cooking oil, noodles, etc

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Specioza is 30 years old, married and has two children who are six and seven years old.  Currently, both of her children attend school.  Specioza sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for four years.  Her husband is a motorbike spare parts dealer.  

Specioza will use the loan to purchase more bananas and beans.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Specioza plans to increase her sales. In the future, she plans to have one million as capital.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 51 years old and is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 4 children. Adora is a farmer and tills her own land. She plants and harvests rice crops. Although Adora has a sari-sari store located at her house, she still rents a small stall at the market to sell her harvest. She said more people can buy her rice if she sells it at the market. Adora is a good mother. She wants the best for her family.

Adora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Adora is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Los Gira Soles Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Girasoles" porque ya que en la zona que viven se dedican al cultivo de flor, entre ellos de girasoles. Esta ubicado al sur del Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes. La señora Angelica Díaz M. es una itegrante del grupo. Tiene 21 años, es foricultura y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Ella se dedica al cultivo de rosa que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar fumigo y fertilizante, para poder tener rosas de calidad. Sus clientes dicen que las flores que vende son de variedad y de muy buena calidad, ya que puede ser utilizada para arreglos florales o para ser utilizada en el hogar. Al solicitar este prestamo ella se siente contenta y con un apoyo extra de su familia, para poder crecer económicamente y poderle ofrecer a su hijo educación y una mejor casa. Le gustaría seguir teniendo el apoyo de los prestamos para siguir produciendo rosas y ser conocida en otros estados y paises.
texts.en: This group is called "Girasoles" (Sunflowers) because flowers are cultivated in the area where they live, among them the sunflowers.  This group is located in the south of the state of Mexico.  The group has 8 members.  Angelica Díaz M. is one of the members.  She is 21 years old, works in floriculture, and has a 4 year-old child.  She has been growing roses for 5 years.  She requests a loan to buy insecticide sprays and fertilizers, so that she can have good quality roses.  Her customers say that the variety of flowers that she sells are very high quality, and so can be used for floral arrangements or for home use.  In requesting this loan she feels very pleased, since with the extra support of her family, she will be able to grow economically and offer her child an education and a better house.  She would like to continue to have the support of the loans so that she can continue to produce roses and become known in other states and countries.

loans.use: to buy insecticide sprays and fertilizers for the cultivation of roses

loans.name: Flor De Mayo Group

texts.es: Doña Fidelina Angelica S. I., es casada, tiene 28 años de dad, cursos el sexto grado de primaria escolar, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la elaboracion de almohadas, tiene 5 años de experiencia con este oficio, empezo cuando tenia 18 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante. doña Fidelia reune a otra compañeras para organizar grupo y solicitar un prestamo a ASDIR, que les servira para ampliar su capital de trabajo,las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas que son: crianza de animales, vebnta de plasticos y venta de ropa. Doña Fidelia quiere ver que su negocio se grande.
texts.en:
Doña Fidelina Angelica S. I., 28, is married and studied up to the sixth grade in school.  She has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school, and earns a living making pillows.  She has five years of experience in this work having started when she was 18 years old.  She relies on her husband's support who is merchant.  

Doña Fidelia gathered some friends to organize a group and solicit a loan from ASDIR which will serve to increase their working capital.  The members of this group work in diverse areas like: raising small animals, selling plastics, and selling clothing.  Doña Fidelia wants to see her business grow big.

loans.use: Working captial.

loans.name: Lerica

texts.en: Lerica M. has a "sari-sari" (variety store) to generate her daily income. She is 49 and married, living in Ospital, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Out of five, three of her children are still in school. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to avail herself of its credit facilities & insurances. She availed herself of loans several times already. Now, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP. The money will be used as additional capital for her store. She hopes to replace her present "sari-sari" store with a concrete one and she also plans to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 29 años y nació en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. La socia Irene tiene su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Irene vive en la comunidad de Yanahuara y su actividad económica es la venta de papa pelada, ella nos cuenta que lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y vende a las pollerías de la esa ciudad.    

Irene es una mujer emprendedora y trabadora que requiere  el préstamo para comprar más papa y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old and was born in the city of Puerto Maldonado.  She has a partner and they have four children together.  Irene currently lives in Yanahuara community and her business is selling peeled potatoes.  She tells us that she transports her products to the city of Puerto Maldonado and sells them to grilled chicken joints in that city.

Irene is an enterprising and hard-working woman who needs this loan to buy more potatoes and other products.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 31 years old and married with two children.  He sells charcoal ("makaa") to earn a living for his family.  He has been running the business for eleven years and he has employed one person.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business hence improving his living standards.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to add to his stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To add to his stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; es casada, la socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9, 5 años de edad, la socia se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo y siendo esta zona conocida como tierra sagrada por tener los granos de maíz grandes y dulces, ellos producen el mejor maíz de  Perú para exportación, la socia siembra y cosecha maíz,  y vende en jora para elaborar la famosa bebida inka, la chicha de jora. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra de maíz.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA” community bank which is located in the village of Rumichaca, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Vilma is 34 years old, married, and has four children aged 13, 11, 9 and 5.  Vilma's main business activity is farming and she owns her own farmland.  This area is known as sacred land because they grow the biggest and sweetest corn kernels.  They produce the best corn in Peru for export.  Vilma sows and harvests corn and sells jora corn which is used to make the famous Incan drink 'chicha de jora'.

Vilma is requesting this loan to invest in buying seeds for her new corn crop.  She is very grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying seeds for her new corn crop

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida G. is 54 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Tabid, a part of Ozamiz City. Bienvenida runs a motor transport service. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Bienvenida joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, her first from GDMPC, which will be used to repair her motorbike’s existing engine. Bienvenida plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing motorbike engine.

loans.name: Duo Cosuelo De Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO CONSUELO DE DIOS
AURA Y VILMA 
AURA ES UNA SEÑORA MUY TRABAJADORA TIENE TRES HIJOS A ASU CARGO ELLA ES VIUDA DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS FALLECIO SU ESPOSO TIENE TRES HIJOS CASADOS QUE TAMBIEN LA APOYAN Y LA AYUDAN EN SUS GASTOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE TEJIDOS A MANO YA DESDE VARIOS AÑOS SE DEDICA A ESA ACTIVIDAD Y AHORA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA CONFECCIONAR SU PRODUCTO. VILMA TAMBIEN ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN JUAN COMALAPA TIENE  DOS HIJOS YA GRANDES , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA TIPICA PERO SU NEGOCIO LO REALIZA DE AMBULANTE, TAMBIEN VENDE GUIPILES A MANO LOS VENDE EN LA COMUNIDAD DONDE ELLA VIVE, ELLA  NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU PRODUCTO Y TENER MAS VENTAS Y MEJORES GANANCIAS.
texts.en:
DUO CONSUELO DE DIOS
Aura is a very hard-working lady.  She is a widow and has three children in her care.  Her husband died four years ago.  She has three children who are already married.  They support her and help her with her expenses.  Her business is weaving products by hand.  She has been in this business for several years and needs this loan so that she can buy raw materials for making her products.

Vilma is from San Juan Comalapa.  She has two grown-up children.  Vilma's business is selling traditional clothes and she makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.  She also sells hand-made traditional blouses in her community.  She needs this loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business so that she can make more sales and better profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving products

loans.name: Toma

texts.en:
Toma is from village Khevasheni. He is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife Darejan and two sons (26 and 20 years old). 

The main source of income for the family is farming activities. In particular, Toma and his sons cultivate family-owned land with an area of 0.8 ha and grow potatoes, haricot beans and onions. Harvested vegetables are sold on Akhaltsikhe Market. Also, they run a dairy farm with seven milk cows and six calves. They produce cheese and sell it on Akhaltsikhe open market. 

With the requested credit Toma will purchase two additional milk cows and the family will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will positively influence their income. The increase in the income will be used for renovation of the house, equipping it with new household goods.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: Arooj's Group

texts.en:
Arooj is a 36-year-old lady. She carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to the passengers and to schoolchildren. He is very good at driving. Arooj doesn’t have any children yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw and buy a new rickshaw body, which will allow him to save his business asset and provide better quality transport services to his passengers. Arooj hopes that the loan will help her husband improve his business and increase his profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Arooj.

loans.use: To repair and buy a new rickshaw body

loans.name: Sokhouen

texts.en: Sokhouen, 36, a sweets seller, and her husband, a construction worker, earn a combined income of $10 per day. They have three children, none of whom  yet attend school.  Every month, Sokhouen has to spend $42 on food and $15 on transportation. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy farmland to begin a farming enterprise. In the future she wants to have a café and sell groceries.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Ismael Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ismael lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Karen Jahoska de 23 años quien vende prendas desde hace 2 años  la cual inicio sacando mercadería al crédito y poco apoco fue creciendo su negocio. Ella con el crédito comprara la mercadería al contado lo cual le proporcionara mayor cantidad de ganancias.
Su meta es poder realizar sus estudios superiores ya que quiere ser Farmacéutica.
La otras integrantes son Elena de 29 años quien vende productos Avon y Rosa María de 25 años quien tiene una tienda de auto partes en el mercado oriental, vende prendas, ropa y carnicería.
texts.en:
The “Ismael” group is composed of three hard working, enterprising women. One of them is Karen Jahoska, 23, who has sold items for two years.  She started out taking out merchandise on credit and gradually created her business.  She will use the loan to pay cash for merchandise which will mean higher profits for her.  Her goal is to be able to go to college; she wants to be a Pharmacist.

The other members are Elena, 29, who sells Avon products and Rosa María, 25, who has an auto spare parts store in the Oriente Market and sells items, clothes and meats.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis alberto de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Luis Alberto se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café y granadillas, actividad que realiza desde hace varios, además de ser productos muy consumido por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para mejorar sus tierras y de ganado vacuno, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Luis alberto con trabajo y dedicación les brinda lo mejor a sus hijos y con la intensión de brindarles otras oportunidades académicas en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 28 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. The only service he receives is electricity. Luis resides in the rural section of the District of Pomahuaca, which is part of the Department of Cajamarca. This area is known for having businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

Luis Alberto is a farmer and has his own land on which he grows coffee and passion fruit. He has been farming for many years and his products are widely consumed. Once his crops are harvested, they are sold at different markets within and outside of the area. The income he generates enables him to provide a better quality of life for his wife and children.

Noticing that his business needs to grow, Luis Alberto is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy compost to improve his land and help his cattle. With the revenue he generates, Luis will be able to repay the loan and meet the daily needs of his family. Through work and dedication, Luis Alberto will supply the best for his children and intends to provide them with other academic opportunities in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase compost for his land.

loans.name: Akiba

texts.en:
Akiba is a married man who has two children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has piped water, but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, Akiba has operated a stationery selling business, selling items from a shop, to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season the demand is lower compared to supply. He dreams of establishing a photocopying business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase text books and pens for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase text books and pens for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI  B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été  remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée par la groupe en l'occurrence par Madame KADIA  debout au milieu, est essentiellement  l’arachide.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000 FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKADI B group are married women who have an average age of 32 years and 3 children. They live for the most part in polygamous families in MAARO, a village located 45 km away from Sikasso, the 3rd largest administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to continue their agricultural activities during the winter season. This is the 5th loan they have requested from the institution; all previous loans were reimbursed without any difficulties. Mrs KADIA, who is standing in the middle of the back row in the photograph, is a good representative of the group. She plans to use this loan to cover labor costs and purchases of fertilizer and seeds for 1 acre of land.
Good produced are sold at the neighboring village of LOUTANA and at the SIKASSO market to a client base of men and women. She hopes to obtain profits of 80,000 FCFA (approximately 176 USD) at the end of the season, which will enable her to pay back her loan as well as help her husband cover daily living expenses.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and cover costs of labor and seeds

loans.name: Beverli

texts.en: Beverli is 53 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 26 years she has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She also earns an income from fishing.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.  Beverli has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this one. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se caracteriza por estar rodeada D. cerros y se siembra muchos arboles D. hule.
Las Perlas es un grupo conformado por dies mujeres las cuales cada una tiene una actividad economica:
Rosa- Venta D. pan
Florinda- Venta D. tacos
Praxedis- venta D. carne
Juana C- Venta D. pollo
Claudia D. J.- Venta D. abarrotes
Juana - venta D. refrescos
Abigail- Farmacia
Geronimo- Venta D. Perfumeria
Araceli- Venta D. pollo

La señora Mirian es uno D. los miembros D. este grupo, ella tiene la edad D. 38 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado D. secundaria y esta casada con el señor Samuel que trabaja como jornalero en el campo, ellos tienen dos hijos D. los cuales uno estudia la secundaria y el mas pequeño la primaria. Ella nos platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y que desD. se caso ella y su esposo decidieron abrir un negocio para poder ganar un poco D. dinero extra y ofrecer una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
Doña Miriam nos dice que como su esposo sabra hacer pan abrieron una panaderia en la cual trabajan los dos con el tiempo poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio y abrio una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes y ahora ella y su familia atienden sus dos pequeños negocios.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra D. aceite, huevos, arina, gas, azucar, levadura, para la elaboracion  del pan y azucar, frijoles, aceite, productos enlatados, papel higenico, refrescos, dulces, jabon y un poco D. papeleria (lapiceros, sacapuntas y lapiceros) para resurtir su negocio.
Doña Miriam espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea que sus hijos puedan una profesion.
"Gracias por traer estos prestamos hasta nuestras comunidad"
texts.en:
This group is noted for the fact that it they are surrounded by hills and lots of rubber trees.  'Las Perlas' is a group which has ten [female] members.  Each one has her own business activity:

Rosa - sells bread
Florinda - sells tacos
Praxedis - sells meat
Juana C - sells chicken
Claudia D. Jesús - sells groceries
Juana - sells soft drinks
Abigail - runs a pharmacy
Gerónima - sells perfume
Araceli - sells chicken

Miriam is one of the members of this group.  She is 38 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is married to Samuel who works as a farm laborer.  They have two children: one is in high school and the other is in elementary school.  Miriam tells us that she has always enjoyed working and that, when they got married, she and her husband decided to open a business so that they could earn a little extra money and offer their family a better quality of life.

Miriam tells us that, as her husband knows how to make bread, they opened a bakery.  They both work in the bakery and, over time, they gradually grew their business and opened a small grocery store as well.  Now Miriam and her family serve in the two small businesses.

Miriam needs this loan to invest in buying oil, eggs, flour, gas, sugar and yeast for making her bread and sugar, beans, oil, canned goods, toilet paper, soft drinks, sweets, soap and some stationery products (pens, pencils and pencil sharpeners) to re-stock her grocery store business.

Miriam hopes that this investment will help her businesses to prosper as she would like her children to grow up to have a profession.  She says "thank you for bringing these loans to our community".

loans.use: to buy groceries and bread

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma mentioned that the only way to survive poverty is through "patience and hard work". She is now 55 and has two adult children. Her husband is a farmer who manages their farm lots while Emma sells meat in the market to earn additional income. She has operated this business for almost 33 years and usually earns a profit of 8,000 PHP per month, which they use to acquire their daily consumption and for the allowances of their children.

Due to financial difficulties, she is asking for additional capital of 13,000 PHP to buy fresh meat and pork sausages to sell in the market. She hopes that through this loan, she will improve her business. Emma hopes that in the future, she will see her business grow and that her children will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat and pork sausages to sell in the market.

loans.name: Hukmon

texts.ru: Хукмон женат и имеет четверых детей. В его бизнесе ему помогают его взрослые дети и жена. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и пшеницы, также выращивает крупный и мелкий рогатый скот. Полученные доходы идут на содержание семьи. Ему нужны денежные средства на приобретение минеральных удобрений, семян и обработки земли. Он надеется на получение займ.
texts.en: Hukmon is married and has four children that assist him in running the business. Hukmon breeds cattle (large and small) and grows agricultural products such as wheat. He uses the profits to support his family. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds and to develop his land. He's hoping to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Kholida

texts.ru: Более двух лет Холида занимается выращиванием пшеницы. Она активная и трудолюбивая незамужняя девушка. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль и купить себе швейную машинку, чтобы заниматься шитьем в сводное время, ведь это приносит ей дополнительный доход. Холида хотела бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Kholida has been growing wheat for over two years. She is an energetic and hard-working single woman. She would like to expand her business and maximize her profits and buy as sewing machine in order to do sewing in her spare time, since this brings her additional income. Kholida would like to obtain a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Alba Mónica

texts.es: Alba Mónica de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive con su madre en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de comida rápida en su hogar, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre satisface el gusto de las personas que la visitan con productos de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; Alba es una mujer emprendedora con grandes objetivos para el futuro, para ella el mayor de sus secretos es la constancia y el amor en su labor, quiere aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presenten es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar papitas, golosinas, producto congelado, bebidas entre otros. Alba Mónica tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Alba Mónica, 34, lives with her mother in her own house.  She has a fast-food business in her home.  She is very well known in the area and she has acquired many customers because she always satisfies the taste of the people who visit her with top-quality products at affordable prices.  Also, the service is excellent.  Alba is an enterprising woman with big objectives for the future.  Her greatest secret is perseverance and love in her work.

She wants to take advantage of all of the opportunities offered to her, and so she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy potatoes, sweets, frozen products, and drinks, among others.

Alba Mónica hopes that with her effort she will manage to bring financial security to her home and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sweets, frozen products, and drinks.

loans.name: Ndèye Fatou

texts.fr:
Mme Ndèye Fatou est une dame âgée de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait parti des premiers clients de l’Institution ou elle a bénéficié de plusieurs crédits.
Son activité consiste à élever des poulets de chair : une activité qu’elle fait depuis plus de 10 ans déjà 
Avec le crédit elle veut acheter de l’aliment volaille pour  avoir de bons sujets au finish.
Avec les bénéfices acquis elle renforce son activité en augmentant sa capacité de production et d’offre.
texts.en:
Ndèye Fatou is 57 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She was one of UIMCEC´s first customers and has already benefited from several loans.

Ndèye Fatou has been raising broiler chickens (chickens raised specifically for meat production) for over 10 years. She will use this loan to buy chicken feed so that she can raise healthy chickens to sell. She will use her profits to strengthen her business by increasing her production capacity and supply.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her broiler chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”LOS ANGELES;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Benedicta;  La socia tiene 54 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 5 hijos; los cuales ya son independientes; La socia se dedica  a la preparación de ceviche, este es un plato peruano a base de pescado y cocido con limón y sal, el ceviche es un plato que se sirve frio y acompañado de cebollas, tostado, choclo, camote,  ají y rocoto; la socia desea invertir en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de este rico potaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para elaborar este potaje.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Benedicta belongs to the "LOS ANGELES" communal bank.  The bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and state of Cuzco.  

Benedicta is 54 years old.  She is married and has 5 children who all live independently.  She prepares ceviche, a Peruvian dish made with fish "cooked" in lemon and salt.  Ceviche is a dish served cold, accompanied by onions, toasted bread, corn, sweet potatoes, ají sauce, and rocoto peppers.

She would like to purchase ingredients for the preparation of this delicious dish.  She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients to make ceviche.

Beneditcta is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to puchase ingredients to make ceviche.

loans.name: Juan Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Roberto; el tiene 19 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el estudio en la universidad, el socio estudia la carrera de psicología, el socio estudia desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el sueño del socio es salir profesional en la carrera de psicología. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor para implementar su casa.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juan Roberto, 19, belongs to the “Tinka” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  He’s single and alternates his daily activities with his university classes.  He is studying Psychology.  He attends classes from 7am until 6pm and his dream is to become a professional psychologist.  He is asking for the loan to buy a television set for his house.  He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy a television set.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 46, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business of repairing watches and clocks at the market. Four of her children are employed. Two are garment workers and two more are the staff in a food store. 

Thy requests a loan of USD 500 to purchase more watch-repairing tools for her husband to have enough tools to use in his reparation service. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more watch repairing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Erica Nohemi

texts.es:
Érica Nohemí de 28 años de edad, casada desde hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 9 años de edad quienes comienzan sus estudios, vive en Colonia flor Blanca, Petoa Santa Bárbara.

Erica, le gusta mucho la belleza, se propuso a estudiar en una academia de belleza, para cumplir su sueño de tener su propio negocio. Hace 2 años que lo estableció y ofrece los servicios de corte, alisado, secado, manicure, tintes e iluminaciones y también vende productos como champú, cosméticos, lociones, cremas etc. a este negocio ella le dedica 6 horas diarias. Lo que motivó es el deseo de sentirse útil aportando a la unidad familiar, aunque les dedique poco tiempo a sus hijos.
El préstamo que solicita es para invertir en productos de belleza, cosméticos, cremas, lociones etc. para uso en el salón y para vender a los clientes que necesitan algún producto de estos.
Su meta es llegar a tener un salón grande y tener más empleados que atiendan la demanda de clientes.
texts.en:
Érica Nohemí, age 28, has been married for ten years.  She has two children, ages five and nine, who are starting their education.  She lives in Colonia Flor Blanca, Petoa Santa Bárbara.

Erica really likes the beauty profession.  She went to study at a beauty academy in order to fulfill her dream of having her own business, which she established two years ago.  The services she offers are cutting, straightening, drying, manicure, dying, and highlighting.  She also sells products like shampoo, cosmetics, lotions, and creams, etc.  She devotes six hours a day to this business.  She was motivated by the desire to feel useful contributing to the family, even though she devotes little time to her children.

The loan she is requesting is to buy beauty products, cosmetics, creams, and lotions, etc. to use in the salon and to sell to the customers who need some of these products.

Her goal is to have a big salon and to have more employees to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, cosmetics, creams, and lotions, etc.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng is 22 years old and a villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Memot district. She is a mother of one son and he is too young for schooling. For her family, cassava farming on four and haft hectares of farmland is the main source for her to earn income. She is the third-time borrowerwith VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she paid her past loans. For this cycle, she is seeking for the loan in order to fertilizers and seeds for her cassava plantation. She hopes to collects more yield so as to better off her living’s condition.

loans.use: to fertilizers and seeds for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Jaja

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Jaja. Jaja lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Jaja owns a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone accessories and provide mobile payment service for his community. He feels that since he joined Ruma he learnt a lot about how to improve his business, as well as gave more contribution to his community. 

As the business keep growing, Jaja is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Imron improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Jaja is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Queen Esther Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Salome W. is a business woman, married and living in Ole Roimen. Most of her business skills have been learnt through years of practice by which she has acquired various businesses.

Salome operates her business of rental houses located in Ole Roimen area. She has a number of rental houses which provide income for her family. In addition to rental houses, she operates butchery and a shop in the same place. She sells kerosene, owns a kerosene pump and a grocery store.

loans.use: Salome intends to get a loan of USD 700 which will be used to renovate her rental houses. This will enable her increase income by increasing rent.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
DANIEL K. is a 34 yr old married truck driver with five children. His children are all in school in junior grades. They live in a small house in the suburbs of Nakuru city. Daniel is semi literate. He dropped out of school before going to high school due to lack of school fees. He was employed as a driver until two years ago when he bought a lorry with his own savings and started a transport services business. His wife does not work and he has to work hard to provide for his family maintenance and pay school fees. Daniel would like to a start a green grocer wholesale shop as a family business. His lorry will be transporting vegetables from the farms to his shop. This will help him maximize profit to increase his income. This is to pay for their children’s education especially when the two eldest join senior school next year.

Daniel requests for a US $ 1200 loan and plans to use it as follows:

US $ 1000 stocks the business

US $ 100 pay for a license

US $ 100 for decoration i.e. shelves etc

He is focused and will repay the loan.

loans.use: START A GREEN GROCERY SHOP

loans.name: Anna
