She is always watchful of her two small children who are very important to her.  Because of this she strives to keep the business which is what generates income for her home.

She will use the loan to buy tortillas, cheese, bags and napkins, among others.  Petrona’s dream is to leave the business to her children so that they will have a means of supporting themselves.

loans.use: To buy tortillas, cheese, bags and napkins, among others.

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
Ligia madre soltera, mujer emprendedora, trabajadora ha salido adelante con sus hijos y tiene proyecto de mejorara su vivienda, cumplir con su sueño de que sus hijos se preparen y en ámbito laboral que ella tenga sus tramos en el cual tenga uno de abarrote y el otro una peluquería, ya que tiene conocimiento en el ramo de la belleza. Como fuente de trabajo tiene su pulpería que su hijo le apoya en la venta, también la peluquería y alquila cuartos para universitarios.  Inicio su pulpería con fondo propios y poco apoco ha ido aumentando sus ventas. 
El préstamo que solicitad es para agrandar su inventario con la compra de nuevas y variada mercadería como: artículos escolares, bisutería, perfumes, granos básicos, productos enlatados, bebidas y otros. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su desarrollo como micro empresaria que es.
texts.en: Ligia is a single mother. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who has provided for her children and now has a project to improve their home. Her dream is to ensure her children have a good education and, in terms of work, for one to have a grocery shop and the other a hairdressers. Ligia herself has a small grocery shop and a hairdressers. She also rents out rooms to university students. She opened her grocery shop with her own savings and gradually increased her sales over time. She will use the loan to broaden the range of products she sells, to include new and varied merchandise such as: school stationery; inexpensive jewellery; perfumes; basic cereals; canned produce; and drinks. She is very grateful for the financial support, to help develop her small enterprise.

loans.use: compra de productos

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr: Monsieur Tété habite quartier Adidogomé. Il est marié et père de  2 enfants. Il  est âgé de 62 ans. Il exerce comme activité la vente de carte de recharge et téléphone. Il  a commencé  en 2006 et s’approvisionne à la direction Togocel, Togo Telecom et Moov. Ensuite il revend dans une cabine à côté de Boukarou.   Il demande un crédit  pour  acheter  200 cartes Togocel, 80 cartes Illico Togo télécom et 150 cartes Moov.
texts.en: Monsieur Tété lives in the Adidogomé area. He is a married father of two. He is 62 years old. He makes his living by selling phone cards and phones. He started in 2006 and stocks up with Togocel, Togo Télécom and Moov. He then sells in a booth next to Boukarou. He is seeking a loan to buy 200 Togocel cards, 80 Togo Télécom cards, and 150 Moov cards.

loans.use: to buy phone cards

loans.name: Joel Adalberto

texts.es:
Joel de 26 años, es un joven trabajador que desde muy pequeño aprendió a reparar bicicletas. Poco a poco fue incursionando en el mercado de bicicletas hasta ahora que tiene un pequeño taller de reparación de bicicletas. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Repara los tubos, frenos da mantenimiento a las bicicletas etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su taller ya que desea con el préstamo comprar tubos, cadenas aceite. En el futuro quiere que su negocio aumente con mas clientela.
texts.en:
26 year-old Joel is a hard-working young man who learned to repair bicycles at a very young age.  He gradually broke into the bicycle market and now has a small workshop where he repairs bicycles.

Joel currently works from 8.00am to 8.00pm every day.  He repairs inner tubes and brakes, and does maintenance work on bicycles.  Joel has a lot of aspirations for his workshop.  He would like to use his loan to buy inner tubes, chains and oil.  In the future, he would like his business to grow and have more customers.

loans.use: to buy inner tubes and chains

loans.name: Dzingenhamo Group

texts.en:
Florence D., in the middle of the front row, is the leader of the Dzingenhamo group. Florence is a 48-year-old cross-border trader who imports blankets, clothes and pots for resale.  Her husband works as a driver at a local firm. They have 4 children and two other dependants. One child aged 15 is still attending school. Her business operations at times dwindle as a result of her debtors failing to pay on time. 

Florence will buy more clothing and blankets for resale with the loan she has requested through MicroKing. She will also purchase airtime cards for resale. She strongly believes that her livelihood will be improved by the loan as she sees herself acquiring better household assets. Florence wishes to own her business premises in the future as she is currently renting. She is very thankful to MicroKing and Kiva for the loan facility that will assist in increasing her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and clothes for resale

loans.name: Lanier De Jesús

texts.es:
Lanier, tiene 28 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad La Pita, ubicada en el municipio Miraflor, Estelí, de oficio agricultor, esta casado tiene dos hijos, lleva 6 años dedicándose a la siembra de hortaliza de forma independiente. Empezó con ayuda de su papa a la edad de 10 años, su padre le enseñaba a preparar la tierra, pero difícil situación económica le impidieron seguir con sus estudios, se tuvo que dedicar tiempo completo a trabajar para poder subsistir y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra de siembra de tomate. Le ayudara a aumentar su producción, sacar mejor rendimiento de su cosecha de tomate. 
Tiene como planes futuros ampliar su siembra de tomate, sembrar chiltoma y cebolla, le gustaría poder venderlos fuera de Estelí en los departamentos de León y Managua. Su próxima meta es sembrar 3 manzanas de maíz y ¼ de manzana de frijol.
texts.en:
Lanier, aged 28, lives in La Pita, a neighborhood located in the municipality of Miraflor in Estelí. He is a farmer, married and the father of two children. He has been an independent vegetable farmer for six years. He began working with his father when he was 10 years old and learnt how to prepare the field. However, financial hardship prevented him from finishing his studies and he had to work full-time to survive and provide for his family.

Lanier applies for this loan to maintain his tools, buy supplies and pay laborers to grow tomatoes. It will help him increase production and get a better return on his tomato crop.

His future plan is to expand his tomato crop, and to grow sweet peppers and onions. He would like to sell them outside of Estelí, namely in the departments of León and Managua. His next goal is to plant 2 hectares of corn and 17 ares of beans (5 and 0.4 acres, respectively).

loans.use: to maintain his tools, buy supplies and pay laborers to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and married with two children. Elvira works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

Elvira has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, sugar, "Pancit", curls, etc. 

In the future Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ori-Loniche Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ORI-LONICHE  est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent et qui appartiennent au même groupe d’artisan. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Gabriel est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gabriel est né le six février 1975. Gabriel est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Pauline. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge dont deux sont les leurs. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents mais ne sont pas scolarisés. Gabriel  est un mécanicien. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Gabriel vend depuis neuf ans des pièces de rechange, dans son atelier. Gabriel  s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Gabriel sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The "Ori-Loniche" group is composed of three people who know each other and belong to the same craftsmen's group. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), in order to raise the level of their businesses. The group representative, named Gabriel, is the man whose hand is raised in the photo. Gabriel was born on 6 February 1975 and is married to a hairstylist named Pauline. The couple have four children in their care, of whom two are their own. The children live together with their parents but do not attend school. Gabriel is a mechanic. Alongside this business, which allows him to provide for himself and his children, Gabriel has been selling spare parts at his workshop for nine years. He gets his supplies in Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. With the goal of satisfying his clientele and increasing his sales volume and income, Gabriel, together with his group, is seeking his first loan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Moises Adali

texts.es:
Moisés, vive con su familia, sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, todos trabajan en su familia, él es comerciante de medicina, este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas, antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas, esta compra le ayudara a tener abastecido el negocio, para ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar los ingresos.
Su aspiración es montar su propio negocio en un lugar estratégico, incrementar la clientela y aportar para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Moisés is single.  He lives with his family: parents and siblings.  Everyone in his family works.  He sells medicine, a business he carries out as a street vendor.

He is asking for a loan to buy medicines, antibiotics, analgesics and vitamins.  This purchase will help him have his business stocked for his customers and to improve his income.

His hope is to set up a business of his own in a strategic spot, increase his clientele and provide his family with what’s needed.

loans.use: to buy medicines, antibiotics, analgesics and vitamins.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, age 29, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of weaving traditional silk products, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction foreman, earning an income of $4 per day. 

Phalla is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce more silk products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been in farming for over 15 years, producing and selling milk, maize, cabbages, tomatoes and tea. She also gets additional income from working as a tea harvester.  Josephine is married and has 4 children between 12 and 3 years old. All her children are in school and live with her in their home in Nyamira, South Rift Kenya.

Josephine has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will help her educate her children. She is also focusing on purchasing more land and acquiring two additional dairy cows.

Josephine says crop diseases are a challenge to farmers. She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for its support of farmers.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells shea butter, steel wool and soaps at Elmina. She is single and has 5 children. She has been selling shea butter for 6 years. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more shea butter and soaps. She hopes to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more shea butter and soaps.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, 25, sells grocery items, CDs, and VCDs. Her husband has full-time employment. She lives in a village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has no children yet.     
 
Ra is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional grocery items, CDs, and VCDs for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items, CDs, and VCDs for sale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old. She is from Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is married, with 2 school-aged children to attend to. For 1 year, Jocelyn has been enjoying her new livelihood.  She peddles deliciously-cooked foods around the community and has put a temporary food station outside the house. She makes PHP 5,000 from it every month.

This year Jocelyn became one of the registered GDMPC members. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy foods and drinks as additional products to offer.  In this way, she can improve her general living conditions and earn more to use for business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase foods and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a married woman with eight children. Seven of her children graduated from school and one still attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a firewood, charcoal and food vending business. Her potential customers are the neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation because of poor roads. Mkambe dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Félix Humberto

texts.es: Félix Humberto de de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee un comedor, vende ricos almuerzos todos los días, Félix es un gran cocinero prepara platillos exquisitos para el deleite de sus clientes a precios muy accesibles, la comida es de muy buena calidad y el lugar es muy higiénico además el servicio que les ofrece es inigualable; Félix es un hombre de metas, quiere ver crecer su negocio y mantenerse siempre adelante de la competencia, para él la disciplina y la constancia en el trabajo son el mejor amigo del hombre porque permiten que realices tus mas grandes propósitos, es así como se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carnes, verduras, embutidos condimentos entre otros, para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela. Félix Humberto tiene fe que con su esfuerzo le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Félix Humberto is 45 years old, and lives with his life companion and children.  He has a diner where he sells rich lunches every day.  Félix is a great cook who makes exquisite dishes for the delight of his customers, at very affordable prices.  The food is of very good quality, and the premises are very hygienic; also, the service that he provides is incomparable.

Félix is a man with goals.  He wants to grow his business and keep himself always moving ahead of the competition.  For him, discipline and constancy in work are the best friends of a man, because they allow him to realize all his grand plans.  

This is why he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow him to buy bulk grains, meat, vegetables, sausages, condiments and other things, to meet his customers' needs.

Félix Humberto has faith that with his efforts, he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, meat, vegetables, sausages, and condiments.

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
Ghaith is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with eight family members, three of whom work. Since 2008 he has owned a barber shop where he offers services including haircutting, coloring and texturing in addition to shaving and trimming beards. He has 5 years of experience in this field. He has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He is well-known in his area.

Ghaith is requesting a $2400 loan in order to renovate, redecorate and make a digital advertising box for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to renovate, redecorate and make a digital advertising box for his barbershop

loans.name: Virgen Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La señora Narley nació en el distrito D. Huallabamba D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y radica en la comunidad D. Hycho del distrito  D. Huallababamba. (La socia está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

La señora Narley tiene 24 años y tiene una relación D. libre unión D. la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable que saca adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras y vendía en la ciudad D. Urubamba pero ahora venD. verduras en la comunidad D. Hycho D. forma ambulatoria. En esta oportunidad Narley requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras.   

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “virgen Guadalupe” son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Hycho. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Hycho y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. maíz, venta D. verduras, venta D. comida, venta D. cereales,  venta D. ropa y otros brindan servicios varios. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Señora Narley was born in the Huallabamba district in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco, and she lives in the community of Hycho in Huallabamba district.  (The member is raising her hand in the photograph).

Señora Narley is 24 years old and lives in a common law relationship from which she has a child.  She is a hard-working woman, who is responsible and moves her family ahead in life.  She works selling vegetables; she used to sell in Urubamba market, but now she sells in the Pompas market in Hycho as a street vendor. On this occasion, Narley wants the loan to buy more vegetables.

The members of the "Virgen Guadalupe” communal bank meet every month in the community of Hycho.  The communal bank is maD. up of people who are hard-working and entrepreneurial.  They are continually looking for opportunities to move ahead in life and through their daily efforts to deliver a better future for their children.  The majority of the members live in the community of Hycho, and the economic activities of the other members incluD. selling corn, selling vegetables, selling food, selling cereals, selling clothes, and others who proviD. various services.

Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.  

(The member who is in the rear of the photograph came late to the communal bank meeting).

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 62, is married and has two children. Her children are already married and she lives with her husband. Rosita has a business selling a variety of products in her "sari-sari store" general store to earn an income. She believes it is better to have her own business, in order to earn her own income. She has been in this business for four years and has monthly earnings of 5,000 PHP. She is doing her best to expand her business.

Rosita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more items to sell. In the future, Rosita wants to save funds through savings, portion of her income to have good life. She hopes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old and is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has a business selling tea in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to purchase more sugar and glasses for her to operate the business. She will use the profit from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and glasses for tea sales.

loans.name: Djumabay

texts.ru:
Джумабай проживает в селе Чалдовар (Панфиловский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан) и воспитывает дочь девяти лет. 
Джумабай родился в 1969 году в простой семье фермера.  У отца было небольшое фермерское хозяйство и с детства Джумабай помогал отцу по уходу за скотом и мечтал в будущем иметь свое собственное хозяйство. 
В 1988 году, после окончания школы, Джумабай пошел служить в армию и 1990, вернувшись в родное село и  выучившись на водителя сельхоз техники, устроился в местный колхоз в качестве тракториста - комбайнера. 
Через некоторое время Джумабай женился  и постепенно, получая зарплату, покупал молодняк и выращивал клевер и зерновые, таким образом  приумножая хозяйство. В 2002 году родилась дочь, а  в 2003 году Джумабай смог купить собственный дом для своей семьи.
На данный момент благодаря упорству Джумабая, в хозяйстве у него насчитывается 3 дойных коровы и 22 головы баранов. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Джумабай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)на покупку бычков для откорма.    В будущем Джумабай планирует увеличение поголовья скота и мечтает купить внедорожник.
texts.en: Djumabay lives in the Chaldovar village (Panfilovsk district, Chuysk region, Kyrgyzstan) and is raising one nine-year daughter.  Djumabay was born in 1969 into a simple farmer's family.  His father had a small farm, and since childhood, Djumabay helped his father with caring for the livestock and dreamed of having his own farm in the future.  In 1988, after finishing school, Djumabay went to serve in the army.  Upon his return to his native village in 1990, he studied to become a driver of agricultural machinery and was hired at the local collective farm as a tractor/combine driver.  After some time, Djumabay got married and, using his salary, gradually purchased young livestock and grew clover and cereals; thus, expanding his farm.  His daughter was born in 2002, and Djumabay was able to buy his own house for his family in 2003.  Currently, thanks to Djumabay's persistence, his farm contains 3 dairy cows and 22 heads of sheep.  In order to further develop his business, Djumabay requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for the purchase of bulls for fattening up.  In the future, Djumabay plans to increase livestock headcount and dreams of buying an off-road vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Luz Katherine

texts.es: La señora Luz es una cliente nueva en la institución vino por referencias de un familiar que tuvo un crédito en la institución ya cancelado se dedica a la venta de comida en una pensión por un mercado el crédito esta destinado a la compra de sillas, mesas, vajillas un televisor de 21 pulgadas un aparato de radio y algunos utensilios para mejorar la calidad en el servicio y ampliar su negocio. Tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar y vive con su esposo en la casa de sus papas en la zona de Llojeta, es un apersona joven y trabajadora su deseo es ampliar su restaurante y dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes .
texts.en:
Señora Luz is a new client for the institution.  She came through the referral of a relative, who obtained a loan from the institution which has already been paid back.

Luz works preparing meals in a boarding-house a market.  This loan will be used for purchasing chairs, tables, dishes, a 21 inch TV, a radio, and several utensils for improving the quality of her service and expanding her business.

She has one school-age son, and lives with her husband in his parents' home in the Llojeta area.  She is a young, hard-working woman, whose wish is to expand her restaurant and provide better comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and other things to expand her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child who has not yet begun schooling. Janet owns a boutique that has been in operation for the last two years. Janet also sells water to her neighbors.

She joined Milango after an invitation from her friend in order to access credit. This was because she lacked capital to increase stock in her business. Janet is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase handbags and clothes.

It is peak season in Changamwe and with Christmas festivities approaching, Janet believes she can make enough sales to save for her future use and also improve the living standard of her family. Her future ambition is to open other stalls.

loans.use: To purchase handbags and clothes.

loans.name: Lugari Farmer A Group

texts.en:
Rajab is the facilitator of the Lugari Farmer A group. Rajab and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rajab takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Rajab had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Rajab was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rajab and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rajab will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Lugari Farmer A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Rajab is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is a single woman and she is 22 years of age.

Sila owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Sila needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2011, Sila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sila's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is a 46-year-old single woman living with her parents. She grows fruits and vegetables in the garden. She started this business four years ago. She chose this field because fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan. People like to eat them fresh and make fresh juices which is very healthy. She sells her crops in the central bazaar and her monthly income is 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). Raising crops takes a lot of strength and means working in the open air, which is very hard for women. Guldasta is a very strong woman and has the potential to work even harder to produce more crops.

Guldasta needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she grows and increase monthly turnover. For this purpose, she applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Karem Del Socorro

texts.es: Karem es una joven emprendedora, está estudiando Psicología, el préstamo será usado para pagar el curso de titulación de finalización de sus estudios, sus padres le apoyaran en al pago del crédito. Dentro de algunos años se ve en su propia clínica, siendo capaz de ganar su propio salario, Su inspiración es su hijo porque es lo que más quiere en su vida, y es su motor. Ha sido formada en una familia honrada y mi familia tiene un récord crediticio excelente. Su embarazo fue un desafío ya que lo vivió estando en la universidad, pero su familia le ayudó a superarlo tanto en lo económico como emocional
texts.en: Karem is an enterprising young woman.  She’s studying Psychology.  The loan will be used to pay for the final coursework in her studies.  Her parents will help her repay the loan.  In a few years she sees herself in her own clinic able to earn her own salary.  Her inspiration is her son because she loves him above all else in life and he’s her motivating factor.  She’s grown up in an honest family and her family has excellent credit history.  Her pregnancy was a challenge since she underwent it while attending university but her family helped her overcome it both emotionally and economically.

loans.use: to pay graduation costs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 50 años, casada tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 27, 23, 15 y 10 años,   ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo,  es promotora,  ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a usar este préstamo  para comprar zapatos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio ya que esta época de fin año su demanda se incrementa ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old, is married and has four children aged 10, 15, 23 and 27. She sells shoes by catalogue and is a promoter. She sells as a travelling saleswoman visiting public and private institutions and homes in various neighborhoods offering her products. 

This loan is her first sequence with the institution. Juana is going to use this loan to buy shoes that are on sale to have them in stock for her business since during this end of year period her demands increase and she already has many orders to deliver. Her reason for requesting this loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy her customers. 

Juana faces challenges in her business which are to serve her customers with efficiency. She is going to use the profits to improve the quality of life of her family since this is the only business that allows her to support herself and support her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes which are on sale to have them in stock.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine, a teacher with university degree, lives and works in Bnunis village of Shirak region. She has been working at the local village school for already 6 years. 
Karine's family consist of 5 members: her mother-in-law, husband and two little sons (in the photo). 
After her work as a teacher, Karine helps her husband with the family's farm. The family keeps a big livestock of 10 cows, 3 calves, 16 oxen, 20 sheep, and 2 piglets. Last year, with the profits gathered from farm, the family also purchased arable land near their house, where wheat and potato are cultivated. 
Karine's main goal is to sustain her family's living providing her children with normal living conditions. SHe requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season. This is highly important for their farming business as the cattle is big and family can't purchase the forage for it with savings. Karine and her whole family hope to receive lenders' support and continue their hard and tireless work.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season

loans.name: Port

texts.en:
This business is located in Au Bekam, Dangkar District, outside of Phnom Penh City

Part Sithaot is a nurse; she acts as a medical assistant for the families in the neighborhood. Most of the time, she is living alone with her four children as her husband is a soldier. She moved from Battambang to Phnom Penh 6 years ago to follow her elder son who was starting with the University.

With the $1600 she requested from CREDIT, Part Sithaot will be able to enlarge her house. She has already bought the material but needs this money to hire people to perform the operations. Sithaot will not have any problem to find her labor force among the unemployed youth of her community. It will cost her around $1.25 per day per worker.

With this loan, Sithaot is also planning to open a furniture workshop. She will rent a place, purchase tools and raw materials and employ permanently at least two skilled workers.

Part Sithaot is confident about repaying her loan. It is the second time I borrow from CREDIT, she said, and so far, I have never been late.

loans.use: House enlargement and furniture workshop opening

loans.name: Koffi Sylvain

texts.en:
Married with four children, Mr. Koffi Sylvain A. is a gentle and honest man. His wife’s income from selling vegetables doesn't go very far towards the household expenses. For Mr. A., cultivating oil palm trees is a very profitable occupation. He sells the palm fruits to women who make the palm oil. He currently owns a small palm grove, and he is requesting a loan of $700 to extend the grove, thus turning it into a real plantation that would satisfy the demands of his clientele. Mr. A. received an initial loan, which he has already paid off, and he has high hopes for this new loan that will enable him to take care of his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, Monsieur A. Koffi Sylvain est un homme doux et honnête. Les revenus de la vente des légumes de sa femme n’arrivent pas à contribuer efficacement aux charges du foyer. Pour Monsieur A., la culture du palmier à huile est une activité très rentable. Il vend les noix aux femmes qui font de l’huile de palme. Il possède aujourd’hui une petite palmeraie et sollicite ce crédit de $700 pour l’agrandir puis en faire une véritable plantation pour satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle. Il a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qu’il a d’ailleurs déjà soldé. Monsieur A. attend beaucoup de ce nouveau crédit qui lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To extend his palm grove

loans.name: Vitali

texts.en:
Vitali is a young clothing merchant from Nikopol, Ukraine on the beautiful Dnepro River. He started his small business when he was in his late 20’s and gradually, though much hard work, he has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise.

Vitali has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural business man. Funding from “Nadiya Ukraine” has been instrumental in helping Vitali build his business. His first loan was for $500 and since that time he has benefited from nine additional loans while establishing a great credit history.

He has requested $1200 to add to his available working capital. The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for merchants such as Vitali. He would like to buy a supply of men’s sportswear and men’s and women’s jean clothing that will boost his inventory before the busy summer season. Vitali appreciates the availability of funding through Nadiya Ukraine. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family.

Віталій – молодий підприємець, займається продажем одягу на місцевому ринку м. Нікополь. Він відкрив власну справу, коли йому було лише 20 з чимось. Віталій наполегливо працював й поступово його бізнес ставав успішним. У Віталія є усі якості та здібності, які необхідні підприємцю для успіху. Цілеспрямований, працьовитий та пунктуальний - він дуже ділова людина. Фінансова підтримка від „Надії України” сприяла розвитку бізнесу Віталія. Розмір його першої позики складав 500 доларів. З того часу він вчасно сплатив 9 позик, в нього склалася чудова кредитна історія. Віталій просить про позику в 1200 доларів, тому що хоче поповнити свій робочий капітал. Можливість оптом закупити велику партію товару дасть йому шанс зберегти час та зменшити витрати. Віталій планує купити повсякденний чоловічий та джинсовий жіночий одяг, розширити асортимент товарів напередодні літнього сезону. Він цінує доступність кредитних послуг в „Надії України”. Завдяки позикам у Віталія з’являється багато нових можливостей, він може зосередитися на рості свого бізнесу та забезпеченні власної родини.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar works with his wife in a salon where they do manicures, pedicures, massages and reduction treatments. He lives in the zone Miraflores, where he also sees his customers, he has one employee who he pays a percentage according to the work she does. This is the first time that he is applying for a loan with IMPRO. The loan will be used to purchase material ( porcelain, bone, nail polishes in all colors and nailpolish remover.). His work makes him a good candidate for this loan as he already has work experience, the incomes from which will be able to cover the loan, and he has no other bills to pay.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Omar trabaja con su esposa y se dedican al servicio de manicure, pedicure, masajes y tratamientos de reducción. Vive en la zona de Miraflores donde también atienden a sus clientes; tiene una empleada a quien le paga un porcentaje de acuerdo al trabajo que realiza. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de material (Porcelana, yeso, esmalte de todo color, y quita esmalte) Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo, considerando que no tiene otras cuentas por pagar.

loans.use: To purchase work materials.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella O. is happily married with 7 children. She sells provisions, pure water & food stuffs to those living in her community. She has 4 years of  experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of $550 to buy more food stuffs, pure water & provisions to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, pure water, food stuffs & provisions

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma has a small general store at the market in Leon. She started out more than twenty years ago selling candy and cigarettes in front of the bus terminal. After several years of hard work, she obtained a small loan from Banco Popular and set up a small stand selling watches and cosmetics. She started selling some clothing from her makeshift hut of wood, cardboard and plastic. She added cheap toys to the mix and continued to grow the business. Norma is the single mother of two--one in grade school and the other in high school. Thanks to many years of effort she has seen her children advance and provided a humble home for them.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora posee un pequeño, pero bien surtido negocio de mercadería en general ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de León. Ella inicia hace más de 20 años con un pequeño canasto de venta de cigarrillos y golosinas, ubicada frente a la parada de buses, ella trabajaba en la acera de la terminal.

Luego de varios años de esfuerzo, logra mediante un pequeño crédito del Banco Popular poner una pequeña mesa de relojes y cosméticos, luego vino la venta de algunas piezas de ropa, para ese entonces ya contaba con una pequeña caseta hecha de madera, cartón y plástico, más tarde agregó venta de juguetes baratos y en fin poco a poco fue surtiendo su negocio. Ella es madre soltera con un total de 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando uno en primaria y otro en secundaria. Gracias al esfuerzo de muchos años ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y obtener su humilde casa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan Y., age 45, is a widow who makes her living by producing mortar and pestles, earning on average US$4 a day in revenue. She has four children: two work at a garment factory earning US$80 a month each, and two are students. Mrs. Y. would like to borrow US$700 in order to buy more rocks to increase the mortar and pestle output and her income. She will use the additional income to raise her family’s standard of living and fund her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of rocks to produce mortar and pestles

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is 29 years old. She studied through secondary school. She has 2 children, both dependent on her. Currently Rosario lives in the district of Laredo, in the province of Trujillo and the department (region) of La Libertad. She works selling beauty products by catalog and selling clothing on credit. Her principal clients are the vendors of the Modelo market in Laredo, whom she has known for a long time; they are her loyal clients. It was some of these vendors from the Market who invited Rosario to invest in the commnity bank "Laredo". Through this community bank she obtained her first loan fo 300 soles (Peruvian currency) ,with which she bought beauty products for her inventory.

With this lnew oan of 1800 soles , which she will repay in full in 6 months, Rosario will buy clothing. She plans to sell the clothing during the holiday season at the end of the year and into the summer season. Her dream is to launch a large boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosario tiene 29 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Actualmente la señora Rosario vive en el distrito de Laredo provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y ropa al crédito y sus principales clientes son los vendedores del mercado “Modelo” de Laredo a los que conoce hace mucho tiempo y son sus clientes fieles. Justamente algunas de estas vendedoras del mercado fueron quienes la invitaron a ingresar la Banco Comunal “Laredo”, en este Banco Comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 soles, con este dinero compró productos de belleza para tener en stock. Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 soles, que cancelará en seis meses, comprará ropa, la cual piensa vender en estas fiestas de fin de año e inicio de la temporada de verano. Su mayor sueño es poner una boutique grande.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Yawa Holali

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Mrs. Yawa Holali A. did not have the chance to go to school. Married, she has four (04) children. For more than 15 years, she has turned manioc into gari (flour), and also practiced agriculture. With these activities, she meets the dietary needs of her children as well as she can. Her husband, a farmer and gravel harvester, gives her a hand with the education of the children. Honest and dynamic, she managed her three previous loans well. In order to extend her agricultural options, she is asking for a loan of $750, which will serve to grow maize, manioc, okra, and peanuts. A portion of the loan is destined for the transformation of manioc into gari. She will thus be able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1972, Madame A. Yawa Holali n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle fait depuis plus de 15 ans la transformation du manioc en gari et l’agriculture. A partir de ces activités, elle assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Son mari agriculteur et exploitant de gravier lui donne des coups de mains dans l’éducation des enfants. Honnête et dynamique, elle a su gérer les trois précédents crédits obtenus. Afin d’étendre sa surface cultivable, elle sollicite un appui financier de $750 qui servira à faire la culture de maïs, de manioc, de gombo et d’arachide. Une partie va être destinée à la transformation du manioc en « gari ». Elle pourra ainsi subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To grow food crops

loans.name: Magamaga Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Feda N.. She is currently in the nursery seedling business and is requesting a loan to buy more farm equipment like watering cans. Feda is 38 years old and married. Her husband is a librarian. She has 5 children ranging from age 8 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Feda makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add more to her business. Feda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Feda is joined in her small group by Janet K.. Janet K. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To add to seedlings business

loans.name: Kabiroy

texts.ru:
Kabiroy Dzhuraevna B., 41, lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has five children. Since Kabiroy has finished only secondary school, she doesn't have a specialized education and does not work outside the home. However, she is engaged in livestock breeding at home, which brings badly needed income to her family. Kabiroy is applying for a loan to buy a cow, in order to increase the number of livestock she owns. This will serve as an investment for her family. Kabiroy can pay off the loan within 8 months, after which the cow will remain in her possession and bear calves.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Баратова Кабирой Джураевна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 41 год, замужем и имеет 5 детей. Закончила только среднюю школу, поэтому не имеет специального образования и нигде не работает. Но все-таки дома у нее имеется маленькое хозяйство, в котором она разводит домашних животных. Ее занятие дает ее семье доход, в котором она так нуждается. Сейчас клиентка хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить одну корову, для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это будет вложением денег для ее семьи, а погасить кредит она сможет частично в течении 8 месяцев, но зато у нее останется корова , которая сможет дать ей приплод.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Anna M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 13 and 20. She also has two dependents, her nephews, who live with her.

In 2006, Anna established her grocery store. Anna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase oil, cocoa, and cloth in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase oil, cocoa, and cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es:
Keeping her family together and without deprivation is the aim of Fidelia and her dear husband Melquíades, who works diligently as a master of construction while Fidelia works making beautiful and colorful ponchos, sweaters, caps and gloves that are sold at the San José y Laguna Temporal market in the city of Juliaca, in which they live. In order to perform her work, she currently has 2 weaving machines but right now she needs to acquire a larger quantity of raw material (wool) to continue making her beautiful garments so that she can fulfill the all of her clients' orders, which makes her feel very satisfied with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Mantener a su familia unida y sin privaciones es el fin de Fidela y su querido esposo Melquíades, quien labora diligentemente como maestro de construcción.En tanto doña Fidela se dedica a confeccionar hermosos y coloridos ponchos, chompas, chullos y guantes que son vendidos en el mercado San José y Laguna Temporal de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca.Para realizar su trabajo actualmente cuenta con 2 máquinas de tejer, pero en estos momentos requiere adquirir mayor materia prima (lana) para seguir confeccionando sus hermosas prendas y así cumplir con la gama de solicitudes de sus clientes, que para su satisfacción se sienten complacidos con su trabajo.

loans.use: Increasing capital in order to buy a larger quantity of raw material

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50 year-old Lucy S.. She is married and has six children aged between 12 and 22. In 2004, Lucy established her grocery and snacks business. Lucy has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, fruits, vegetables, and ingredients to make samosas. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, fruit and vegetables as well as ingredients for samosas.

loans.name: Mohamed Lamin's Group

texts.en: This group of soldiers are requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1,375. Three of them will give their share of the loan to their wives to invest in business so that the proceeds they get from these businesses will complement their salaries. The other two will use theirs to complete the building of houses they have already started. Their names are (right to left), Mohamed Lamin M., Mohamed M. K., Saidu Kabba, Peter K. and Sulaiman  K.. Mohamed Lamin M. (for this purpose) is the leader of this group. He is 27, born in Kailahun, over 150 miles from Makeni. He has two children who are currently living in Freetown with their mom. His wife will invest this loan in her current soft drink business.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca belongs to the Teresa Ramos Community Bank located in Jr. Callao # 427 of the Yarina Cocha District of the Ucayali Department. She is 26 years old. Her husband is a sales agent. She decided to invest her first loan of S/. 300 received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of fishing products. Her stand is located in a market close to the port, allowing her to sell these products to the fishermen that work there. With this loan of S/ 1,000, which will be paid over 5 months, she will increase her business by buying fish hooks of all sizes, nets, nylon and line preparation products. Francisca is a very happy person because she feels very accomplished as a woman, a businesswoman and a wife and thanks the opportunity that has been given in giving her a loan to invest in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Francisca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa Ramos, ubicado en el Jr. Callao # 427, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años. Su esposo es agente vendedor. Francisca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de productos par pesca. Su puesto se encuentra en un mercado que esta cerca del puerto donde le permite vender estos productos a los pescadores que trabajan allí. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, incrementara su negocio comprando anzuelos de todo tamaño, redes. Nailon y productos de pasamanería. Francisca es una persona muy alegre dado que se siente muy realizada como mujer, empresaria y como esposa y agradece la oportunidad que se le dio en darle un crédito para invertir en este negocio.

loans.use: To purchase fishing supplies (nets, fish hooks, etc.)

loans.name: Youn

texts.en:
Mrs. Youn N., 47, lives in Serey Sokhom Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a vegetable farmer and owns a field that is three hectares. Her husband, Mr. Lay Sut, is raising five cows and also helps with his wife's business. The couple has one child who is employed in a garment factory.

Her field is covered with grass, thus she cannot grow vegetables. In order to solve this problem, Mrs.Youn N. has decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer to chop the grasses so she may grow vegetables. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to chop the all grasses in order to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Leyla M., es una cliente de nuestra institucion que tiene 45 años de edad, es casada,tiene dos hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad respectivamente, uno cursa el cuarto año de bachillerato y el mayor va iniciar en la universidad, su compañero de vida trabaja como mecanico, uno de sus propositos es seguir siendo cliente de la institucion, para poder ir mejoradno su inventario, su deseo es poder llegar a tener una minidistribuidora y mejorar sus condiciones economicas, su sueño es poder ir creciendo economicamente en su negocio y poder ver a sus hijos con una carrera coronada como profesionales, su deseo es poder realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, por consiguiente darle condicioens de vida a sus familia. En cuanto a su actividad economica ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso y consumo diario del hogar como es una pulperia donde ademas de ofrecer estos productos tambien ofrece cosa de horno un producto tipico de nuestro pais, teniendo cinco años de dedicarse a la pulperia, el cual da inicio como una necesidad en vista que su marido por el tipo de trabajo muchas veces no tiene un ingresos fijo, de ahi surge la idea de poner un negocio que en la actualidad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos, con el credito pretende adquirir productos como arroz, azucar, detergentes, verdura, gaseosa entre otros productos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leyla M. is45 years old, she is married and hast two children who are 16 and 18 years old, and are studying in school, the oldest one will start university soon. Her life partner works as a mechanic. Her goal is to keep on growing her business and have one day a mini-distribution company and see her children graduating as professionals, and improve her family’s living conditions. She works at her grocery store for the last 5 years and also offers “cosa de horno” (oven thing) a typical dish from Nicaragua. She started this business because her partner’s job sometimes doesn’t bring constant income, so currently her store is their main source of income. The loan she is requesting is to buy products like sugar, detergent, vegetables, and sodas, among other home products.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Despertar ("Awaken") Communal Bank. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband and their five children. She has a stand in the Miraflores market (located on the outskirts of the city of Ayacucho) where she sells dry goods every day. She also has another stand, administered by her son, where she sells grains. Her son works at the stand in the morning and studies in the afternoons.

Elizabeth needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy fruitcake and milk for the Christmas season.

Elizabeth dreams of buying a car to use for passenger transport and for her children to complete their education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Elizabeth tiene un puesto en el mercado Miraflores que se ubica en las afueras de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Elizabeth tiene otro puesto en donde vende cereales, este negocio esta administrado por su hijo quien atiende por las mañanas y por las tardes estudia. Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, leches para la campaña navideña. Elizabeth sueña con comprar un carro para realizar transporte urbano y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake and milk

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mr. Chan M., 59, has run his business for over ten years. He makes jars, and usually sells them to wholesalers who order a few days or a week in advance. He has five children, two of whom are construction worker in Thailand, and three who are married. His wife, Mrs. Chim Phet, age 61, helps in her husband's business. 

Mr. M. would like to get a loan to purchase more raw materials to make jars to sell. The family reside in Banteay Meanchey Province.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han P., 36, is a local farmer and a resident of Pursat Province where she has been growing rice and vegetable crops which she can grow twice per year, for a profit, since 1996. She now cares for four children; all of them are teenagers and students, while her husband is a fisherman and also works with her in the farming business. Before, she used to hire a buffalo from a neighbor for her farming activities. Now she hopes to have her own buffalo by requesting a loan to buy two buffaloes to help her with her farming and provide an extra asset. (She and her husband appear in the picture.)

loans.use: to buy two buffaloes to help her with her farming

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter M. is an enterprising Tanzanian man. He runs a shop at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of items, including serial crop products. He plans to open a wholesale shop to increase his income. Small shops are very common and important in Tanzania because they provide the items that people demand on a daily basis. Peter M. is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000. ($750) to buy products for his new shop.

loans.use: Buy products for his new shop

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Хакназарова Фотима проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 47 лет , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Муж не работает. Обеспечивать семью ей приходится одной. Она занимается торговлей. Продает овощи и фрукты на дехканском рынке. Занимается бизнесом уже 14 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение  10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima H. lives in Tursunzade. She is 47 years old and is married with four children. She has a high school diploma. Her husband is unemployed and she is the family's only breadwinner. Fotima sells produce at a peasant market. She has been in this business for 14 years. Fotima is applying for a loan that would allow her to increase cash flow. She would repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is fifty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three females and three males. According to her, all of her children are out of school and living independently. The last born, a male is a professional teacher. She lives with her husband and her last-born in a family house in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai are in commercial activities.

Beatrice is a trader. She procures her goods from shops in her community at retail prices. She wants a bigger working capital so she can travel and buy directly from wholesalers at effective prices. Beatrice sells on a table top in front of her house to neighbors in her community. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure groceries  for re-sale

loans.name: Ifeanyenwa

texts.en:
Ifeanyenwa is 42 years old and married with six children. She produces and sells snakes. She lives in Delta State, Nigeria and has been in this business for a long time.

She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more snake materials for production and to sell. Ifeanyenwa is a LAPO client. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more snake materials for production and to sell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Mrs. Tita M. of Purok Bonifacio, Bacolod, Ozamiz City is a new member of PDP-LP Microfinance Program. She is 36 years of age, with five sons and one daughter. They have twins who are boys. Her husband is a carpenter. With the help and idea of her friend, she decided to engaged in the RTW buy and sell business in order to help her husband support their family. For the past year, her business has been growing with her neighbors and friends as her loyal customers. She is very happy being a member of PAGLAUM because of the services and insurance she enjoys. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000.00 to add to her capital for her RTW buy and sell business. She is hoping that someday she will own a house and a lot and be able to expand her business. She believes that KIVA and PAGLAUM are continually reaching those micro-entrepreneurs like her to improve the quality of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for her RTW buy & sell business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Victoria es viuda, tiene 41 años y 6 hijos, Victoria se dedica a la venta D. cereales, viaja semanalmente a la costa a la ciudad D. cañete y D. allá compra frutas que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa seca, cebada, haba.
Los sueños D. Victoria son ahorrar para comprar su casa y su hija ultima culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank “Villa Huatatas.” She is a widow, 41 years old, and has 6 children. Victoria sells cereals for a living. Every week she travels to the coast, to the city Cañete, where she buys fruits that she sells in the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. Victoria needs a loan of 1500 soles to invest in the purchase of dried potatoes, barely, and beans. Victoria dreams of saving so she can buy a house and help her youngest daughter finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa seca, cebada, haba.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 55 años, se caracteriza por su optimismo y su dedicación a su familia, con quienes vive en la casa que tanto sacrificio le costó obtener. Su gusto por la fotografía, pues siempre contaba con una cámara de fotos en todas las fiestas a donde la invitaban, se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos económicos, pues su pareja le dio la idea de dedicarse a la venta de fotografías para eventos especiales. Es así que hace 20 años prestar sus servicios como fotógrafa, y es muy reconocida, debido a su experiencia. Además, ahora está diseñando nuevas formas de marcos digitales para fotografías, lo cual es un adicional que ofrece para ganar mayores ingresos, y es un trabajo en equipo, ya que son sus hijos quienes elaboran estos diseños en la computadora. Para un futuro cercano, Victoria y su familia, tienen la ambición de abrir una tienda fotográfica donde brinden diversos servicios fotográficos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y este tiempo de permanencias le han servido para aprender cómo generar mayores ingresos, pero también para conocer a sus compañeras de grupo, con quienes mantiene una buena amistad, pues el banco comunal que conformaron las llevó a trabajar unánimemente. Con los 1000 soles que solicita adquirirá una video grabadora, pues sus clientes le están pidiendo no sólo fotografías, sino también videos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 55 years old and is characterized by her optimism and dedication to her family, with whom she lives in a house that she sacrificed a lot to obtain. She enjoys photography, as she always has a camera at all the parties that she is invited to. She has converted photography into a source of income, because her partner gave her the idea to sell photographs for special events. It is in this way that she has spent 20 years offering her photography services. She is very well-known because of her experience. Also, now she is designing new forms of digital frames for photographs, which are a supplement that she offers in order to earn more income. This is a team effort, since her children are the ones who produce these designs on the computer. For the near future, Victoria and her family want to open a photography store where they will offer diverse photography services. This is her sixth credit with MFP. In this time, she learned how to generate more income. She also got to know the members of her group, with whom she has a good friendship, since the community bank they belong to brings them to work together. With the 1000 soles that she requests, she will buy a camcorder, since her clients are asking not only for photographs, but also for videos.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camcorder

loans.name: Sovoen

texts.en: Mr. Sovoen S. is a villager in Praek Taten village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate vegetables. In his field, he wants to grow more plants to earn more income for his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy banana plants to grow in the field. His wife, Mrs. Kuy Heang Leng, owns a small business as a furniture seller. Mr. Sovoen S. is 52 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a grocer. Two other children are Chinese noodle sellers and the remaining one is attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy banana plants

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia N., 29, is married with three children. She has one year of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). She has one previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Leonia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very happy and appreciative of the good help she gets from the program.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and tools needed for making her BBQ business successful

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 24 years old. She is married and mother with one (boy) child and he has been breastfeed. She works very hard supporting her husband to earn enough for their family's upkeep. She works hard to provide for herself and her business. She has been preparing and baking bread for four years.  She is also a teacher and teaches in the primary level at a community school. She manages to combines her busy schedule to meet her deadlines. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet her needs. She requests a loan support to buy raw materials to remain in business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials such as bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Sout Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people livI. in Tuol Kdei village in Kandal province comprise this village bank group loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Sokha S. is a 46-year-old village bank group president. She is a grocer who owns a grocery store. Since her business is doI. well, she wants to expand it by purchasI. more grocery goods to resell to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Sarorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. The couple has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while three are attendI. the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Four members in this group loan are End-of-Term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-Term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase grocery store goods for resale

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es: María Lilian R. D. P. resiD. en Ilopango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. María vive con su hija y su nieta, mientras que su hija sale a trabajar fuera D. casa la abuelita María cuida D. su nieta Michell D. 2 años D. edad. María también trabaja desD. su casa ya que tiene montada una tienda con productos D. consumo para el hogar, el anhelo D. María es poder surtir su negocio con más variedad D. marcas y productos pero esto solo sera posible con la ayuda D. su crédito, que le permitirá a María surtir su negocio y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
María Lilian R. D. P. lives in the town of Ilopango in the district of San Salvador. She lives with her daughter and granddaughter.

When her daughter leaves for work, Grandma María takes care of her 2 year old granddaughter Michell. She also operates a store from home in which she sells basic consumer products. She wants to restock her store with a greater variety of products of different brands. This can only be maD. possible with the help of a loan. We hope that you will allow María the opportunity to fill her business so that she can improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: General merchandise and food sales.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: This is Luz H., a 41-year-old apartment landlady from Silang, Cavite. She lives with her two adult children. Luz has been managing her own apartment complex for the last eighteen years. She also sells purified drinking water in large containers. She earns at least P20,000 a month and her profits are used to sustain her children’s college education. Luz came across a staff of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 who explained to her the benefits she can gain from being a member. She became a member a month later. Luz is applying for a loan of P49,000 to undertake a few repairs on some of her apartment units. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To fund minor repairs in her apartment complex

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana D. C. is from the village of Hasaan Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old and is married. To make a living, Susana owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $62 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Susana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Susana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her store toward improving the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tsedevsuren

texts.en: Tsedevsuren B. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 3-year-old child in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a food technician for a private company. B. operates a transport service in his town. He uses a large van, or microbus, to transport people between his province and Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. B. started his transportation business in 2004 after purchasing his microbus.  He has found success with his business and has gained much experience as a driver over the years. His working capital has increased from 800,000 tugrugs when he started to a level exceeding 2,500,000 today. B. is a very honest and hardworking person and is known by his customers for his good character. In the future, he hopes to continue to provide a quality and efficient transportation service, but his dream is to open a small bakery shop in his town. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase new parts for his microbus.

loans.use: To purchase new parts for his microbus

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mr. Yeng N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Sin Art, is a garment factory worker. Mr. Yeng N. has two children: one is working and the other is attending the local school. They live in Pris Leu village in Takeo province. 
Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Yeng N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to improve their living conditions after he sells the cow. 
His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Leoum

texts.en:
Leoum M., 51, is married with five children. Three of his children are enrolled at a local high school. He resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, with his wife and children. To make a living, he operates his motorbike as a taxi at the local markets in the town, earning an income of $5 per day. The family is also assisted by two of his children, who are employed as construction builders, earning an income of $3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Mr. M. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, M. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase rice from the local farmers in the province to store and sell back when the price is good enough to make a profit.

loans.use: Buy rice in stock for resale

loans.name: Kiko

texts.en:
Kiko M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use.

Kiko is 35 years old and is married; her husband is a taxi driver. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy materials for making alcohol

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano Antonio Muñoz, en su casa del barrio Villa del Carmen de Soledad-Atlántico, inicia el día moliendo carne bien sazonada y con la cual rellena una tripa natural prealistada, sometida a altas temperaturas, que amarra con un hilo de pita, para darle su singular forma de cadeneta; es así como la prepara para la cocción y apertura de orificos, a fin de que posteriormente se recoja y quede lista para degustarla.  De esta manera Antonio, elabora un embutido artesanal, llamado “Butifarra” típico de Soledad –Atlántico, donde la proliferación de estas unidades artesanales ha ido disminuyendo, pues actualmente  ha sido copiado y forma parte de la línea de producto de grandes empresas carnicas que son su máxima competencia; aunque como lo expresa Antonio, a esas industrias no le queda este producto con el exquisito sabor costeño y por eso su clientela sabe lo que come, lo prefieren y lo buscan en el municipio de Soledad, el cual se ha hecho famoso por este producto inspirador de típicas y hermosas canciones compuestas por artistas de nuestra Región Atlanticense e incluidas en álbumes  “Joyas de la Música Colombiana”.
